title_src: Mystery of British woman Sarm Heslop who disappeared from a luxury Caribbean yacht
text_src: Mystery of British woman who disappeared from a luxury Caribbean yacht 9 hours ago Share Save Tir Dhondy BBC News Share Save CCTV shows last recorded moments of woman missing from Caribbean yacht The couple, holding hands, walk down a wooden dock by the water's edge, after spending an evening in a bar on the island of St John in the US Virgin Islands. They are seen boarding a dinghy and motoring away into the darkness of the Caribbean Sea, headed for their luxury yacht, anchored in the next bay. This CCTV footage - never made public before and released exclusively now to the BBC - contains the last-recorded sighting of British woman Sarm Heslop in 2021. Some six hours later, she would be reported missing, feared lost at sea. Ryan Bane, her boyfriend at the time, maintains she most likely fell overboard, or drowned while swimming, while he was sleeping. He has never been formally questioned by the police. Despite a massive search operation, Sarm's body has never been found and her disappearance remains a mystery. To try to establish the truth, I spent a month in the US Virgin Islands investigating the case for a BBC Three documentary - speaking to the police who led the investigation, the coastguard and possible witnesses. Family handout Sarm's friends say she was "always up for a new challenge" Described by her friends as a "free spirit", former flight attendant Sarm, originally from Southampton, left the UK in 2019 to sail across the Atlantic with friends on a small boat. "She was always up for a new challenge. Totally run-of-the-mill for Sarm to just be doing something bonkers," one of her friends Zan tells me. Accompanied by friend Kate and Kate's boyfriend, Sarm headed for the Caribbean - visiting St Lucia, Guadeloupe, Dominica and Martinique. Seven months into the trip, Sarm met Ryan Bane, 49, an American boat captain who chartered his £500,000 catamaran - Siren Song - to wealthy tourists. They dated, Sarm stayed on Mr Bane's yacht, and - after three months - the relationship turned serious. Sarm then decided to work as a chef on the yacht and, on 7 March, 2021, completed her first charter. That night, she disappeared, leaving behind her passport, phone and money. She was 41. Facebook Mr Bane has never spoken publicly about the case While Sarm's friends and family have tried to keep her story in the media spotlight, and enlisted an investigator to help, her mum Brenda says she accepts her daughter is dead. But the hope they will establish what happened, she says, is what keeps them going. "We still haven't been able to grieve properly. We all deserve to know what happened to her and to bring her home. It's just so, so unfair," says Brenda. One key piece of evidence I wanted to see was CCTV showing the last recorded sighting of Sarm, which had never been made public by police. So, when the islands' chief of police, Steven Phillip, handed it to me, I was surprised. "We're at a dead end," he admitted. "If anybody could look at this video and see something and say something it can help. That's why now." Sarm's mum had previously watched a small section of the footage, but Sarm's friends had not seen any of it. They hoped they might spot something in the way the couple interacted with each other that night, which would provide answers. But when I showed the footage to them - crowded round a kitchen table - they admitted that beyond confirming that she did get on board the dinghy, the CCTV didn't tell them much - and it could be interpreted in a variety of ways. Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm will be on iPlayer from 0600 on Wednesday 17 September, and on BBC Two that evening at 22:00 But I did notice an inconsistency with the timestamp on the CCTV. In reports released by the US Coast Guard, Mr Bane stated the couple had returned to the yacht at 22:00 local time. But the timestamp - which police say they have confirmed is correct - shows them motoring away from the Cruz Bay dinghy dock at 20:45 local time. Having also travelled this route, I know it should take five to 10 minutes in a dinghy to get to the next bay, so they would have got back by 21:00. This means there is a missing hour that Mr Bane has never accounted for. "The timeline is suspicious, and that's one of the reasons why we need to talk to Ryan," says US Virgin Islands' police commissioner, Mario Brooks. But Mr Bane's lawyer, David Cattie, told us this characterisation of the timeline was "irresponsible". Commissioner Brooks told us Mr Bane remained the only person of interest in the case. "There was… nothing of evidentiary value that points to Sarm having contact with anyone that night, outside of Ryan," he said. Lawyer David Cattie says there is no evidence Mr Bane "had a hand" in Sarm's disappearance While Mr Bane has never spoken publicly about the case, his lawyer agreed to be interviewed on his client's behalf, for the first time. Asked what happened when Sarm disappeared, David Cattie said Mr Bane believed Sarm perhaps hit her head and fell overboard, or had become disorientated while swimming, lost her way and drowned. The timeline inconsistency that evening reflected nothing other than a possible error in estimating the time while under the stress of trying to locate Mr Bane's missing girlfriend, he added. Mr Bane said he discovered Sarm was missing at 02:00 local time. His subsequent actions have been questioned by all the boat captains and experts I have spoken to. There were two other boats anchored in Frank's Bay at the time. I contacted the captains from both, who confirmed Mr Bane did not alert them to a problem either that night, or the following morning. They also told me that captains are trained to shout a missing person's name, call a mayday, immediately call the coastguard and alert neighbouring boats. Mr Cattie acknowledges Mr Bane didn't do everything "you would say a boat captain is absolutely supposed to do". "But we're not here because you're saying, 'well, Ryan didn't follow all the boat protocol'. You're here because people are suggesting he had a hand in her disappearance. There's no evidence of that, at all." 'Minutes count' I obtained a police timeline and US Coast Guard reports that cover the hours after Sarm was reported missing. Mr Bane said he had woken up when he heard the anchor alarm - which rings if the boat is straying from its mooring - and realised that Sarm was no longer on the yacht. At 02:44 local time - having called them 10 minutes before - Mr Bane gave a brief statement to police when he arrived ashore on his dinghy. From this point onwards though, Mr Bane's account differs from that of the police. His lawyer tells me police had left Mr Bane with the impression that they would contact the coastguard. However, police statements describe how officers had, instead, told Mr Bane to call the coastguard. It was nine hours after having initially reported Sarm missing to police when Mr Bane did eventually call the coastguard - at 11:46 local time. "Ultimately it's always the captain's responsibility [when a person is missing]," says Cdr Jan League from the US Coast Guard. "Minutes count at that point. So waiting nine hours is decreasing the possibility of finding a person in the water." Family handout Sarm's disappearance is still classified as a missing person's case The US Coast Guard search began 11 hours after Sarm was reported missing to police. Boats and a helicopter combed the water and coastline around where Siren Song was anchored. It is very rare for somebody to fall overboard and for their body to never be found, Cdr League tells me. "In the three years I have been here, we've had people go overboard, but we've never had the body go missing," he says. Mr Bane has used his rights under the Fourth Amendment of the US Constitution - which prohibits unreasonable government searches and seizures - to block a forensics team from searching his yacht. The only search that did take place was an initial safety sweep by the coastguard. Mr Bane has also used the Fifth Amendment - the right to not give evidence that may self-incriminate - to decline questioning by police. Mr Cattie said he had advised Mr Bane to invoke his rights. "One thing you learn with being a lawyer is that there are tonnes of people who had nothing to hide, who had done nothing wrong," he said. "That… just want to do all this cooperation, that wind up in jail for something they didn't do." Five weeks later after reporting Sarm missing, Mr Bane left the US Virgin Islands. He has never returned. He later tried to sell the yacht. 'Scariest thing' To find out more about what Ryan Bane was like, I tracked down his ex-wife, Cori Stevenson. They married in 2008, then in 2011 he attacked her after they attended a wedding. He knocked her to the ground, she says, "grabbed my hair and he smashed it [my head] in the floor", breaking her front teeth. "He choked me and I passed out," she adds. "When he was in that weird rage… his eyes would go completely black," she says. "That was probably the scariest thing. So I was like, 'I'm going to die today'." Ryan Bane was given a 60-day sentence for domestic violence simple assault. The couple divorced in 2014. Mr Cattie acknowledges Mr Bane was convicted in that single case - but he adds: "There's absolutely no indication that he ever had a violent altercation with Sarm." Family handout Sarm's mum says she was "the love of my life"
summary_src:
A new BBC documentary has exclusively released previously unseen CCTV footage showing the last recorded moments of British woman Sarm Heslop, who vanished from a luxury yacht in the US Virgin Islands in March 2021. Her disappearance remains a mystery, and her boyfriend at the time, Ryan Bane, is the sole person of interest in a case where her body has never been found.

Heslop, a 41-year-old "free spirit" from Southampton, met American boat captain Ryan Bane in 2019 and became a chef on his catamaran. On March 7, 2021, after her first charter, CCTV shows Heslop and Bane boarding a dinghy at Cruz Bay dock at 20:45, heading towards their yacht anchored in the next bay.

Six hours later, around 02:00, Bane reported Heslop missing, claiming she likely fell overboard or drowned while swimming, while he was sleeping. However, the confirmed CCTV timestamp contradicts Bane's statement that they returned to the yacht at 22:00, creating a "missing hour" that Bane has not accounted for, which the US Virgin Islands police commissioner calls "suspicious."

Investigators also question Bane's actions following the disappearance. Despite being the captain, he waited nine hours until 11:46 to call the US Coast Guard after initially reporting Heslop missing to police at 02:44. Coast Guard officials emphasize that "minutes count" in such situations, and Bane's delay significantly reduced the chances of finding her. Bane's lawyer acknowledges he didn't follow all protocols but denies his client had any hand in Heslop's disappearance, citing a lack of evidence.

Bane, who has a 2011 domestic violence conviction for assaulting his ex-wife, invoked his Fourth and Fifth Amendment rights, blocking a forensic search of his yacht and declining questioning by police. Five weeks after Heslop's disappearance, Bane left the US Virgin Islands and later unsuccessfully attempted to sell the yacht.

Despite a massive search, Heslop's body has never been found, a rare occurrence for someone falling overboard. Police chief Steven Phillip, admitting they are "at a dead end," released the CCTV footage to the BBC, hoping the public might spot something to help solve the case. Heslop's family, including her mother Brenda, accept she is dead but desperately seek answers to properly grieve. The BBC Three documentary "Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm" aims to shed light on the unsolved mystery.
summary_tgt:
यहाँ उस अंग्रेजी समाचार सारांश का हिंदी अनुवाद है:

**अमेरिकी वर्जिन द्वीप समूह से ब्रिटिश महिला के लापता होने का मामला: नए सीसीटीवी फुटेज में आखिरी पल सामने आए**

एक नई बीबीसी डॉक्यूमेंट्री ने विशेष रूप से पहले कभी न देखे गए सीसीटीवी फुटेज जारी किए हैं, जिसमें ब्रिटिश महिला सार्म हेसलॉप के अंतिम रिकॉर्ड किए गए पल दिखाई दे रहे हैं, जो मार्च 2021 में अमेरिकी वर्जिन द्वीप समूह में एक लग्जरी नौका से गायब हो गई थीं। उनका गायब होना एक रहस्य बना हुआ है, और उस समय के उनके बॉयफ्रेंड रयान बेन इस मामले में एकमात्र संदिग्ध व्यक्ति हैं, जिसमें उनका शव कभी नहीं मिला है।

साउथम्पटन की 41 वर्षीय 'आज़ाद ख्याल' सार्म हेसलॉप 2019 में अमेरिकी नाव कप्तान रयान बेन से मिलीं और उनकी कैटामरान पर शेफ बन गईं। 7 मार्च, 2021 को, अपनी पहली चार्टर यात्रा के बाद, सीसीटीवी फुटेज में हेसलॉप और बेन को रात 8:45 बजे (20:45) क्रूज़ बे डॉक पर एक डिंघी पर सवार होते हुए दिखाया गया है, जो अगली खाड़ी में लंगर डाले हुए उनकी नौका की ओर जा रहे थे।

छह घंटे बाद, लगभग 2:00 बजे, बेन ने हेसलॉप के लापता होने की सूचना दी, यह दावा करते हुए कि जब वह सो रहा था, तब वह शायद नाव से गिर गईं या तैरते समय डूब गईं। हालांकि, पुष्टि किया गया सीसीटीवी टाइमस्टैम्प बेन के इस बयान का खंडन करता है कि वे रात 10:00 बजे (22:00) नौका पर लौट आए थे, जिससे एक "लापता घंटा" पैदा हो गया है जिसका बेन ने कोई हिसाब नहीं दिया है, जिसे अमेरिकी वर्जिन द्वीप समूह के पुलिस आयुक्त "संदिग्ध" बताते हैं।

जांचकर्ता लापता होने के बाद बेन की कार्रवाइयों पर भी सवाल उठाते हैं। कप्तान होने के बावजूद, उन्होंने सुबह 2:44 बजे पुलिस को हेसलॉप के लापता होने की शुरुआती रिपोर्ट करने के बाद, अमेरिकी तटरक्षक बल को फोन करने के लिए सुबह 11:46 बजे तक नौ घंटे इंतजार किया। तटरक्षक बल के अधिकारियों ने जोर दिया कि ऐसी स्थितियों में "एक-एक मिनट मायने रखता है", और बेन की देरी ने उन्हें ढूंढने की संभावनाओं को काफी कम कर दिया। बेन के वकील ने स्वीकार किया कि उन्होंने सभी प्रोटोकॉल का पालन नहीं किया, लेकिन इस बात से इनकार करते हैं कि उनके मुवक्किल का हेसलॉप के गायब होने में कोई हाथ था, जिसका कारण सबूतों की कमी बताया।

बेन, जिस पर 2011 में अपनी पूर्व पत्नी पर हमला करने के लिए घरेलू हिंसा का आरोप सिद्ध हुआ था, ने अपने चौथे और पांचवें संशोधन अधिकारों का आह्वान किया, जिससे उसकी नौका की फोरेंसिक जांच रुक गई और उसने पुलिस द्वारा पूछताछ से इनकार कर दिया। हेसलॉप के गायब होने के पांच हफ्ते बाद, बेन ने अमेरिकी वर्जिन द्वीप समूह छोड़ दिया और बाद में नौका को बेचने का असफल प्रयास किया।

बड़े पैमाने पर तलाशी के बावजूद, हेसलॉप का शव कभी नहीं मिला है, जो नाव से गिरने वाले किसी व्यक्ति के लिए एक दुर्लभ घटना है। पुलिस प्रमुख स्टीवन फिलिप ने यह स्वीकार करते हुए कि वे "एक गतिरोध पर हैं", सीसीटीवी फुटेज बीबीसी को जारी किए, यह उम्मीद करते हुए कि जनता कुछ ऐसा देख सकती है जिससे मामले को सुलझाने में मदद मिले। हेसलॉप का परिवार, उनकी मां ब्रेंडा सहित, स्वीकार करता है कि वह मर चुकी हैं, लेकिन ठीक से शोक मनाने के लिए जवाबों की बेसब्री से तलाश कर रहे हैं। बीबीसी थ्री डॉक्यूमेंट्री "मिसिंग इन पैराडाइज: सर्चिंग फॉर सार्म" का उद्देश्य इस अनसुलझे रहस्य पर प्रकाश डालना है।
meta_description: CCTV footage from 2021, released exclusively to the BBC, contains the last-recorded sighting of Sarm Heslop.

title_src: Shooting throws Utah students into heart of US political divide
text_src: Shooting throws Utah students into heart of US political divide 9 hours ago Share Save Christal Hayes BBC News, reporting from Utah Share Save BBC / Christal Hayes The campus has become a place to both mourn and protest over the days since Kirk's death Scott Sperry jotted his name down on a sign-up sheet. The 22-year-old student at Utah Valley University had watched Charlie Kirk's videos for years and credits the conservative firebrand with being a catalyst in his own political involvement. Now, on this Thursday afternoon, moments before his political hero was about to speak on campus, Mr Sperry thought it was time for him to pay it forward by joining its chapter of Turning Point USA - the organisation Kirk co-founded in 2012 to advocate for conservatism on college campuses. Moments after taking his front-row seat to see Kirk speak, Mr Sperry watched in shock as a sniper bullet rang out and blood started pouring from Kirk's neck. The images, he said, he still can't shake, but he thinks the loss will only strengthen the movement Kirk inspired him to join. "When you try to silence a voice like this, they don't go away - you only amplify it," the second-year student said. "There are now going to be a million Charlie Kirks, and I feel like that's the thing that we need to do." As the immediate shock of the attack calms, some at Utah Valley University said it has been replaced with a deep sense of resolve to continue what Kirk began. Students with various political ideologies - including those vehemently opposed to Kirk's beliefs - told the BBC they've felt a personal sense of responsibility to ensure healthy debates on college campuses continue. BBC / Christal Hayes Scott Sperry choked up several times describing the moments he witnessed Kirk's death The killing has thrown Utah Valley University into the centre of America's political divide. Soon after Kirk was shot, some who disagreed with him took to social media to blame Kirk, who has openly supported gun ownership. On the right, pundits and politicians said that conservatives were under attack by the "radical left". The spotlight has made some students feel the need to step into the ideological fray. "This is the first political thing we've ever done. We're not political like this," first-year student McKinley Shinkle said, while waving signs with his cousin on campus that called Kirk a hero and said they aren't afraid. "This happening on our campus and then seeing people who are supporting the shooting - it just kind of radicalised us," he added, nothing they're both planning to continue political involvement. "It's changed everything." Young fans and critics debate Charlie Kirk's political legacy Who is Charlie Kirk shooting suspect Tyler Robinson? Nestled in a valley surrounded by towering mountains, Utah Valley is the biggest university in the state. It sits on a hill, overlooking a crisp blue lake and a 218-feet-tall granite temple for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. The state, which is also a conservative stronghold, has the largest concentration of Mormons in the US and religion plays a leading role in this community. Many have expressed confusion about why Kirk was targeted here. Ben Forster, a second-year student, noted how Kirk often stopped in much more liberal-leaning areas where he could have been more of a target. "This is now where his martyrdom was established," he said, reflecting on his university. "I mean, that is what martyrdom is: He was killed at a debate." Despite not agreeing with Kirk's stances, Mr Forster attended Wednesday's event in Utah to watch the spectacle and hear the varying viewpoints - something he hopes will not cease at his university and others after the attack. "I don't care about what his opinions were," he said. "He was exercising his right in a public forum to talk and discuss - and that is a good thing." The signs of what happened here are everywhere you look near campus. Law enforcement blocking entrances, makeshift memorials with candles and flowers, signs in apartment windows and on roads declaring Kirk a hero after he was gunned down in front of thousands during one of his signature college campus debates. From teenage activist to the heart of the president's inner circle How 33-hour manhunt ended with suspect in custody Some students told the BBC they've been leaning on one another in the aftermath - with some discussing what happens next. It's clear part of that future will include a political awakening for some on campus. Several students made defiant posters, hanging them in their apartment windows with messages reading, "freedom" and "you can't kill the truth". A campaign-style merch display near campus is selling Trump hats and flags. All day and all night, people drive through the traffic circle entrance to campus, beeping their horns - either supporting or in opposition to Kirk. BBC / Christal Hayes McKinley Shinkle (left) said the deadly shooting had "changed everything"
summary_src:
A shooting at Utah Valley University (UVU) during an appearance by conservative firebrand Charlie Kirk, founder of Turning Point USA, has plunged the campus into America's political divide. Student Scott Sperry, a long-time admirer of Kirk, witnessed the fatal shooting, describing it as a shocking event that he believes will only strengthen the movement Kirk inspired.

The incident has sparked a deep sense of resolve among UVU students, including those who vehemently oppose Kirk's beliefs, to ensure healthy campus debates continue. Social media erupted with accusations, with some blaming Kirk and others on both the political left and right decrying attacks from the "radical left." This intense scrutiny has prompted many previously apolitical students, like McKinley Shinkle, to become politically active, with Shinkle stating the event "kind of radicalised us" and "changed everything."

The targeting of Kirk in conservative Utah, a state with a large Mormon population, has caused confusion, as he often spoke in more liberal-leaning areas. Student Ben Forster, while disagreeing with Kirk's stances, defended his right to free speech and described the shooting as establishing Kirk's "martyrdom."

In the aftermath, the campus is marked by law enforcement presence, makeshift memorials, and defiant student posters proclaiming "freedom" and "you can't kill the truth." The tragedy has ignited a palpable political awakening among students, signaling a profound and lasting shift in the university's environment.
summary_tgt:
यूटा वैली यूनिवर्सिटी (यूवीयू) में टर्निंग पॉइंट यूएसए के संस्थापक, रूढ़िवादी प्रखर वक्ता चार्ली किर्क की मौजूदगी के दौरान हुई गोलीबारी ने कैंपस को अमेरिका की गहरी राजनीतिक दरार में उलझा दिया है। किर्क के पुराने समर्थक छात्र स्कॉट स्पेरी ने इस घातक गोलीबारी को अपनी आँखों से देखा, और इसे एक चौंकाने वाली घटना बताया। उनका मानना है कि यह घटना किर्क द्वारा प्रेरित आंदोलन को और मजबूत ही करेगी।

इस घटना ने यूवीयू के छात्रों में, यहाँ तक कि किर्क के विचारों के कट्टर विरोधियों में भी, कैंपस में स्वस्थ बहस जारी रखने का एक गहरा दृढ़ संकल्प पैदा किया है। सोशल मीडिया पर आरोपों की बाढ़ आ गई, कुछ ने किर्क को दोषी ठहराया, जबकि राजनीतिक वाम और दक्षिणपंथी दोनों ओर के अन्य लोगों ने "कट्टर वामपंथियों" के हमलों की निंदा की। इस गहन जाँच और प्रतिक्रिया ने मैकिनले शिंकल जैसे कई पहले के गैर-राजनीतिक छात्रों को राजनीतिक रूप से सक्रिय होने के लिए प्रेरित किया है। शिंकल ने कहा कि इस घटना ने "हमें एक तरह से कट्टरपंथी बना दिया है" और "सब कुछ बदल दिया है।"

रूढ़िवादी यूटा, जो एक बड़ी मॉर्मन आबादी वाला राज्य है, में किर्क को निशाना बनाने से भ्रम पैदा हो गया है, क्योंकि वह अक्सर अधिक उदारवादी झुकाव वाले क्षेत्रों में बोलते थे। छात्र बेन फोर्स्टर ने, किर्क के विचारों से असहमत होते हुए भी, उनके अभिव्यक्ति की स्वतंत्रता के अधिकार का बचाव किया और इस गोलीबारी को किर्क की "शहादत" स्थापित करने वाला बताया।

इस घटना के बाद, कैंपस में पुलिस की मौजूदगी, अस्थायी स्मारक और छात्रों के विद्रोही पोस्टर नज़र आते हैं, जो "स्वतंत्रता" और "आप सच को मार नहीं सकते" का उद्घोष कर रहे हैं। इस त्रासदी ने छात्रों के बीच एक स्पष्ट राजनीतिक जागृति जगाई है, जो विश्वविद्यालय के माहौल में एक गहरे और स्थायी बदलाव का संकेत देती है।
meta_description: They tell BBC they feel a personal sense of responsibility to ensure healthy debates on campus continue.

title_src: In depth and expert analysis from BBC News
text_src: Empty homes are on the rise. So why aren't they being used to solve the housing shortage? There are almost 720,000 empty homes in England. And many more on social housing waiting lists - so why aren't we better using one to help solve the other, and is it a case of a missed opportunity?
summary_src:
Empty homes are significantly on the rise in countries like the U.S. and England, despite widespread housing shortages and long social housing waiting lists. The U.S. has seen a more than 10% increase in vacant properties over the past five years, while England alone accounts for nearly 720,000 unused homes, a figure projected to grow.

This paradox is further underscored by housing crises in nations like Australia, and England's additional challenge of nearly 1.2 million unfilled construction jobs. The situation prompts critical questions about why these readily available properties are not being utilized to alleviate housing pressures, representing a major missed opportunity.

अमेरिका और इंग्लैंड जैसे देशों में खाली पड़े मकानों की संख्या में उल्लेखनीय वृद्धि हो रही है, जबकि इन देशों में घरों की भारी कमी है और सामाजिक आवास के लिए लंबी प्रतीक्षा सूचियां हैं। पिछले पांच सालों में अमेरिका में खाली पड़े मकानों में 10% से अधिक की वृद्धि देखी गई है, जबकि अकेले इंग्लैंड में लगभग 7.2 लाख अप्रयुक्त घर हैं, और यह आंकड़ा बढ़ने का अनुमान है।

यह विरोधाभास ऑस्ट्रेलिया जैसे देशों में आवासीय संकटों से और भी स्पष्ट होता है, और इंग्लैंड में निर्माण क्षेत्र में लगभग 12 लाख रिक्त पदों की अतिरिक्त चुनौती भी है। यह स्थिति गंभीर सवाल उठाती है कि इन आसानी से उपलब्ध मकानों का उपयोग आवासीय दबावों को कम करने के लिए क्यों नहीं किया जा रहा है, जो एक बड़ा गंवाया हुआ अवसर है।

title_src: Rugby Championship: New Zealand 10-43 South Africa, Australia 26-28 Argentina
text_src: "I give credit to my boys - we didn't give up. And to the coach (Rassie Erasmus) as well," said South Africa captain Siya Kolisi. "We played fearlessly. We didn't want to hold back. We knew what we needed to do and we believed in ourselves - that was the most important thing out there." South Africa made a strong start at the Wellington Regional Stadium but were denied a try following a brilliant Jordie Barrett tackle on Cheslin Kolbe. RG Snyman did go over for South Africa, only to have the effort ruled out. New Zealand responded through debutant Leroy Carter, who scored after a well-worked move. South Africa drew level when Kolbe intercepted a pass in his own half before sprinting clear. A Damian McKenzie penalty restored New Zealand's lead but, from there on, it was all South Africa. Kolbe scored his second try early in second half before Manie Libbok's penalty. Damian Willemse powered over the line to extend the Springboks' lead following a poor New Zealand line-out, and Kwagga Smith, Snyman and Andre Esterhuizen added further tries. "That's a tough one to swallow," said New Zealand captain Scott Barrett. "The Springboks certainly showed up and took a real improvement from last week, and we just didn't adjust. There's a lot of areas where we can get better." In the remaining two rounds South Africa play Argentina and New Zealand take on Australia. "We've got the right to fight for the Rugby Championship," said Kolisi. "It's open now and that's what matters to us."
summary_src:
South Africa delivered a commanding performance to defeat New Zealand in a Rugby Championship fixture at Wellington Regional Stadium. Springboks captain Siya Kolisi praised his team's "fearless" approach, crediting coach Rassie Erasmus and highlighting their self-belief and determination not to "hold back."

Despite a strong start from South Africa, they were initially denied tries through a brilliant Jordie Barrett tackle on Cheslin Kolbe and a disallowed effort from RG Snyman. New Zealand then took an early lead through debutant Leroy Carter.

However, South Africa quickly responded, with Kolbe intercepting a pass to score and draw level. Although a Damian McKenzie penalty briefly restored New Zealand's advantage, the Springboks dominated from that point onwards. Kolbe secured his second try early in the second half, followed by a penalty from Manie Libbok. Damian Willemse, Kwagga Smith, Snyman, and Andre Esterhuizen all added further tries, showcasing South Africa's overwhelming control.

All Blacks captain Scott Barrett described the loss as "a tough one to swallow," while coach Stuart Lancaster admitted New Zealand "didn't adjust" to South Africa's significant improvement from the previous week, acknowledging "a lot of areas where we can get better."

With the Rugby Championship now "open," Kolisi expressed his team's resolve to "fight for" the title. In the remaining two rounds, South Africa will face Argentina, while New Zealand takes on Australia.
summary_tgt:
दक्षिण अफ्रीका ने वेलिंगटन रीजनल स्टेडियम में रग्बी चैंपियनशिप के एक मुकाबले में न्यूजीलैंड को हराकर एक प्रभावशाली जीत दर्ज की। स्प्रिंगबोक्स के कप्तान सिया कोलिसी ने अपनी टीम के "निर्भीक" (निडर) रवैये की सराहना की। उन्होंने कोच रासी इरास्मस को इसका श्रेय दिया और उनके आत्मविश्वास व "पीछे न हटने" के दृढ़ संकल्प पर प्रकाश डाला।

दक्षिण अफ्रीका की मजबूत शुरुआत के बावजूद, चेसलिन कोल्बे पर जॉर्डी बैरेट के शानदार टैकल और आरजी स्नेमन के अस्वीकृत प्रयास के कारण उन्हें शुरुआती ट्राइ से वंचित रहना पड़ा। इसके बाद न्यूजीलैंड ने पदार्पण करने वाले लेरॉय कार्टर के दम पर शुरुआती बढ़त बना ली।

हालांकि, दक्षिण अफ्रीका ने तुरंत पलटवार किया, जब कोल्बे ने एक पास को इंटरसेप्ट करते हुए स्कोर किया और मैच को बराबर ला खड़ा किया। डेमियन मैकेंजी के पेनल्टी से न्यूजीलैंड ने अपनी बढ़त थोड़े समय के लिए फिर से हासिल कर ली, लेकिन इसके बाद स्प्रिंगबोक्स का दबदबा कायम रहा। कोल्बे ने दूसरे हाफ की शुरुआत में अपना दूसरा ट्राई हासिल किया, जिसके बाद मैनी लिबॉक ने एक पेनल्टी स्कोर की। डेमियन विलेमसे, क्वाग्गा स्मिथ, स्नेमन और आंद्रे एस्टरहुइज़ेन ने भी और ट्राइ स्कोर किए, जिसने दक्षिण अफ्रीका के पूर्ण नियंत्रण को दर्शाया।

ऑल ब्लैक्स के कप्तान स्कॉट बैरेट ने इस हार को "पचा पाना मुश्किल" बताया, जबकि कोच स्टुअर्ट लैंकेस्टर ने स्वीकार किया कि न्यूजीलैंड ने पिछले हफ्ते से दक्षिण अफ्रीका के उल्लेखनीय सुधार के अनुरूप "खुद को नहीं ढाला"। उन्होंने यह भी माना कि "अभी कई ऐसे क्षेत्र हैं जहाँ हम बेहतर प्रदर्शन कर सकते हैं।"

रग्बी चैंपियनशिप के अब "खुला" होने के साथ (यानी मुकाबला रोमांचक होने के साथ), कोलिसी ने अपनी टीम के खिताब के लिए "लड़ने" के दृढ़ संकल्प को व्यक्त किया। शेष दो राउंड में, दक्षिण अफ्रीका का मुकाबला अर्जेंटीना से होगा, जबकि न्यूजीलैंड ऑस्ट्रेलिया से भिड़ेगा।
meta_description: New Zealand suffer their biggest defeat in history as they lose 43-10 to South Africa in the Rugby Championship in Wellington.

title_src: New Zealand 46-17 South Africa: World champions progress to Women's Rugby World Cup semi-finals
text_src: World champions New Zealand recovered from a slow start to defeat a spirited South Africa side and seal their spot in the Women's Rugby World Cup semi-finals. The Springbok Women, appearing in their first quarter-final in the competition, opened the scoring in Exeter through prop Babalwa Latsha. The Black Ferns responded through centre Theresa Setefano and teenage wing Braxton Sorensen-McGee, but Aphiwe Ngwevu's try levelled the game at half-time to cap a remarkable first-half performance by South Africa. However, Allan Bunting's side clicked into gear to score five second-half tries to set up a semi-final against either Canada or Australia, who play later on Saturday, on Friday in Bristol. Full-back Renee Holmes scored twice, with Sorensen-McGee, the tournament's top try-scorer, and number eight Kaipo Olsen-Baker also grabbing two scores. South Africa managed to finally cross late in the second half through Lerato Makua to finish off a memorable World Cup campaign on a high. Replacement Katelyn Vahaakolo was the final try-scorer of an entertaining game at Sandy Park.
summary_src:
New Zealand defeated a spirited South Africa to secure their place in the Women's Rugby World Cup semi-finals. The defending champions overcame a slow start, which saw the Springbok Women open the scoring through Babalwa Latsha and draw level at half-time with a try from Aphiwe Ngwevu.

However, New Zealand clicked into gear in the second half, scoring five tries—including two from full-back Renee Holmes and another from tournament top try-scorer Braxton Sorensen-McGee—to dominate the remainder of the game. South Africa, who were appearing in their first-ever World Cup quarter-final, managed a late consolation try from Lerato Makua, concluding a memorable campaign. New Zealand will now face either Canada or Australia in the semi-finals.

महिला रग्बी विश्व कप के सेमीफाइनल में अपनी जगह पक्की करने के लिए न्यूज़ीलैंड ने जुझारू दक्षिण अफ्रीका को हरा दिया।

गत चैंपियन न्यूज़ीलैंड की शुरुआत धीमी रही। स्प्रिंगबॉक महिला टीम ने बाबल्वा लात्शा के ज़रिए शुरुआती स्कोर किया और अपिव न्गवेवु के एक ट्राई से हाफ-टाइम तक बराबरी कर ली थी।

हालांकि, दूसरे हाफ में न्यूज़ीलैंड लय में आ गई और उसने पांच ट्राई किए — जिसमें फुल-बैक रेनी होम्स के दो और टूर्नामेंट की शीर्ष ट्राई-स्कोरर ब्रैकस्टन सोरेनसेन-मैकगी का एक ट्राई शामिल था — और बाकी के खेल पर पूरी तरह हावी रही।

दक्षिण अफ्रीका, जो अपने पहले विश्व कप क्वार्टर फाइनल में खेल रही थी, ने अंतिम समय में लेराटो माकुआ के एक सांत्वना ट्राई से अपने यादगार अभियान का समापन किया।

न्यूज़ीलैंड अब सेमीफाइनल में कनाडा या ऑस्ट्रेलिया में से किसी एक से भिड़ेगी।
meta_description: Defending champions New Zealand overcome a slow start and a spirited South Africa side to seal their spot in the Women's Rugby World Cup semi-finals.

author: ['Mike Henson']
title_src: Helena Rowland: England's stand-in superstar replacing Ellie Kildunne
text_src: With Ellie Kildunne, the reigning world player of the year, ruled out of Sunday's quarter-final against Scotland, it is Rowland that Mitchell has turned to to fill in at full-back. This is the curse of the skills Rowlands is blessed with. A skilful, clever runner with an innate understanding of space and deft hands, she can apply herself to any position across the backline. She has played for England in every position from 10 to 15, and has even been pencilled in as a fourth-choice scrum-half in case of emergencies. That versatility makes her an ideal bench option, a superb stand-in wherever needed in the backline. Once Kildunne suffered a concussion in the win over Australia - her head whiplashing back on to the turf in a tackle by Samantha Wood - Rowland was always in pole position to step up. While Gloucester-Hartpury's Emma Sing is a specialist full-back, she is only 12 caps into her Test career and yet to show the same consistency and composure as Rowland. Both played in the win over Samoa in the second round of pool matches, with Sing at full-back and Rowland at fly-half. But it was Rowland who caught the eye, scoring 27 points - a Women's Rugby World Cup record for a player in a single match - landing 11 out of 14 conversions and crossing for a try. That score was characteristically smart, slamming on the brakes and stepping out into the blind-side to cross as Samoa were retreating. But her accuracy off the tee will have been reassuring for Mitchell, who has Holly Aitchinson in ahead of regular kicker Zoe Harrison at fly-half for the meeting with Scotland and Sing, England's best place kicker, on the bench. The loss of Kildunne undoubtedly robs England of star power, but it might not weaken them significantly on the pitch. Kildunne's backfield positioning was exposed by Australia last weekend, with the Wallaroos landing several 50-22 kicks, while the England backline has yet to hit its stride in attack. Rowland enjoyed an enterprising 35-minute cameo after replacing Kildunne, creating space and making breaks with teasing running lines out wide.
summary_src:
England's Ellie Kildunne has been ruled out of Sunday's Rugby World Cup quarter-final against Scotland due to a concussion sustained against Australia. Versatile back Helena Rowland will step into the full-back position for the World Cup holders.

Rowland, praised for her exceptional skill, innate understanding of space, and ability to play any backline position from 10 to 15, was the clear choice over specialist full-back Emma Sing, who is less experienced at Test level and will be on the bench. Rowland has a proven track record, having set a Women's Rugby World Cup record with 27 points against Samoa (including 11 conversions and a try), and delivered an enterprising cameo after replacing Kildunne against Australia.

While Kildunne's absence robs England of star power, Rowland's comprehensive abilities and recent form suggest the team may not be significantly weakened. This is partly due to Kildunne's backfield positioning being exploited by Australia last weekend and the England backline generally not having hit its stride. In other team news, Holly Aitchinson will start at fly-half ahead of regular kicker Zoe Harrison.
summary_tgt:
यहाँ अंग्रेजी समाचार सारांश का हिंदी अनुवाद है:

इंग्लैंड की एली किल्डन रविवार को स्कॉटलैंड के खिलाफ होने वाले रग्बी विश्व कप क्वार्टर-फाइनल से बाहर हो गई हैं। उन्हें ऑस्ट्रेलिया के खिलाफ खेलते हुए दिमागी चोट लगी थी। बहुमुखी खिलाड़ी हेलेना रॉलैंड विश्व कप धारक टीम के लिए फुल-बैक की जिम्मेदारी संभालेंगी।

रॉलैंड, जिनकी असाधारण कौशल, स्थान की सहज समझ और 10 से 15 तक किसी भी बैकलाइन स्थिति में खेलने की क्षमता के लिए प्रशंसा की जाती है, को विशेषज्ञ फुल-बैक एम्मा सिंग पर स्पष्ट प्राथमिकता दी गई। सिंग टेस्ट स्तर पर कम अनुभवी हैं और बेंच पर रहेंगी। रॉलैंड का प्रदर्शन शानदार रहा है; उन्होंने समोआ के खिलाफ 27 अंक (जिसमें 11 कन्वर्जन और एक ट्राई शामिल थे) बनाकर महिला रग्बी विश्व कप का रिकॉर्ड बनाया था। ऑस्ट्रेलिया के खिलाफ किल्डन की जगह आने के बाद भी उन्होंने एक प्रभावशाली कैमियो दिया था।

हालांकि, किल्डन की अनुपस्थिति से इंग्लैंड को एक प्रमुख खिलाड़ी की कमी खलेगी, लेकिन रॉलैंड की व्यापक क्षमताएं और हालिया फॉर्म बताती है कि टीम शायद महत्वपूर्ण रूप से कमजोर नहीं होगी। ऐसा आंशिक रूप से इसलिए है क्योंकि पिछले सप्ताहांत ऑस्ट्रेलिया ने किल्डन की बैकफ़ील्ड पोज़िशनिंग का फायदा उठाया था और इंग्लैंड की बैकलाइन अभी तक पूरी तरह से लय में नहीं आ पाई है। टीम की अन्य खबरों में, हॉली एटकिंसन नियमित किकर ज़ो हैरिसन की जगह फ्लाई-हाफ के रूप में शुरुआत करेंगी।
meta_description: Helena Rowland has largely been restricted to a World Cup bench role, but with Ellie Kildunne injured, her importance is clear as she starts at full-back for England against Scotland.

title_src: South Korean workers detained in US raid arrive home
text_src: South Korean workers detained in US raid arrive home How the massive immigration raid on a Georgia car plant unfolded The incident has shaken ties between the US and South Korea, whose companies are investing billions in the States – investment President Donald Trump has pushed to secure. A chartered Korean Air jet carrying the workers and 14 non-Koreans who were also detained in the raid took off from Atlanta at midday local time on Thursday (17:00 BST). One South Korean national has reportedly chosen to stay in the US to seek permanent residency. Their return comes as the country's president and Hyundai's chief executive have warned about the impact of the raid. More than 300 South Koreans who were detained in a massive immigration raid at a Hyundai plant in the US state of Georgia have arrived back home. A large group of journalists and some protesters had gathered at Incheon International Airport ahead of their arrival The workers' departure was delayed by more than a day because of an instruction from the White House, South Korean President Lee Jae Myung said on Thursday. Trump ordered the pause to check whether the workers were willing to remain in the US to continue working and training Americans, according to a South Korean foreign ministry official. The workers looked happy but tired as they were brought through Incheon International Airport and shepherded onto buses to be reunited with their families. "I'm back, I'm free," one of them shouted. A large group of journalists had gathered at the airport ahead of the workers' arrival on Friday. There were also a few people protesting the raid. One of them held up a banner showing Trump in the uniform of an immigration agent, with the caption: "We're friends! Aren't we?" Another protester's banner read: "Public outrage over detention of 300 Koreans, shackled up and treated like major criminals! Why shall [we] continue US investments after such back-stabbing?" The returning workers have requested privacy, South Korea's foreign ministry said earlier on Friday, advising media outlets to blur any photographs and videos so that they will not be identified. Security was tight at the airport, with officers directing other travellers to gates not used by the workers. Last week, US officials detained 475 people - more than 300 of them South Korean nationals - who they said were working illegally at Hyundai's battery facility, one of the largest foreign investment projects in Georgia. The workers were taken away in handcuffs and chains to be detained, sparking outrage in their home country. Companies would be "very hesitant" about investing in the US following the raid, South Korea's president said on Thursday. "The situation is extremely bewildering," Lee added, while noting it is common practice for Korean firms to send workers to help set up overseas factories. "If that's no longer allowed, establishing manufacturing facilities in the US will only become more difficult... making companies question whether it's worth doing at all," he added. On Friday, the South Korean foreign ministry said it had called for the US Congress to support a new visa for Korean firms. During meetings with US senators in Washington this week, Foreign Minister Cho Hyun reiterated concerns among South Koreans over the arrests, the ministry said in a statement. Meanwhile, Hyundai's chief executive José Muñoz has said the raid will delay the factory's opening by at least two months, as the company needs to find new workers to finish the job. Mr Muñoz told US media that the raid will create "minimum two to three months delay [in opening the factory] because now all these people want to get back".
summary_src:
More than 300 South Korean workers, detained in a massive US immigration raid at a Hyundai plant in Georgia, have returned home, sparking a diplomatic row and raising concerns about future US investments.

The workers were among 475 people, most of them South Korean nationals, apprehended last week and accused of working illegally at Hyundai's battery facility. They arrived at Incheon International Airport on Friday via a chartered Korean Air jet from Atlanta. Their departure was reportedly delayed by over a day due to a White House instruction to ascertain if any workers wished to remain in the US for work and training programs; one South Korean national has chosen to stay to seek permanent residency.

The incident has provoked strong reactions in South Korea. President Moon Jae-in and Hyundai's chief executive have warned of a "devastating effect" on the country's economy, potentially making companies "very hesitant" about investing in the US. South Korean officials have expressed deep concern to US senators, emphasizing that sending workers to help set up overseas factories is common practice for Korean firms and have called for a new visa category for them.

Hyundai CEO José Muñoz confirmed the raid would delay the factory's opening by at least two to three months, as the company now needs to find new workers. At Incheon Airport, journalists and protesters gathered, with some banners criticizing the detention of Koreans "shackled up and treated like major criminals" and questioning continued US investments. Despite appearing tired, the returning workers expressed relief, with one shouting, "I'm back, I'm free." South Korea's foreign ministry has requested privacy for the returning workers.

यहां अंग्रेजी समाचार सारांश का हिंदी अनुवाद है:

**जॉर्जिया में हुंडई प्लांट में अमेरिकी आव्रजन छापेमारी के बाद 300 से अधिक दक्षिण कोरियाई श्रमिक वतन लौटे, राजनयिक विवाद गहराया**

जॉर्जिया में हुंडई के एक प्लांट में अमेरिका की एक बड़ी आव्रजन छापेमारी के दौरान हिरासत में लिए गए 300 से अधिक दक्षिण कोरियाई श्रमिक अपने वतन लौट आए हैं, जिससे एक राजनयिक विवाद खड़ा हो गया है और अमेरिका में भविष्य के निवेश को लेकर चिंताएँ बढ़ गई हैं।

ये श्रमिक उन 475 लोगों में शामिल थे, जिनमें से अधिकांश दक्षिण कोरियाई नागरिक थे, जिन्हें पिछले हफ्ते हुंडई के बैटरी संयंत्र में अवैध रूप से काम करने के आरोप में पकड़ा गया था। वे शुक्रवार को अटलांटा से कोरियाई एयर के एक चार्टर्ड जेट से इंचियोन अंतरराष्ट्रीय हवाई अड्डे पर पहुंचे। कथित तौर पर उनकी रवानगी एक दिन से अधिक समय तक इसलिए विलंबित हुई क्योंकि व्हाइट हाउस ने यह सुनिश्चित करने का निर्देश दिया था कि क्या कोई श्रमिक काम और प्रशिक्षण कार्यक्रमों के लिए अमेरिका में रहना चाहता है; एक दक्षिण कोरियाई नागरिक ने स्थायी निवास (परमानेंट रेसिडेंसी) के लिए अमेरिका में रुकने का फैसला किया है।

इस घटना ने दक्षिण कोरिया में कड़ी प्रतिक्रियाएँ पैदा की हैं। राष्ट्रपति मून जे-इन और हुंडई के मुख्य कार्यकारी ने देश की अर्थव्यवस्था पर इसके "विनाशकारी प्रभाव" की चेतावनी दी है, जिससे कंपनियाँ अमेरिका में निवेश करने से बहुत कतरा सकती हैं। दक्षिण कोरियाई अधिकारियों ने अमेरिकी सीनेटरों से गहरी चिंता व्यक्त की है, इस बात पर जोर देते हुए कि विदेशों में कारखाने स्थापित करने में मदद करने के लिए श्रमिकों को भेजना कोरियाई फर्मों के लिए एक सामान्य प्रथा है और उन्होंने उनके लिए एक नई वीज़ा श्रेणी की मांग की है।

हुंडई के सीईओ जोस मुनोज़ ने पुष्टि की कि इस छापेमारी के कारण फैक्ट्री के खुलने में कम से कम दो से तीन महीने का विलंब होगा, क्योंकि कंपनी को अब नए श्रमिकों को खोजना होगा। इंचियोन हवाई अड्डे पर, पत्रकार और प्रदर्शनकारी जमा हुए थे, जिनमें से कुछ के बैनर कोरियाई लोगों की हिरासत की कठोर आलोचना कर रहे थे, जिन्हें "हथकड़ी में जकड़कर और बड़े अपराधियों जैसा सलूक किया गया" था। बैनरों में अमेरिका में लगातार निवेश पर भी सवाल उठाए गए थे। थके हुए होने के बावजूद, लौटने वाले श्रमिकों ने राहत महसूस की, एक ने चिल्लाते हुए कहा, "मैं वापस आ गया हूँ, मैं आज़ाद हूँ।" दक्षिण कोरिया के विदेश मंत्रालय ने लौट रहे श्रमिकों के लिए गोपनीयता बनाए रखने का अनुरोध किया है।

title_src: South Korean woman who bit off attacker's tongue acquitted after 61 years
text_src: Woman who bit off attacker's tongue acquitted after 61 years 3 days ago Share Save Kelly Ng Singapore and Yujin Choi BBC Korean, Seoul Share Save News1 Ms Choi's case has been cited in legal textbooks in South Korea as a classic example of a court failing to recognise self-defence during sexual violence A South Korean woman has been acquitted after a court revisited her decades-old conviction for biting off the tongue of a man during an alleged sexual attack. Choi Mal-ja was 18 when she was convicted of grievous bodily harm and sentenced to 10 months in jail. Her aggressor, who was 21, received a lighter sentence of six months. After a years-long campaign to clear her name, a retrial began in the southern city of Busan in July. In its first hearing, prosecutors apologised to her and, in an unusual move, asked the court to quash the conviction. "I could not let this case go unanswered... I [wanted] to stand up for other victims who share the same fate as mine," Ms Choi said after the acquittal. As a teenager back then, the incident changed her fate by "turning [me] from a victim to an accused". "People around me warned me that it would be like throwing eggs at a rock, but I could not let this case go," said Ms Choi, now 79. She thanked her supporters, and called out those in power whom she said "abused their authority to trample the weak and manipulate the law". Ms Choi's case has been cited in legal textbooks in South Korea as a classic example of a court failing to recognise self-defence during sexual violence. According to court records, the attacker had pinned Ms Choi to the ground somewhere in the southern town of Gimhae. She only managed to break free after biting off about 1.5cm (0.59in) of his tongue. The man continually demanded compensation for his injury and even broke into Ms Choi's home with a knife on one occasion, South Korean media reported. In one of South Korea's most contentious rulings on sexual violence, the man was sentenced to six months in prison - suspended for two years - for trespassing and intimidation. He was never charged for attempted rape. Ms Choi received the harsher sentence for causing him grievous bodily harm, with the court saying at the time that her actions exceeded the "reasonable bounds" of self-defence. She was detained for six months during the investigation, and was later given a 10-month sentence, which was suspended for two years. News1 Ms Choi, now 79, said she wanted to stand up for other victims who shared her fate
summary_src:
**South Korean Woman Acquitted 61 Years After Biting Attacker's Tongue in Self-Defense**

Choi Mal-ja, now 79, has been acquitted of grievous bodily harm 61 years after she was convicted for biting off her attacker's tongue while defending herself from a sexual assault. The case has long been cited in legal textbooks as a classic example of a court failing to recognize self-defense during sexual violence.

The incident occurred when Ms. Choi was 18, pinned to the ground by a 21-year-old man. She managed to escape only after biting off 1.5cm of his tongue. Despite her actions being a desperate act of self-preservation, she was convicted and received a suspended 10-month sentence, with the court ruling her actions exceeded "reasonable bounds" of self-defense. In stark contrast, her aggressor was never charged with attempted rape and received a lighter, suspended six-month sentence for later trespassing and intimidation offenses committed when he repeatedly demanded compensation from her, even breaking into her home with a knife.

After decades of living with the conviction, Ms. Choi launched a years-long campaign to clear her name. A retrial began in Busan in July, where, in an unusual move, prosecutors not only apologised to her but also requested the court to quash her original conviction.

Ms. Choi expressed profound relief at the acquittal, stating that she felt compelled to pursue justice not just for herself, but to "stand up for other victims" and ensure they do not have to endure similar suffering. She condemned those in power who "abused their authority to trample the weak and manipulate the law," highlighting how the initial ruling transformed her from a victim into an accused.

यहाँ उस अंग्रेजी समाचार सारांश का हिन्दी अनुवाद है:

**दक्षिण कोरियाई महिला 61 साल बाद आत्मरक्षा में हमलावर की जीभ काटने के आरोप से बरी हुई**

79 वर्षीय चोई माल-जा को यौन उत्पीड़न से अपनी आत्मरक्षा करते हुए अपने हमलावर की जीभ काटने के मामले में दोषी ठहराए जाने के 61 साल बाद गंभीर शारीरिक चोट पहुँचाने के आरोप से बरी कर दिया गया है। इस मामले का लंबे समय से कानूनी पाठ्यपुस्तकों में यौन हिंसा के दौरान आत्मरक्षा को पहचानने में अदालत की विफलता के एक उत्कृष्ट उदाहरण के रूप में हवाला दिया जाता रहा है।

यह घटना तब हुई जब सुश्री चोई 18 साल की थीं और उन्हें एक 21 वर्षीय व्यक्ति ने जमीन पर दबोच लिया था। वह उसकी 1.5 सेमी जीभ काटने के बाद ही भागने में सफल रहीं। आत्म-संरक्षण का एक हताश कार्य होने के बावजूद, उन्हें दोषी ठहराया गया और 10 महीने की निलंबित सज़ा मिली, क्योंकि अदालत ने फैसला सुनाया कि उनके कार्य आत्मरक्षा की "उचित सीमाओं" से अधिक थे। इसके बिल्कुल विपरीत, उनके हमलावर पर कभी भी बलात्कार के प्रयास का आरोप नहीं लगाया गया। उसे बाद में अतिक्रमण और डराने-धमकाने के अपराधों के लिए हल्की, छह महीने की निलंबित सज़ा मिली थी। उसने बार-बार सुश्री चोई से मुआवज़े की मांग की थी, यहाँ तक कि चाकू लेकर उनके घर में भी घुस गया था।

दशकों तक इस दोषसिद्धि के साथ जीने के बाद, सुश्री चोई ने अपना नाम साफ़ करने के लिए वर्षों लंबा अभियान चलाया। जुलाई में बुसान में एक पुनर्विचारण शुरू हुआ, जहाँ, एक असामान्य कदम उठाते हुए, अभियोजकों ने न केवल उनसे माफी मांगी बल्कि अदालत से उनकी मूल दोषसिद्धि को रद्द करने का भी अनुरोध किया।

सुश्री चोई ने बरी होने पर गहरी राहत व्यक्त की और कहा कि उन्हें न्याय मांगने के लिए मजबूर होना पड़ा, न केवल अपने लिए, बल्कि "अन्य पीड़ितों के लिए खड़े होने" और यह सुनिश्चित करने के लिए कि उन्हें ऐसी ही पीड़ा न झेलनी पड़े। उन्होंने सत्ता में बैठे उन लोगों की निंदा की जिन्होंने "कमजोरों को कुचलने और कानून में हेरफेर करने के लिए अपनी शक्ति का दुरुपयोग किया", इस बात पर जोर देते हुए कि कैसे प्रारंभिक फैसले ने उन्हें एक पीड़ित से एक आरोपी में बदल दिया था।
meta_description: Choi Mal-ja only managed to break free after biting off about 1.5cm of her alleged attacker's tongue.

title_src: UK economy saw zero growth in July
text_src: UK economy saw zero growth in July 1 day ago Share Save Emer Moreau Business reporter Share Save Getty Images The UK economy failed to grow in July, following the biggest contraction in manufacturing output for a year. The Office for National Statistics (ONS) said the economy saw zero growth in the month, which was in line with expectations, following a 0.4% expansion in June. However, monthly figures are volatile, and the ONS has said it will now focus on growth over a rolling three-month period. In the three months to July, the economy expanded by 0.2% The government is under mounting pressure to deliver on its key priority of boosting economic growth ahead of the Budget on 26 November. In the Budget, Chancellor Rachel Reeves will outline the government's tax and spending plans with increasing speculation she will raise taxes to meet her self-imposed fiscal rules. The ONS said the service sector grew by 0.4% over the three months to July, helped by a good performance from the health sector, computer programming and office support services. However, this was offset by a fall in output from the production sector, which includes manufacturing. In July itself, manufacturing contracted by 1.3% - the sharpest monthly decline since July last year. The UK economy expanded by 0.7% in the first three months of the year, and then grew by 0.3% between April and June. The ONS said the latest figures showed the economy had "continued to slow" over the past three months. However, it is still on track to grow in the third quarter. Rob Wood, chief UK economist at Pantheon Macroeconomics, said the UK's finances were "looking pretty resilient to the barrage of shocks faced this year". The latest data also comes ahead of the Bank of England's next interest rate decision on 18 September, with policymakers weighing up flagging growth against stubborn inflation. 'Sign of things to come'
summary_src:
The UK economy experienced zero growth in July, primarily driven by the largest contraction in manufacturing output in a year, according to the Office for National Statistics (ONS). While the ONS reported a modest 0.2% expansion over the three months to July, supported by a 0.4% rise in the service sector (including health and technology), this was significantly offset by a decline in the production sector. Manufacturing output specifically fell by 1.3% in July—its sharpest monthly drop since the previous year and the biggest fall in the UK since the start of the recession.

This economic stagnation intensifies pressure on the government to deliver on its growth priorities. Chancellor Rachel Reeves is expected to outline tax and spending plans in her upcoming Budget, with speculation of tax increases to meet fiscal rules. The data also comes ahead of the Bank of England's interest rate decision on September 18, where policymakers will weigh the flagging growth against persistent inflation. Despite the ONS indicating the economy has "continued to slow" for the first time in three years, some analysts, such as Rob Wood of Pantheon Macroeconomics, suggest the UK's finances appear "pretty resilient."
summary_tgt:
**ब्रिटेन की अर्थव्यवस्था को जुलाई में शून्य वृद्धि का सामना करना पड़ा, मुख्य रूप से विनिर्माण उत्पादन में एक साल की सबसे बड़ी गिरावट इसके लिए जिम्मेदार रही। यह जानकारी राष्ट्रीय सांख्यिकी कार्यालय (ONS) ने दी है।**

ONS ने बताया कि जुलाई तक के तीन महीनों में अर्थव्यवस्था में मामूली 0.2% का विस्तार हुआ था, जिसे सेवा क्षेत्र (स्वास्थ्य और प्रौद्योगिकी सहित) में 0.4% की वृद्धि से समर्थन मिला। हालांकि, उत्पादन क्षेत्र में आई गिरावट ने इस विस्तार को काफी हद तक बेअसर कर दिया। विशेष रूप से, जुलाई में विनिर्माण उत्पादन में 1.3% की गिरावट दर्ज की गई – यह पिछले साल के बाद से इसकी सबसे तेज़ मासिक गिरावट है और मंदी की शुरुआत के बाद से ब्रिटेन में सबसे बड़ी गिरावट है।

इस आर्थिक गतिरोध ने सरकार पर अपनी विकास प्राथमिकताओं को पूरा करने का दबाव बढ़ा दिया है। वित्त मंत्री राचेल रीव्स से उम्मीद की जा रही है कि वह अपने आगामी बजट में कर और खर्च की योजनाओं को रेखांकित करेंगी, जिसमें राजकोषीय नियमों को पूरा करने के लिए करों में वृद्धि की अटकलें लगाई जा रही हैं। यह डेटा 18 सितंबर को बैंक ऑफ इंग्लैंड के ब्याज दर के फैसले से पहले भी आया है, जहां नीति निर्माता धीमी पड़ती वृद्धि और लगातार बढ़ती मुद्रास्फीति के बीच संतुलन साधने का प्रयास करेंगे।

हालांकि ONS ने संकेत दिया है कि अर्थव्यवस्था तीन साल में पहली बार "लगातार धीमी हुई है", पैन्थियन मैक्रोइकॉनॉमिक्स के रॉब वुड जैसे कुछ विश्लेषकों का सुझाव है कि ब्रिटेन की वित्तीय स्थिति "काफी लचीली" दिखती है।

title_src: Hyundai says opening of raided plant to be delayed
text_src: Hyundai says opening of raided plant to be delayed 2 days ago Share Save Natalie Sherman Business reporter Share Save AFP via Getty Images A massive immigration raid at a Hyundai plant in the US will delay its opening by at least two months, according to the company. The raid has raised tensions between the US and South Korea, where many of those detained were from, with the South Korean president warning that it will discourage foreign investment into the US. South Korean officials have said many of the workers had been sent to the US factory temporarily to help get it going. Hyundai chief executive José Muñoz told US media the raid will create "minimum two to three months delay [in opening the factory] because now all these people want to get back". The raid in the state of Georgia was the biggest in US history, leading to the detention of 475 people, including roughly 300 people from South Korea. US immigration officials said the workers were not authorized to work in the US while South Korean officials said it is common practice for Korean firms to send workers to help set up overseas factories. According to South Korean officials, the workers are due to return home on Friday after their flight, initially set for Wednesday, was delayed. South Korean Lee Jae Myung added US President Donald Trump proposed the workers remain in the US to continue training American workers but that only one person accepted that offer. Mr Muñoz said the firm is figuring out how it will fill the positions of the workers who plan to return to South Korea.
summary_src:
A raid by US immigration officials on a new Hyundai plant in Georgia has significantly delayed its opening and heightened tensions between the US and South Korea. The raid, the largest in US history, led to the detention of 475 people, including approximately 300 South Koreans.

Hyundai's chief executive, José Muñoz, confirmed the plant's opening would be delayed by a "minimum two to three months," explaining that many of the workers, whom South Korean officials state were temporarily sent to help establish the factory, now wish to return home. US officials, however, maintained the workers were unauthorized, while South Korea asserted it is common practice for its firms to send personnel for overseas factory setups.

The incident has drawn criticism from South Korea, with its president warning it could discourage foreign investment into the US. Most of the South Korean workers are due to return home, their flight having been delayed, though only one accepted an offer from US President Donald Trump to remain and train American workers. Muñoz stated Hyundai is now working to fill the vacant positions and is collaborating with the South Korean government to manage the situation.
summary_tgt:
यहाँ उस अंग्रेजी समाचार सारांश का हिन्दी अनुवाद है:

जॉर्जिया में हुंडई के एक नए संयंत्र पर अमेरिकी आव्रजन अधिकारियों द्वारा की गई छापेमारी ने इसके खुलने में काफी देरी कर दी है और अमेरिका तथा दक्षिण कोरिया के बीच तनाव बढ़ा दिया है। अमेरिकी इतिहास की यह सबसे बड़ी छापेमारी थी, जिसमें लगभग 300 दक्षिण कोरियाई सहित 475 लोगों को हिरासत में लिया गया।

हुंडई के मुख्य कार्यकारी, जोस मुनोज ने पुष्टि की कि संयंत्र के खुलने में "न्यूनतम दो से तीन महीने" की देरी होगी। उन्होंने बताया कि कई कर्मचारी, जिन्हें दक्षिण कोरियाई अधिकारियों के अनुसार कारखाने की स्थापना में मदद के लिए अस्थायी रूप से भेजा गया था, अब घर लौटना चाहते हैं। हालांकि, अमेरिकी अधिकारियों ने दावा किया कि ये कर्मचारी अनाधिकृत थे, जबकि दक्षिण कोरिया ने जोर देकर कहा कि उसकी कंपनियों के लिए विदेशों में कारखाने स्थापित करने हेतु कर्मियों को भेजना एक सामान्य प्रथा है।

इस घटना की दक्षिण कोरिया ने आलोचना की है, उसके राष्ट्रपति ने चेतावनी दी है कि यह अमेरिका में विदेशी निवेश को हतोत्साहित कर सकता है। अधिकांश दक्षिण कोरियाई कर्मचारी घर लौटने वाले हैं, हालांकि उनकी उड़ान में देरी हुई है; लेकिन केवल एक ने अमेरिकी राष्ट्रपति डोनाल्ड ट्रंप के अमेरिकी श्रमिकों को प्रशिक्षित करने और वहीं रहने के प्रस्ताव को स्वीकार किया। मुनोज ने कहा कि हुंडई अब रिक्त पदों को भरने के लिए काम कर रही है और स्थिति को संभालने के लिए दक्षिण कोरियाई सरकार के साथ सहयोग कर रही है।

title_src: US inflation rises ahead of key interest rate decision
text_src: US inflation rises ahead of key interest rate decision 2 days ago Share Save Danielle Kaye Business reporter Share Save Reuters US inflation rose in August at the fastest pace since the beginning of the year ahead of a key Federal Reserve meeting where it will decide whether to cut or hold interest rates. Consumer prices increased 2.9% in the year to August, up from 2.7% the previous month, according to the latest figures from the US Labor Department as the cost of cars, household furnishings and grocery staples like tomatoes and beef all rose. The US central bank has kept interest rates unchanged since last year as policymakers continued to monitor the effect of President Donald Trump's import tariffs on consumer prices. Trump and some of his allies have attacked the Fed for not cutting rates at the same pace as other central banks in, for example, the UK and Europe. The Fed is widely expected to cut interest rates next week by a quarter of a percentage point. The new data is unlikely to derail those forecasts but the uptick in inflation is poised to keep policymakers cautious as they weigh rate cuts in the months ahead. "President Donald Trump's inflationary policies - tariffs and restrictive immigration measures - are gradually showing up in the hard data and continue to erode consumers' purchasing power," said Atakan Bakiskan, US economist at banking group Berenberg. Trump has dismissed concerns that his policies will drive up prices or weigh on the economy. Since Trump latest tariffs took effect last month, most goods entering the US face taxes of between 10% and 50%, depending on their origin. The price of tariff-sensitive products - such as clothing and household goods - inched up last month in a sign that more businesses might be passing on costs to consumers. Economists noted that the uptick in food prices, which tend to be volatile, might also be driven in part by Trump administration policies, including tariffs and mass deportations. Inflation data showed that tomato prices rose by 4.5% in August. About 70% of tomatoes consumed in the US are imported from Mexico, according to the Florida Tomato Exchange. In July, the US imposed a 17% tariff on most tomatoes bought in from its southern neighbour. As well as inflation, the Fed has become increasingly focused on job market weakness. Fewer jobs Last week, the Labor Department reported that employers added just 22,000 jobs in August, fewer than expected, while the unemployment rate ticked up from 4.2% to 4.3%. More recently, it said the US economy added 911,000 fewer jobs than initial estimates had suggested in the year to March. And on Thursday, the Labor Department reported a jump in weekly unemployment filings to 263,000 - the highest level in nearly four years. An underlying measure of inflation, which strips out volatile food and energy costs, held steady at 3.1% year-over-year in August. "Right now, inflation is a key subplot, but the labor market is still the main story," said Ellen Zentner, chief economic strategist for Morgan Stanley Wealth Management. "That translates into a rate cut next week - and, likely, more to come." BBC/Tommy Lumby
summary_src:
The US Federal Reserve is widely expected to cut interest rates by a quarter of a percentage point next week, driven primarily by a weakening job market, despite a recent uptick in inflation.

Consumer prices rose 2.9% in August, the fastest pace this year, with increased costs for cars, household furnishings, and grocery staples like tomatoes and beef. This inflation has been linked by economists to President Donald Trump's import tariffs and restrictive immigration policies, with "tariff-sensitive" goods and imported tomatoes (which faced a 17% tariff in July) showing price increases. Trump, however, dismisses these concerns, stating his policies are aimed at helping the middle class.

Despite the inflation rise, the central bank's focus remains on the job market, which showed significant weakness. Employers added only 22,000 jobs in August, the unemployment rate climbed to 4.3%, and weekly unemployment filings jumped to a nearly four-year high. While core inflation (excluding food and energy) held steady at 3.1%, analysts consider the labor market "the main story," indicating the upcoming rate cut is likely the first of several, even as policymakers remain cautious due to the inflation uptick.
summary_tgt:
अमेरिकी फेडरल रिजर्व द्वारा अगले सप्ताह ब्याज दरों में चौथाई प्रतिशत अंक की कटौती करने की व्यापक उम्मीद है। यह कदम मुख्य रूप से कमजोर होते रोजगार बाजार के कारण उठाया जाएगा, भले ही मुद्रास्फीति में हाल ही में वृद्धि हुई हो।

अगस्त में उपभोक्ता कीमतें 2.9% बढ़ीं, जो इस साल की सबसे तेज गति है। इसमें कारों, घरेलू साज-सज्जा और टमाटर व बीफ जैसे आवश्यक किराना सामान की लागत में वृद्धि देखी गई। अर्थशास्त्रियों ने इस मुद्रास्फीति को राष्ट्रपति डोनाल्ड ट्रंप के आयात शुल्क और प्रतिबंधात्मक आव्रजन नीतियों से जोड़ा है, जिसमें "टैरिफ-संवेदनशील" वस्तुएं और आयातित टमाटर (जिन पर जुलाई में 17% टैरिफ लगा था) की कीमतों में वृद्धि देखी गई। हालांकि, ट्रंप इन चिंताओं को खारिज करते हुए कहते हैं कि उनकी नीतियों का उद्देश्य मध्यम वर्ग की मदद करना है।

मुद्रास्फीति में वृद्धि के बावजूद, केंद्रीय बैंक का ध्यान रोजगार बाजार पर बना हुआ है, जिसमें महत्वपूर्ण कमजोरी दिखी। अगस्त में नियोक्ताओं ने केवल 22,000 नौकरियां जोड़ीं, बेरोजगारी दर बढ़कर 4.3% हो गई, और साप्ताहिक बेरोजगारी दावे लगभग चार साल के उच्चतम स्तर पर पहुंच गए। जबकि कोर मुद्रास्फीति (खाद्य और ऊर्जा को छोड़कर) 3.1% पर स्थिर रही, विश्लेषक श्रम बाजार को "मुख्य कहानी" मानते हैं, यह दर्शाता है कि आगामी दर कटौती संभवतः कई कटौतियों में से पहली है, भले ही नीति-निर्माता मुद्रास्फीति में वृद्धि के कारण सतर्क रहें।

title_src: You just can't recreate that glow': The people who hunt old TVs
text_src: They are televisions from another era, replaced by the flat screen, high-resolution displays of the modern era. Yet cathode-ray tubes are still surprisingly in demand. The moment he saw pictures of the grubby old televisions for sale, Shaan Joshi knew he had to have them. Joshi, a game developer and writer from central Florida in the US, immediately paid up: $2,500 (£1,900) for 10 cathode-ray tube (CRT) TVs. Chunky boxes with thick glass screens. Relics from another time. Wi-fi connectivity? Apps? Forget about it. These things produced a glow and sound from an earlier era. These TVs weren't any ordinary analogue displays though. They were professional video monitors, or PVMs. The kind of sets that once furnished hospital labs, hooked up to very expensive equipment. Broadcasters also used to have huge numbers of them. Today, PVMs light up the dreams of certain die-hard retro gamers. Joshi is part of a small group of people who scavenge for vintage TVs like this. They are looking for boxes with nostalgia-triggering picture quality. "Being tapped into the scene gives you a pretty good competitive edge," he says. "If you know enough people." A contact had sent him a link to the CRTs for sale on eBay. Minutes after he'd bought the sets and excitedly told an online group he's part of, someone messaged him. "Hey," the person said. "Do you want to go split on this stuff?" Joshi thought about it for a moment. The TVs were 200 miles away in southern Florida. If this person helped – and the TVs were OK – he'd get half his money back, and potentially even some help hauling the hefty sets back home. As long as this total stranger was as good as their word. He sent his reply: "Sure."
summary_src:
Despite being largely replaced by modern flat screens, cathode-ray tube (CRT) televisions from the 1970s and 80s are experiencing a surprising resurgence in demand, particularly professional video monitors (PVMs). These once-common displays, originally used in settings like hospital labs and by broadcasters, are now highly sought after by die-hard retro gamers for their nostalgic picture quality.

US game developer and writer Shaan Joshi exemplifies this trend, having recently paid $2,500 for a lot of 10 PVMs he discovered through a contact on eBay. Joshi is part of a niche community of enthusiasts who actively scavenge for these vintage sets, leveraging their networks for competitive advantage. After his purchase, a fellow member of his online group messaged him, offering to split the cost and assist in hauling the hefty TVs 200 miles from southern Florida, an offer Joshi accepted despite the inherent risk of trusting a stranger.
summary_tgt:
**आधुनिक फ्लैट स्क्रीन द्वारा काफी हद तक प्रतिस्थापित किए जाने के बावजूद, 1970 और 80 के दशक के कैथोड-रे ट्यूब (CRT) टेलीविजन, खासकर प्रोफेशनल वीडियो मॉनिटर (PVMs), मांग में एक आश्चर्यजनक पुनरुत्थान का अनुभव कर रहे हैं। ये कभी आम रहे डिस्प्ले, जिनका मूल रूप से अस्पताल प्रयोगशालाओं और प्रसारकों (broadcasters) जैसी जगहों पर उपयोग किया जाता था, अब अपनी पुरानी यादों भरी तस्वीर गुणवत्ता (nostalgic picture quality) के लिए कट्टर रेट्रो गेमर्स द्वारा अत्यधिक मांग में हैं।**

**अमेरिकी गेम डेवलपर और लेखक शान जोशी इस प्रवृत्ति का एक उदाहरण हैं, जिन्होंने हाल ही में eBay पर एक संपर्क के माध्यम से खोजे गए 10 PVMs के एक लॉट के लिए $2,500 का भुगतान किया है। जोशी उत्साही लोगों के एक विशिष्ट समुदाय का हिस्सा हैं जो इन पुराने सेटों की सक्रिय रूप से तलाश करते हैं, और प्रतिस्पर्धी लाभ के लिए अपने नेटवर्क का लाभ उठाते हैं। उनकी खरीद के बाद, उनके ऑनलाइन समूह के एक साथी सदस्य ने उन्हें मैसेज किया, जिसमें लागत साझा करने और दक्षिण फ्लोरिडा से 200 मील दूर भारी टीवी लाने में सहायता करने की पेशकश की गई थी। जोशी ने किसी अजनबी पर भरोसा करने के अंतर्निहित जोखिम के बावजूद इस प्रस्ताव को स्वीकार कर लिया।**
