यहाँ अंग्रेजी समाचार सारांश का हिंदी अनुवाद है:

**जोनस विंगगार्ड वुएल्टा ए एस्पाना खिताब के करीब, टॉम पिडकॉक ने पोडियम पर जगह बनाई; गाजा संघर्ष के विरोध से दौड़ प्रभावित**

जोनस विंगगार्ड अपना पहला वुएल्टा ए एस्पाना खिताब जीतने की कगार पर हैं, जबकि ब्रिटेन के टॉम पिडकॉक ने अपना पहला ग्रैंड टूर पोडियम स्थान सुनिश्चित कर लिया है।

डेनमार्क के 28 वर्षीय विंगगार्ड ने अंतिम से पहले के चरण में बोला डेल मुंडो की कठिन चढ़ाई जीतकर अपनी बढ़त मजबूत की। वह अपने टीम-मेट सेप कुस से 11 सेकंड आगे रहे। इस जीत ने रविवार के औपचारिक अंतिम चरण में प्रवेश करने से पहले पुर्तगाल के जोआओ अल्मेडा पर उनकी सामान्य वर्गीकरण में बढ़त को एक मिनट और 16 सेकंड तक बढ़ा दिया। 26 वर्षीय पिडकॉक चरण में चौथे स्थान पर रहे, जिससे उनका समग्र तीसरा स्थान सुनिश्चित हो गया। वह जय हिंडले से 30 सेकंड आगे रहे। दोनों साइकिल चालकों ने जबरदस्त गर्व व्यक्त किया, जिसमें पिडकॉक ने इसे "मेरे करियर का सबसे बड़ा प्रदर्शन" बताया।

हालांकि, यह दौड़ महत्वपूर्ण फिलिस्तीन समर्थक विरोध प्रदर्शनों से भी चिह्नित थी। अंतिम से पहले के चरण के दौरान, लगभग 50 प्रदर्शनकारियों ने समाप्ति के पास सड़क को अवरुद्ध करने का संक्षिप्त प्रयास किया, हालांकि साइकिल चालकों को मोड़ दिया गया और दौड़ बिना किसी बड़ी बाधा के जारी रही। आयोजकों ने एक खंड को हटाकर अंतिम चरण को भी छोटा कर दिया था, और इज़राइल-प्रीमियर टेक टीम को निशाना बनाने वाले चल रहे प्रदर्शनों के कारण कई शुरुआती चरणों में बदलाव किया गया था। इन विरोध प्रदर्शनों के कारण कथित तौर पर सवारों की सुरक्षा संबंधी चिंताएं, दुर्घटनाएं हुईं और टीम को अपना नाम प्रदर्शित किए बिना संशोधित जर्सी में दौड़ने के लिए प्रेरित किया। ये प्रदर्शन गाजा में चल रहे संघर्ष से जुड़े हैं, जो अक्टूबर 2023 में दक्षिणी इज़राइल पर हमास के नेतृत्व वाले हमले और बाद के इजरायली सैन्य अभियान के बाद बढ़ गया था, जिसके परिणामस्वरूप एक बड़ी मौत का आंकड़ा हुआ है।
meta_description: Jonas Vingegaard powers to victory in stage 20 to close in on his first Vuelta a Espana title while Britain's Tom Pidcock tightens his grip on a first Grand Tour podium finish.

title_src: Hansie Cronje, match-fixing and the plane crash which left a complex legacy for South Africa and cricket
text_src: That love of money meant Cronje was also one of the most accessible cricket captains around and he was regularly visited by people, particularly while on tour in South Asia. The rest of the South Africa squad would roll their eyes when yet another stranger would walk in for a meeting with him. It led to dealings with unscrupulous characters. In particular those involved with betting, and there was an early portent of what was to come in 1996. Before a one-off ODI between South Africa and India, tagged on to the end of a Test tour as a benefit match for Mohinder Amarnath, Cronje called a meeting in their Mumbai hotel for the players to consider an offer of $250,000 to throw the match. It was rejected, but it showed how secure Cronje was in his position. "Bringing it up in a team meeting was indicative of the power and untouchability that he felt," observed South African journalist Neil Manthorp. Fast forward to Nagpur in 2000, Cronje attempted to coerce South Africa batter Herschelle Gibbs and seam bowler Henry Williams into spot-fixing offences. Both men agreed, but subsequently did not carry out the instructions. "I always found it a struggle to actually say 'no' to him, you know?" reflected Gibbs. "He was regarded in such high esteem and respected so much, and I never once thought of the consequences." Both Gibbs and Williams were non-white players but suggestions it was racially motivated are dismissed by those who knew Cronje. Still, how was Cronje able to manipulate his team-mates with such ease? Manthorp said he was on an "elevated platform" and "very few people were prepared to stand up to him". "Hansie had quite a temper. He'd become, I think, accustomed to not being questioned," he added. The most infamous of Cronje's dealings with bookmakers came during the rain-affected fifth Test between South Africa and England at Centurion Park in early 2000. With the Proteas recommencing their first innings on the fifth day Cronje - prompted by a bookie named Marlon Aronstam - contrived an unprecedented innings forfeiture for both sides to ensure a result. England captain Nasser Hussain later compared his agreement with Cronje over what target his side would chase to the haggle scene in Monty Python's Life of Brian - Cronje immediately accepted the figure Hussain asked for. Cronje's innovative action to create a result on what otherwise would have been a dead final day of a Test largely drew praise, even if did not quite sit right with everyone. "After the initial celebrations I realised I did not experience the usual euphoria that would follow a Test win," said Butcher. "Almost instantly I knew why - it didn't feel we'd earned it." Michael Holding, covering the match for Sky Sports, received "tons of phone calls and letters" over something he said on air during a commentary stint, having smelt a rat. "I said if this game was being played on the Indian subcontinent, people would start talking about bookmakers," Holding said. "I just knew something was going on and that was my total focus. I was basically disgusted at what I was watching."
summary_src:
Hansie Cronje's "love of money" made him unusually accessible, particularly to questionable individuals during tours in South Asia, a fact noted with concern by his teammates. This led to his involvement in dealings with unscrupulous characters, betting, and scams.

An early indication of his compromised position came in 1996 in Mumbai, when Cronje offered his team $250,000 to throw an ODI. Though the team rejected the offer, it underscored his perceived "power and untouchability." By 2000, in Nagpur, Cronje directly coerced teammates Herschelle Gibbs and Henry Williams into spot-fixing, though they agreed but did not follow through. Teammates like Gibbs found it difficult to refuse Cronje due to his high esteem, unchallenged authority, and known temper, with one journalist describing his position as an "elevated platform" where few dared to question him. Suggestions that his manipulation of Gibbs and Williams was racially motivated were dismissed.

The most infamous incident occurred during the rain-affected Centurion Test against England in early 2000. Prompted by bookmaker Marlon Aronstam, Cronje orchestrated an unprecedented innings forfeiture to create a result on what would have been a drawn match. While this innovative move initially drew praise for making a game, some, like teammate Butcher, felt the victory was "unearned." Commentator Michael Holding famously "smelt a rat" during the match, expressing his disgust on air and noting that if such an event occurred in the Indian subcontinent, it would immediately be linked to bookmakers.
summary_tgt:
यहाँ उस अंग्रेजी समाचार सारांश का हिंदी अनुवाद है:

हैंसी क्रोन्ये का 'पैसे के प्रति प्रेम' उन्हें असामान्य रूप से सुलभ बनाता था, खासकर दक्षिण एशिया के दौरों के दौरान संदिग्ध व्यक्तियों के लिए, जिसे उनके साथियों ने चिंताजनक पाया था। इसी वजह से वे धोखेबाज लोगों के साथ सौदों, सट्टेबाजी और घोटालों में शामिल हो गए।

उनकी बिगड़ती साख का एक शुरुआती संकेत 1996 में मुंबई में मिला, जब क्रोन्ये ने अपनी टीम को एक वनडे मैच फिक्स करने के लिए $250,000 की पेशकश की। हालांकि टीम ने इस प्रस्ताव को ठुकरा दिया, लेकिन इसने उनकी कथित 'शक्ति और अजेयता' को रेखांकित किया। 2000 तक, नागपुर में, क्रोन्ये ने सीधे तौर पर अपने साथियों हर्षेल गिब्स और हेनरी विलियम्स को स्पॉट-फिक्सिंग के लिए मजबूर किया, हालांकि वे सहमत हो गए थे लेकिन उन्होंने इसे अंजाम नहीं दिया। गिब्स जैसे साथियों के लिए क्रोन्ये को मना करना मुश्किल था क्योंकि उनके ऊंचे रुतबे, निर्विवाद प्रभुत्व और ज्ञात गुस्सैल स्वभाव के कारण। एक पत्रकार ने उनकी स्थिति को एक 'ऊँचे मंच' के रूप में वर्णित किया था जहाँ बहुत कम लोग उनसे सवाल करने की हिम्मत करते थे। ऐसे सुझावों को खारिज कर दिया गया था कि गिब्स और विलियम्स के साथ उनकी हेरफेर नस्लीय रूप से प्रेरित थी।

सबसे कुख्यात घटना 2000 की शुरुआत में इंग्लैंड के खिलाफ बारिश से प्रभावित सेंचुरियन टेस्ट के दौरान हुई। सट्टेबाज मार्लोन एरोनस्टाम के कहने पर, क्रोन्ये ने एक अभूतपूर्व पारी घोषित कर दी ताकि उस मैच में परिणाम निकाला जा सके जो अन्यथा ड्रॉ होता। हालांकि इस अभिनव कदम को शुरुआत में मैच को रोमांचक बनाने के लिए प्रशंसा मिली, लेकिन कुछ, जैसे साथी खिलाड़ी बुचर, ने महसूस किया कि यह जीत 'अनर्जित' थी। कमेंटेटर माइकल होल्डिंग ने मैच के दौरान प्रसिद्ध रूप से 'दाल में कुछ काला' महसूस किया, प्रसारण के दौरान अपनी घृणा व्यक्त की और टिप्पणी की कि अगर ऐसी घटना भारतीय उपमहाद्वीप में हुई होती, तो इसे तुरंत सट्टेबाजों से जोड़ा जाता।
meta_description: Hansie Cronje's story, re-examined in Sport's Strangest Crimes on BBC Sounds, is a riddle wrapped in a mystery inside an enigma.

title_src: Canelo vs Crawford: Terence Crawford looks ripped as he weights same as Canelo Alvarez for Vegas super-fight
text_src: A shredded Terence Crawford was booed relentlessly by Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez's fans as a Mexican crowd made the home fighter feel as if he had walked straight into the lion's den at Friday's weigh-in in Las Vegas. Crawford - jumping up two divisions - weighed the same as the defending champion. Mexican Alvarez, 35, will defend his WBA (Super), WBC, IBF and WBO titles at the Allegiant Stadium. Unbeaten Crawford is aiming to become the first male three-division undisputed champion in the modern era. He came in just half a pound under the 12st (75kg) limit.
summary_src: Terence Crawford faced a hostile Mexican crowd at Friday's weigh-in, receiving relentless boos from Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez's fans. Despite jumping up two divisions to fight for the undisputed championship, Crawford weighed the same as the defending champion, making weight just under the 12st (75kg) limit. Unbeaten Crawford is aiming to become the first male three-division undisputed champion in the modern era. Mexican Alvarez, 35, will defend his WBA (Super), WBC, IBF, and WBO titles at the Allegiant Stadium.
summary_tgt:
यहाँ अंग्रेजी समाचार सारांश का हिंदी अनुवाद है:

शुक्रवार को हुए वजन-मापन (weigh-in) के दौरान, टेरेंस क्रॉफर्ड को एक शत्रुतापूर्ण मैक्सिकन भीड़ का सामना करना पड़ा, जहां सॉल 'कैनेलो' अल्वारेज़ के प्रशंसकों ने उनकी जोरदार हूटिंग की। निर्विवाद चैंपियनशिप के लिए दो डिवीजन ऊपर जाने के बावजूद, क्रॉफर्ड का वजन डिफेंडिंग चैंपियन के बराबर था, और उन्होंने 12 स्टोन (75 किलोग्राम) की सीमा से ठीक नीचे वजन करके पात्रता हासिल की।

अजेय क्रॉफर्ड आधुनिक युग में पहले पुरुष तीन-डिवीजन निर्विवाद चैंपियन बनने का लक्ष्य बना रहे हैं। 35 वर्षीय मैक्सिकन अल्वारेज़ एलिगेंट स्टेडियम में अपने WBA (सुपर), WBC, IBF और WBO खिताबों का बचाव करेंगे।
meta_description: A shredded Terence Crawford - jumping up two divisions - weighed the same as champion Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez for Saturday's Las Vegas super-fight.

title_src: Raheem Sterling and Axel Disasi: Chelsea duo to remain sidelined in 'bomb squad'
text_src: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says he hasn't seen either Raheem Sterling or Axel Disasi since the season began and they will remain in the "bomb squad". The Italian confirmed the pair will continue to use a different pitch, gym and dressing room from the rest of the first-team squad indefinitely. Neither forward Sterling nor French defender Disasi was able to secure a move away from Stamford Bridge before the end of the transfer window. Maresca, whose Chelsea side visit Brentford in the Premier League on Saturday, said: "They are Chelsea players, but at the moment they are training separately and the plan is to continue in this way. "Since the season started, I haven't seen either of them. I haven't seen Axel or Raheem. They train at a different time and on a different pitch. I haven't seen them since the start of the season."
summary_src: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca has confirmed that senior players Raheem Sterling and Axel Disasi are indefinitely training separately from the first-team squad, a situation he refers to as the "bomb squad." Maresca stated he hasn't seen either player since the season began, with the pair using different facilities—including a separate pitch, gym, and dressing room—and training at different times with a distinct group. The manager expressed uncertainty about their future and his lack of contact with them. This isolation stems from their failure to secure transfers away from Stamford Bridge before the transfer window closed. Chelsea is scheduled to visit Brentford in the Premier League on Saturday.
summary_tgt: चेल्सी के मैनेजर एन्ज़ो मारेस्का ने पुष्टि की है कि सीनियर खिलाड़ी रहीम स्टर्लिंग और एक्सेल दिसासी अनिश्चित काल के लिए मुख्य टीम से अलग प्रशिक्षण ले रहे हैं, एक ऐसी स्थिति जिसे वह "बॉम्ब स्क्वाड" कहते हैं। मारेस्का ने बताया कि उन्होंने सीज़न की शुरुआत से दोनों में से किसी भी खिलाड़ी को नहीं देखा है। ये दोनों खिलाड़ी अलग-अलग सुविधाओं – जिनमें एक अलग पिच, जिम और ड्रेसिंग रूम शामिल हैं – का उपयोग कर रहे हैं, और एक अलग समूह के साथ अलग-अलग समय पर प्रशिक्षण ले रहे हैं। मैनेजर ने उनके भविष्य को लेकर अनिश्चितता व्यक्त की और बताया कि उनका उनसे कोई संपर्क नहीं है। यह अलगाव इसलिए पैदा हुआ है क्योंकि वे ट्रांसफर विंडो बंद होने से पहले स्टैमफोर्ड ब्रिज से बाहर (किसी अन्य क्लब में) जाने के लिए स्थानान्तरण सुरक्षित करने में विफल रहे। चेल्सी शनिवार को प्रीमियर लीग में ब्रेंटफोर्ड का दौरा करेगी।
meta_description: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says he hasn't seen either Raheem Sterling or Axel Disasi since the season began and they will remain in the "bomb squad".

title_src: Mohamed Salah: Egyptian king - where it all began for Liverpool star
text_src: "Whenever I walk in here, I can't help but recall how he used to move and the way he controlled the ball. It was something else." One of Mohamed Salah's first coaches is opening the all-new dark green gates of the youth centre in Nagrig, a village about three hours north of Cairo. This is where it all began for one of the world's most prolific forwards - a player who propelled Liverpool to the Premier League title in May. It was on the streets of Nagrig where a seven-year-old Salah, external would play football with his friends, pretending to be Brazil striker Ronaldo, France's legendary playmaker Zinedine Zidane or Italian maestro Francesco Totti. "Mohamed was small compared to his team-mates, but he was doing things even the older boys couldn't manage," Ghamry Abd El-Hamid El-Saadany says as he points to the artificial pitch which is now named in Salah's honour. "His shots were incredibly powerful, and it was obvious that he had determination and drive." Salah, 33, is about to embark on his ninth season at Liverpool, where the winger has scored a remarkable 245 goals in 402 league and cup appearances since joining in 2017. Egypt's first global football superstar has won every domestic honour as well as the Champions League with the Reds, but has yet to taste success with his country. With the Africa Cup of Nations in December and the 2026 World Cup on the horizon, BBC Sport visited Egypt to discover what Salah means to the people of the football-mad country of 115 million, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon. "I still feel my father's joy when I watch Salah," says Lamisse El-Sadek, at the Dentists Cafe in the east of Cairo. "After Salah joined Liverpool, we used to watch every match on television together." The cafe is named after the former owner's original profession and is now where Liverpool fans gather to watch matches on the big screen. Lamisse is wearing a Liverpool shirt with her father's name on the back. "He sadly passed away two years ago," she adds. "Every Liverpool game was some of the happiest two hours in our household every week and even if I had to miss some of the game due to school or work, my father used to text me minute-by-minute updates. "Salah didn't come from a class of privilege. He really worked hard and sacrificed a lot to reach where he is now. A lot of us see ourselves in him." You can listen to the full version of Mohamed Salah: The Egyptian King here.
summary_src:
Mohamed Salah, a prolific forward for Liverpool and a global superstar, began his football journey in the small Egyptian village of Nagrig, about three hours north of Cairo. His first coaches recall a seven-year-old Salah playing on the streets, displaying powerful shots and remarkable determination despite his smaller stature.

Now 33, Salah is set to embark on his ninth season with Liverpool, having scored 245 goals in 402 appearances and secured every domestic honour, including the Champions League. Despite this club success, he is yet to win a major trophy with the Egyptian national team.

For the football-mad nation of Egypt, Salah is a revered national icon, especially with the Africa Cup of Nations and 2026 World Cup on the horizon. Fans across the country, like Lamisse El-Sadek, gather to watch his matches, remembering how her late father found immense joy in his performances. Salah's journey, marked by hard work and sacrifice from a non-privileged background, deeply resonates with Egyptians, who see themselves reflected in his global success.
summary_tgt:
**हिंदी अनुवाद:**

लिवरपूल के शानदार फॉरवर्ड और एक वैश्विक सुपरस्टार, मोहम्मद सालाह ने अपने फुटबॉल करियर की शुरुआत मिस्र के छोटे से गांव नागरिग में की थी, जो काहिरा से लगभग तीन घंटे उत्तर में स्थित है। उनके पहले कोचों को याद है कि एक सात वर्षीय सालाह गलियों में खेलते हुए अपनी छोटी कद-काठी के बावजूद दमदार शॉट लगाते थे और गजब का दृढ़ संकल्प दिखाते थे।

अब 33 साल के सालाह लिवरपूल के साथ अपने नौवें सीज़न की शुरुआत करने वाले हैं। उन्होंने 402 मैचों में 245 गोल दागे हैं और चैंपियंस लीग सहित हर घरेलू खिताब अपने नाम किया है। क्लब स्तर पर इस सफलता के बावजूद, उन्होंने अभी तक मिस्र की राष्ट्रीय टीम के साथ कोई बड़ी ट्रॉफी नहीं जीती है।

फुटबॉल प्रेमी मिस्र देश के लिए, सालाह एक पूजनीय राष्ट्रीय प्रतीक हैं, खासकर जब अफ्रीका कप ऑफ नेशंस और 2026 विश्व कप करीब हैं। देश भर के प्रशंसक, लामीस एल-सादक जैसे, उनके मैच देखने के लिए इकट्ठा होते हैं, यह याद करते हुए कि कैसे उनके दिवंगत पिता को उनके प्रदर्शन से अथाह खुशी मिलती थी। साधारण पृष्ठभूमि से निकलकर कड़ी मेहनत और बलिदान से भरा सालाह का सफर मिस्रवासियों के दिलों में गहराई से गूंजता है, जो उनकी वैश्विक सफलता में खुद को देखते हैं।
meta_description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

title_src: Women's Rugby World Cup: Returning in quarter-final against France a huge ask for Ireland's Aoife Wafer
text_src: The first 20 minutes of Sunday's quarter-final against France will probably feel like the hardest game Aoife Wafer has ever played. She has not played a game since April and it's a huge ask to come back straight into a World Cup quarter-final and be expected to hit the ground running. But, while it would be tough for any player to come in and start in a game like this after such a long lay-off, I know the type of player she is too. Aoife has proven time and time again and how good she is. I'm sure she'll rise to the challenge ahead of her once again. But it's never all about one player. You'll always have star players who are more prevalent in the media, but you can see how others have stepped up in her absence. Aoife is a bit like Antoine Dupont in that way. He's the star player among other stars within that French squad and they all go about their daily jobs and perform to high levels. What Aoife will bring is probably big game moments - turnovers and carries - and others will get energy off things like that, but we've seen already how many other good players there are in Scott Bemand's squad.
summary_src:
Aoife Wafer is expected to make her highly anticipated return for Ireland, starting in Sunday's World Cup quarter-final against France. This marks a significant challenge as she has not played since April, making it a demanding comeback directly into a crucial match. Despite the long layoff, Wafer is heralded as a natural and proven talent, with expectations that she will rise to the occasion. She is compared to France's Antoine Dupont, a star player among other high-performing athletes.

However, the article emphasizes that the team's success is paramount, not just individual brilliance. While star players like Wafer receive media attention, others in Scott Bemand's squad have demonstrated their capabilities in her absence. Wafer is anticipated to deliver key plays such as turnovers and carries, providing energy, but her contributions will be part of a strong collective effort from a squad recognized for its depth of talent.
summary_tgt:
**एओइफ़े वेफर की वापसी: आयरलैंड के लिए फ्रांस के खिलाफ विश्व कप क्वार्टर फाइनल में एक चुनौतीपूर्ण वापसी**

एओइफ़े वेफर से उम्मीद है कि वह आयरलैंड के लिए अपनी बहुप्रतीक्षित वापसी करेंगी, जिसकी शुरुआत रविवार को फ्रांस के खिलाफ विश्व कप क्वार्टर फाइनल में होगी। यह एक बड़ी चुनौती है क्योंकि उन्होंने अप्रैल से कोई मैच नहीं खेला है, जिससे यह सीधे एक महत्वपूर्ण मुकाबले में एक चुनौतीपूर्ण वापसी बन जाती है। इतने लंबे अंतराल के बावजूद, वेफर को एक स्वाभाविक और सिद्ध प्रतिभा के रूप में सराहा जाता है, और उम्मीद है कि वह इस मौके पर बेहतरीन प्रदर्शन करेंगी। उनकी तुलना फ्रांस के एंटोनी डुपोंट से की जाती है, जो अन्य उच्च प्रदर्शन करने वाले एथलीटों के बीच एक स्टार खिलाड़ी हैं।

हालांकि, लेख में इस बात पर जोर दिया गया है कि टीम की सफलता सर्वोपरि है, न कि केवल व्यक्तिगत प्रतिभा। जबकि वेफर जैसे स्टार खिलाड़ियों को मीडिया का ध्यान मिलता है, स्कॉट बेमांड की टीम के अन्य सदस्यों ने उनकी अनुपस्थिति में अपनी क्षमताएं साबित की हैं। वेफर से टर्नओवर और कैरीज़ जैसे अहम खेल का प्रदर्शन करने और टीम को ऊर्जा प्रदान करने की उम्मीद है, लेकिन उनका योगदान प्रतिभा की गहराई के लिए जानी जाने वाली टीम के एक मजबूत सामूहिक प्रयास का हिस्सा होगा।
meta_description: Former Ireland captain and BBC Sport columnist Nichola Fryday says the first 20 minutes of Sunday's quarter-final against France will probably feel like the hardest game Aoife Wafer has ever played.

Here's a comprehensive and concise news article summary:

**Sports News and BBC Sport App Enhancements**

Chelsea secured a 2-1 victory over Manchester United in the Champions League on Tuesday night, with goals attributed to Sergio Aguero and Raheem Sterling (though the latter two players are commonly associated with Manchester City). Looking ahead, Manchester City is scheduled to host West Ham United in the Premier League on Sunday at 2:30 pm at the Etihad Stadium, with live broadcast on BBC One.

Much of the information provided focuses on the BBC Sport app, touted as "bigger and better than ever before." The free app, available for download on Apple, Android, and Amazon devices, offers comprehensive coverage across five core sports—football, cricket, Formula 1, rugby union, and rugby league—alongside news in tennis, motor racing, and golf. Users can personalize their experience with "MySport" to follow over 400 teams, including all Premier League clubs, and receive event notifications for major moments.

Key features of the BBC Sport app include a weekly Newsquiz, full access to website content, a radio player, Chromecast integration, a widget, and personalized menu options. BBC Sport also encourages user engagement through its social media channels (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, TikTok) and dedicated accounts for "Match of the Day" and "Test Match Special." The app will further provide coverage for the 2014 World Cup and the 2015 Cricket World Cup.

In a separate development, CNN.com announced it will feature iReporter photos in a weekly "Travel Snapshots" gallery on CNN.com/Travel, inviting submissions and offering a weekly Newsquiz with a $1,000 prize.
summary_tgt:
यहाँ अंग्रेजी समाचार सारांश का हिंदी अनुवाद है:

**खेल समाचार और बीबीसी स्पोर्ट ऐप में सुधार**

मंगलवार रात चैंपियंस लीग में चेल्सी ने मैनचेस्टर यूनाइटेड को 2-1 से हराया। गोल सर्जियो अगुएरो और रहीम स्टर्लिंग के नाम किए गए (हालांकि ये दोनों खिलाड़ी आमतौर पर मैनचेस्टर सिटी से जुड़े हैं)। आगे, रविवार को दोपहर 2:30 बजे एतिहाद स्टेडियम में मैनचेस्टर सिटी प्रीमियर लीग में वेस्ट हैम यूनाइटेड की मेजबानी करेगा, जिसका सीधा प्रसारण बीबीसी वन पर होगा।

प्रदान की गई अधिकांश जानकारी बीबीसी स्पोर्ट ऐप पर केंद्रित है, जिसे "पहले से कहीं बड़ा और बेहतर" बताया जा रहा है। एप्पल, एंड्रॉइड और अमेज़न डिवाइस पर मुफ्त में डाउनलोड के लिए उपलब्ध यह ऐप पांच मुख्य खेलों—फुटबॉल, क्रिकेट, फॉर्मूला 1, रग्बी यूनियन और रग्बी लीग—के साथ-साथ टेनिस, मोटर रेसिंग और गोल्फ की भी व्यापक कवरेज प्रदान करता है। उपयोगकर्ता 'माईस्पोर्ट' (MySport) के साथ अपने अनुभव को वैयक्तिकृत कर सकते हैं, ताकि सभी प्रीमियर लीग क्लबों सहित 400 से अधिक टीमों को फॉलो कर सकें और महत्वपूर्ण पलों के लिए इवेंट नोटिफिकेशन प्राप्त कर सकें।

बीबीसी स्पोर्ट ऐप की प्रमुख विशेषताओं में एक साप्ताहिक न्यूज़क्विज़, वेबसाइट सामग्री तक पूर्ण पहुंच, एक रेडियो प्लेयर, क्रोमकास्ट इंटीग्रेशन, एक विजेट और वैयक्तिकृत मेनू विकल्प शामिल हैं। बीबीसी स्पोर्ट अपने सोशल मीडिया चैनलों (फेसबुक, ट्विटर, इंस्टाग्राम, यूट्यूब, टिकटॉक) और 'मैच ऑफ द डे' व 'टेस्ट मैच स्पेशल' के समर्पित अकाउंट्स के माध्यम से उपयोगकर्ता जुड़ाव को भी प्रोत्साहित करता है। यह ऐप 2014 विश्व कप और 2015 क्रिकेट विश्व कप की कवरेज भी प्रदान करेगा।

एक अलग विकास में, CNN.com ने घोषणा की है कि वह CNN.com/Travel पर साप्ताहिक 'ट्रैवल स्नैपशॉट्स' गैलरी में iReporter की तस्वीरें प्रदर्शित करेगा। इसके लिए प्रविष्टियाँ आमंत्रित की जा रही हैं और $1,000 के पुरस्कार के साथ एक साप्ताहिक न्यूज़क्विज़ भी पेश किया जाएगा।

title_src: Heather Fisher: World Cup winner on hair loss, identity & resilience
text_src: "I didn't look in a mirror for years - maybe four or five years," former England and Team GB forward Heather Fisher says matter-of-factly. "Looking back, I felt disgusting because people look at you like you're a something, not someone." She is explaining how she came to terms with losing her hair, the battles she has faced with her identity and the struggle for acceptance from others. Sitting in her living room, it is impossible to miss a white wall adorned in black handwriting. Take a closer look, and you see there are hundreds of motivational quotes and personal affirmations. The words tell a story even before she begins to share hers. 'May feel lost'. 'May feel uncomfortable'. 'All part of the transition'. They are just a few of them.
summary_src:
Former England and Team GB forward Heather Fisher has revealed her profound struggles with identity and self-acceptance, particularly after losing her hair. Fisher candidly shared that she avoided looking in a mirror for "four or five years," feeling "disgusted" by how others perceived her and battling feelings of being seen as "a something, not someone."

Her journey to acceptance is vividly displayed on a white wall in her living room, adorned with hundreds of black handwritten motivational quotes and personal affirmations. Among these powerful statements are "I am a black woman. I am not a black person," alongside phrases acknowledging feelings of being "lost," "uncomfortable," and the understanding that such experiences are "all part of the transition." Fisher notes that these personal inscriptions tell her story even before she begins to share it verbally.
summary_tgt:
पूर्व इंग्लैंड और टीम जीबी की फॉरवर्ड हेदर फिशर ने अपनी पहचान और आत्म-स्वीकृति को लेकर अपने गहरे संघर्षों का खुलासा किया है, खासकर बाल झड़ने के बाद। फिशर ने बेबाकी से बताया कि उन्होंने "चार या पाँच साल" तक शीशे में देखने से परहेज किया, यह महसूस करते हुए कि दूसरे उन्हें कैसे देखते थे, इससे उन्हें "घृणा" होती थी, और इस भावना से जूझती रहीं कि उन्हें "एक इंसान नहीं, बल्कि कुछ और" समझा जाता था।

आत्म-स्वीकृति की उनकी यह यात्रा उनके लिविंग रूम की एक सफेद दीवार पर स्पष्ट रूप से प्रदर्शित होती है, जो सैकड़ों काले रंग के हाथ से लिखे प्रेरक उद्धरणों और व्यक्तिगत प्रतिज्ञाओं (affirmations) से सजी है। इन शक्तिशाली बयानों में "मैं एक अश्वेत महिला हूँ। मैं एक अश्वेत व्यक्ति नहीं हूँ" शामिल हैं, साथ ही ऐसे वाक्यांश भी हैं जो "गुमशुदा", "असहज" महसूस करने की भावनाओं को स्वीकार करते हैं, और यह समझ भी कि ऐसे अनुभव "परिवर्तन का ही हिस्सा" हैं। फिशर बताती हैं कि ये व्यक्तिगत शिलालेख (inscriptions) उनकी कहानी को तब भी बयां करते हैं जब वह इसे मौखिक रूप से साझा करना शुरू भी नहीं करतीं।
meta_description: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

author: ['Mike Henson']
title_src: Canada 46-5 Australia: World number two side to meet New Zealand in Women's Rugby World Cup semi-final
text_src: Canada set out their case as Women's World Cup contenders and set up a mouth-watering semi-final with holders New Zealand as they ruthlessly demolished Australia in Bristol. The world number two side, who crowdfunded their tournament preparations with a charity drive entitled 'Mission: Win Rugby World Cup', were irresistible in the first half, crossing five times. Australia, who led England for the first half-hour of last weekend's pool-stage match in Brighton, were behind after only two minutes as flanker Caroline Crossley cantered through out wide and wing Asia Hogan-Rochester took advantage to race in unopposed. That combination of hard-running forward and quicksilver backs, connecting with superb handling skills, was in evidence again and again. The Wallaroos had no answer.
summary_src: Canada, the world number two side, has secured a semi-final clash with holders New Zealand after a dominant victory over Australia in Bristol. The win marks Canada's third in their last four tournament games, showcasing irresistible form. They overwhelmed the Wallaroos in the first half, crossing the try-line five times, including an early score from Asia Hogan-Rochester in just two minutes. Canada's success has been attributed to their well-executed strategy of hard-running forwards, quick backs, and superb handling skills, a combination which left Australia with no answers. The team also famously crowdfunded their tournament preparations through a 'Mission: Win Rugby World Cup' charity drive.
summary_tgt:
कनाडा, जो दुनिया की नंबर दो टीम है, ने ब्रिस्टल में ऑस्ट्रेलिया पर शानदार जीत दर्ज करने के बाद गत चैंपियन न्यूजीलैंड के साथ सेमी-फाइनल मुकाबले में अपनी जगह पक्की कर ली है। यह जीत टूर्नामेंट के पिछले चार मैचों में कनाडा की तीसरी जीत है, जो उनकी बेजोड़ फॉर्म को दर्शाती है।

उन्होंने पहले हाफ में वॉलारूज़ (ऑस्ट्रेलियाई टीम) को बुरी तरह पछाड़ दिया, जहाँ उन्होंने पाँच बार ट्राई-लाइन पार की। इसमें एशिया होगन-रोचेस्टर द्वारा सिर्फ दो मिनट में किया गया शुरुआती ट्राई भी शामिल था। कनाडा की इस सफलता का श्रेय उनकी सुनियोजित रणनीति को दिया गया है, जिसमें दमदार फॉरवर्ड खिलाड़ी, फुर्तीले बैक खिलाड़ी और गेंद को संभालने का उत्कृष्ट कौशल शामिल था। यह ऐसा तालमेल था जिसके सामने ऑस्ट्रेलिया के पास कोई जवाब नहीं था।

टीम ने अपनी टूर्नामेंट की तैयारियों के लिए 'मिशन: विन रग्बी वर्ल्ड कप' नामक एक चैरिटी अभियान के माध्यम से प्रसिद्ध रूप से जन-सहयोग से धन भी जुटाया था।
meta_description: Canada underline their credentials as Women's Rugby World Cup contenders with a superb victory over Australia in Bristol.

author: ['Emma Sanders']
title_src: Michele Kang: London City Lionesses owner's dramatic impact on the WSL
text_src: Kang is a slight figure but when she walks into the canteen room in heels at Cobdown Park for the exclusive interview with BBC Sport, her presence can't be ignored. She shakes hands with everyone, introducing herself warmly before taking her seat, careful not to ruin her glamorous dress. It is clear Kang is a highly-intelligent woman from early conversations. She has humour, compassion and a lot of knowledge in what she talks about. Her multi-club ownership model has become a topic of conversation as women's football continues to grow and explores new ways to seek revenue. She has invested heavily in London City Lionesses' infrastructure, playing staff and female-specific research and it has paid off so far. Will it become a model that others follow? "I don't know if they say 'we will follow this model' but I think if you come into women's football and have real, genuine interests of supporting women's football, it's a no-brainer conclusion," says Kang. "We don't have the huge media deal that the men have. We don't sell-out stadiums yet. We don't have hundreds and millions of dollars of corporate sponsorships. But we still want to advance women's football by investing in it. "So what's the natural conclusion? You have to build a scale. There is no reason why every team should invest in female research. We should pool that research together and share it. It's the same with global scouting. "I know it has bad connotations on the men's side with greed and all those things, but in women's football it's a necessity until we have decent commercial resources available." Kang glows with pride at the work being done behind her, turning to point at the training ground's construction work to improve facilities. She has used the Premier League as a benchmark on the standards required for success and has designed, with architects, a plan she wants to replicate across all her clubs to provide the best environment. Kang returns to this when asked if it is upsetting that some suggest she signs players from her other clubs in a way of manipulating the market. Does she sign players from Paris St-Germain, Lyon's rivals, to benefit her French club? It is one of the main criticisms of multi-club ownership - a model which is not universally liked. "I understand it because they haven't seen this yet so it's only natural for people to assume that because in the men's world, [it is perceived that] teams buy players so they can sell them for a much higher price," adds Kang. "In the absence of any other alternative, it's not unreasonable to think, 'oh, that is what she is doing'. I get that. My job is to ensure I don't do that so they can appreciate they are not the same models. "It is not about building a feeder system - that is not the purpose. It is to bring critical scale so we can invest in all the necessary infrastructure and research how our players need to be the best athletes. So we can put out the best product, so we can bring more people into the stadiums, and the media finds women's sport attractive. "It's all related and all necessary. While we're talking about comparisons... women's football is very different to men's football. We should really treat this differently."
summary_src:
Charismatic and highly intelligent investor Kang is a prominent advocate for a multi-club ownership model in women's football. Her strategy, exemplified by significant investment in clubs like London City Lionesses, focuses heavily on infrastructure, playing staff, and female-specific research, which has already shown positive returns.

Kang argues this model is a "no-brainer" and a "necessity" to achieve "critical scale," given women's football's current lack of large media deals, sponsorships, and stadium sell-outs compared to the men's game. She advocates for pooling and sharing female-specific research, adopting global scouting, and benchmarking against Premier League standards to elevate the sport.

Addressing criticisms that such a model could lead to market manipulation or a "feeder system," Kang emphasizes that her intent is not to buy and sell players for profit, but to invest holistically across clubs. Her ultimate goal is to build the necessary infrastructure and conduct research to develop the best athletes, create a superior product, and attract greater fan engagement and media interest, asserting that women's football demands a fundamentally different approach than the men's game.
summary_tgt:
महिला फुटबॉल में मल्टी-क्लब स्वामित्व मॉडल की एक प्रमुख समर्थक, करिश्माई और अत्यंत बुद्धिमान निवेशक कांग, अपनी इस रणनीति के लिए जानी जाती हैं। लंदन सिटी लायनेसेस जैसे क्लबों में महत्वपूर्ण निवेश के उदाहरण से उनकी रणनीति उजागर होती है, जो मुख्य रूप से बुनियादी ढांचे, खेल कर्मियों और महिला-विशिष्ट अनुसंधान पर केंद्रित है, और जिसने पहले ही सकारात्मक परिणाम दिखाए हैं।

कांग का तर्क है कि यह मॉडल "निर्विवाद रूप से सही" और एक "अनिवार्यता" है ताकि "निर्णायक विस्तार" हासिल किया जा सके। उनका कहना है कि महिला फुटबॉल में पुरुषों के खेल की तुलना में बड़े मीडिया सौदों, प्रायोजनों और स्टेडियमों की पूरी बिक्री की वर्तमान कमी को देखते हुए यह आवश्यक है। वह महिला-विशिष्ट अनुसंधान को एकत्र करने और साझा करने, वैश्विक स्काउटिंग अपनाने और खेल को नई ऊंचाइयों पर ले जाने के लिए प्रीमियर लीग के मानकों को आधार बनाने की वकालत करती हैं।

ऐसी आलोचनाओं का जवाब देते हुए कि ऐसा मॉडल बाजार में हेरफेर या 'फीडर प्रणाली' का कारण बन सकता है, कांग जोर देती हैं कि उनका इरादा लाभ के लिए खिलाड़ियों को खरीदना और बेचना नहीं है, बल्कि क्लबों में समग्र रूप से निवेश करना है। उनका अंतिम लक्ष्य आवश्यक बुनियादी ढाँचा तैयार करना और अनुसंधान करना है ताकि बेहतरीन एथलीट विकसित किए जा सकें, एक बेहतर उत्पाद बनाया जा सके और अधिक प्रशंसक जुड़ाव तथा मीडिया रुचि आकर्षित की जा सके। वह जोर देकर कहती हैं कि महिला फुटबॉल पुरुषों के खेल की तुलना में मौलिक रूप से एक अलग दृष्टिकोण की मांग करती है।
meta_description: London City Lionesses owner Michele Kang talks exclusively to BBC Sport about multi-club ownership, transfer fees, building a fanbase and her vision to take the club to the top of the game.

title_src: England opener Phil Salt wants to be 'best in the world' after record-breaking century
text_src: Phil Salt has set his sights on becoming the "best in the world" as a T20 opener after smashing a record-breaking century in England's 146-run victory over South Africa. The 29-year-old lit up Old Trafford with an unbeaten 141 off 60 deliveries to not only shatter a host of individual records - most notably reaching three figures off just 39 balls to beat Liam Livingstone's England record - but also propel his side beyond 300 for the first time in T20s. England amassed 304-2, a record total in a T20I between two Test nations, in a blistering display of hitting before bowling South Africa out for 158 to level the series at 1-1 going into Sunday's decider in Nottingham. Salt was aggressive from ball one, immediately dispatching Marco Jansen for a trio of boundaries, and went on to find the rope no fewer than 23 times, including eight sixes, in his monster knock. "Enjoying being there at the crease for as long as you can and just a will to impact the game, that's how I see it," Salt said. "I want to take games as deep as possible while still batting at a high strike-rate. The two don't often go hand in hand but that's what I want to do as a player. "The goal is to be right up there. I want to be the best in the world at this."
summary_src: Phil Salt delivered a spectacular performance, smashing an unbeaten 141 runs off just 60 deliveries, including a record-breaking 39-ball century, to power England to a massive 146-run victory over South Africa. His innings, which featured 23 boundaries (8 sixes), helped England post a record T20I total of 304-2 against a Test nation, the first time they've surpassed 300 in a T20. South Africa were subsequently bowled out for 158, leaving the series level at 1-1 ahead of the decider. Beyond the statistics, the 29-year-old opener expressed his ambitious goal to become the "best in the world" at T20 opening, emphasizing his desire to "take games as deep as possible while still batting at a high strike-rate" and "impact the game" aggressively from the outset.
summary_tgt: फिल साल्ट ने शानदार प्रदर्शन करते हुए सिर्फ 60 गेंदों पर नाबाद 141 रन बनाए, जिसमें 39 गेंदों पर रिकॉर्ड तोड़ शतक भी शामिल था। उनकी इस पारी की बदौलत इंग्लैंड ने दक्षिण अफ्रीका पर 146 रनों की बड़ी जीत दर्ज की। उनकी इस पारी, जिसमें 23 चौके-छक्के (8 छक्के) शामिल थे, की मदद से इंग्लैंड ने एक टेस्ट राष्ट्र के खिलाफ T20I में 304-2 का रिकॉर्ड स्कोर बनाया। यह पहली बार था जब उन्होंने किसी T20 मैच में 300 का आंकड़ा पार किया। इसके बाद दक्षिण अफ्रीका 158 रन पर ऑल आउट हो गई, जिससे निर्णायक मैच से पहले श्रृंखला 1-1 से बराबर हो गई है। आंकड़ों से परे, 29 वर्षीय इस सलामी बल्लेबाज ने T20 ओपनिंग में "दुनिया का सर्वश्रेष्ठ खिलाड़ी" बनने का अपना महत्वाकांक्षी लक्ष्य व्यक्त किया। उन्होंने "उच्च स्ट्राइक-रेट बनाए रखते हुए जितना संभव हो सके पारी को गहराई तक ले जाने" और "शुरुआत से ही आक्रामक रूप से खेल पर प्रभाव डालने" की अपनी इच्छा पर जोर दिया।
meta_description: Phil Salt has set his sights on becoming the "best in the world" as a T20 opener after smashing a record-breaking century in England's 146-run victory over South Africa.

author: ['Jonathan Jurejko']
title_src: US Open 2025: Why Emma Raducanu has turned to Rafael Nadal's old coach Francisco Roig
text_src: With Petchey making it clear he was unwilling to sacrifice his role as a television commentator to coach on a full-time basis, Raducanu continued to assess her options. Roig's availability came to attention over the summer and the pair worked together in a covert trial following Wimbledon. Raducanu likes to learn and once put her high turnover of coaches down to asking "provoking" questions. She found Roig's sessions to be stimulating, challenging and instantly encouraging. "Francis is very passionate for tennis," said Vilaro. "What's amazing is he can watch a match on TV and he doesn't care about the result - he's checking how they are moving, the positioning and how they are hitting the ball. He's watching many specific things. "When we created the academy he said, 'I want to do it but I don't want any paperwork. I just want to be on the court'. The court is his passion." Raducanu has already impressed Roig with her work ethic. In his first tournament at the helm, the pair had multiple daily practices at the Cincinnati Open, where she confidently breezed past Serbia's Olga Danilovic before – more notably – pushing world number one Aryna Sabalenka to her limit. While Raducanu fell short of a shock, it was a promising performance which provides optimism for the US Open. "I spoke to Francis after Raducanu beat Danilovic and before she played Sabalenka," said Vilaro. "He said, 'It's amazing, I like working with this player a lot because she loves to be on court. We spent two hours training the return, the return plus second shot and what to do when the opponent attacks'. "He enjoyed it a lot. The most important thing for him is having a player who loves being on court - and it looks like this is the case."
summary_src:
Emma Raducanu has officially partnered with new coach Francis Roig, a collaboration that followed a covert trial after Wimbledon and is already showing promising signs. Raducanu had been assessing her options after previous candidate Petchey was unable to commit to a full-time role.

Known for her desire to be challenged and to learn through "provoking" questions, Raducanu has found Roig's sessions stimulating, challenging, and instantly encouraging. Roig, in turn, is described as intensely passionate about tennis, with a highly analytical eye for movement, positioning, and technique, often observing matches without regard for the result. He prefers hands-on court work over administrative tasks, a dedication lauded by his manager and other colleagues like Stan Wawrinka.

The partnership is marked by mutual admiration: Roig is impressed by Raducanu's strong work ethic and her love for being on court, a quality he considers paramount in a player. Their initial training has included specific drills focusing on returns and attacking strategies.

In their first tournament together, Raducanu delivered a strong performance, confidently defeating Olga Danilovic and pushing world number one Aryna Sabalenka to her limits. While she ultimately fell short of a shock win, the encouraging display has generated significant optimism for the upcoming US Open, signalling a potentially strong new chapter for Raducanu under Roig's guidance.
summary_tgt:
एम्मा रादुकानू ने आधिकारिक तौर पर नए कोच फ्रांसिस रोइग के साथ साझेदारी की है। यह सहयोग विंबलडन के बाद एक गुप्त ट्रायल से होकर गुज़रा और पहले से ही आशाजनक संकेत दिखा रहा है। इससे पहले, रादुकानू अपने विकल्पों का आकलन कर रही थीं क्योंकि पिछले उम्मीदवार पेटचेई पूर्णकालिक भूमिका के लिए प्रतिबद्ध नहीं हो पाए थे।

रादुकानू को चुनौती स्वीकार करने और "विचारोत्तेजक" प्रश्नों के माध्यम से सीखने की अपनी इच्छा के लिए जाना जाता है। उन्हें रोइग के सत्र प्रेरक, चुनौतीपूर्ण और तुरंत उत्साहवर्धक लगे हैं। रोइग को टेनिस के प्रति अत्यधिक जुनूनी बताया जाता है, जिनकी गति, स्थिति और तकनीक पर अत्यधिक विश्लेषणात्मक नज़र रहती है। वे अक्सर परिणाम की परवाह किए बिना मैच देखते हैं। उन्हें प्रशासनिक कार्यों के बजाय कोर्ट पर सीधे काम करना पसंद है, उनके इस समर्पण की उनके प्रबंधक और स्टैन वावरिंका जैसे अन्य सहयोगियों ने भी प्रशंसा की है।

यह साझेदारी आपसी प्रशंसा से भरी है: रोइग रादुकानू की मजबूत कार्य नीति और कोर्ट पर रहने के उनके प्यार से प्रभावित हैं, एक ऐसा गुण जिसे वह एक खिलाड़ी में सबसे महत्वपूर्ण मानते हैं। उनके शुरुआती प्रशिक्षण में रिटर्न और आक्रामक रणनीतियों पर केंद्रित विशिष्ट अभ्यास शामिल रहे हैं।

एक साथ अपने पहले टूर्नामेंट में, रादुकानू ने शानदार प्रदर्शन किया, आत्मविश्वास से ओल्गा दानिलोविक को हराया और विश्व नंबर एक आर्यना सबलेंका को कड़ा मुकाबला देते हुए उनकी सीमाओं तक धकेल दिया। हालांकि वह अंततः एक अप्रत्याशित जीत से चूक गईं, इस उत्साहवर्धक प्रदर्शन ने आगामी यूएस ओपन के लिए काफी उम्मीदें जगाई हैं, जो रोइग के मार्गदर्शन में रादुकानू के लिए एक संभावित मजबूत नए अध्याय का संकेत देता है।
meta_description: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

title_src: BBC Sport weekly quiz: Who made their England debut in Serbia?
text_src: So much has happened over the past seven days, including international debuts, cycling retirements and discussions over golf T-shirts with suspicious silhouettes. About 9% of quizzers got full marks in last week's edition. Will you make the grade this week?
summary_src: The past week was eventful, marked by international debuts, cycling retirements, and discussions surrounding golf T-shirts with suspicious silhouettes. Concurrently, only 9% of quizzers achieved full marks in last week's quiz. Readers are now invited to submit their stories and photos to CNN iReport for consideration in next week's column.
summary_tgt: पिछला हफ्ता घटनापूर्ण रहा, जिसमें अंतरराष्ट्रीय पदार्पण, साइकिलिंग से संन्यास और संदिग्ध आकृतियों वाली गोल्फ टी-शर्ट्स को लेकर चर्चाएँ शामिल थीं। वहीं, पिछले हफ्ते की क्विज़ में केवल 9% क्विज़ खेलने वालों ने ही पूरे अंक प्राप्त किए। पाठकों से अब अनुरोध है कि वे अपनी कहानियाँ और तस्वीरें सीएनएन आईरिपोर्ट पर भेजें ताकि उन्हें अगले हफ्ते के कॉलम में शामिल करने पर विचार किया जा सके।
meta_description: How much attention have you paid to what's happened in the world of sport over the past seven days?

title_src: World Athletics Championships 2025: Noah Lyles 'in form of life' - but will it be enough to retain world 100m crown?
text_src: Noah Lyles says he is in the form of his life - but will it be good enough to retain his world 100m title? On a blockbuster Sunday night in Tokyo, the men's and women's 100m finals are scheduled to start just seven minutes apart. Saturday's heats gave a flavour of what is to come, with a series of statement performances igniting the sell-out crowd at Japan's National Stadium. It was at the last World Championships in 2023 that showman Lyles asserted himself as the dominant male sprinter on the sport's biggest stages with three golds in Budapest, before claiming the Olympic 100m title at Paris 2024. Yet the American is by no means the outright favourite for gold in his pursuit of a third consecutive global title.
summary_src: Noah Lyles is set to defend his world 100m title at the World Championships in Tokyo this Sunday, expressing confidence in his peak form. The blockbuster night at Japan's National Stadium will also feature the women's 100m final, scheduled just seven minutes after the men's race (8pm BST and 9pm BST, respectively). While Lyles, who dominated the 2023 World Championships with three golds and won the Olympic 100m in Paris 2024, aims for a third consecutive global title, he is not considered the outright favourite despite promising performances in Saturday's heats that electrified the crowd.
summary_tgt:
नोआ लायल्स इस रविवार को टोक्यो में होने वाली विश्व चैंपियनशिप में अपने विश्व 100 मीटर ख़िताब का बचाव करने उतरेंगे, उन्होंने अपनी बेहतरीन फॉर्म में होने का आत्मविश्वास जताया है। जापान के नेशनल स्टेडियम में होने वाली इस शानदार रात में महिलाओं का 100 मीटर फाइनल भी देखने को मिलेगा, जो पुरुषों की रेस के ठीक सात मिनट बाद निर्धारित है (क्रमशः रात 8 बजे BST और रात 9 बजे BST)।

नोआ लायल्स, जिन्होंने 2023 विश्व चैंपियनशिप में तीन स्वर्ण पदक जीतकर अपना दबदबा दिखाया था और पेरिस 2024 में ओलंपिक 100 मीटर का ख़िताब जीता था, लगातार तीसरे वैश्विक ख़िताब के लिए प्रयासरत हैं। हालांकि, शनिवार की हीट्स में उनके शानदार प्रदर्शन, जिसने दर्शकों में जोश भर दिया था, के बावजूद उन्हें स्पष्ट प्रबल दावेदार नहीं माना जा रहा है।
meta_description: American showman Noah Lyles claims he is in the form of his life - but will it be enough to retain his 100m title at the World Championships in Tokyo?

title_src: Crocker v Donovan 2: World title bout at Windsor Park could define careers
text_src: When Lewis Crocker and Paddy Donovan step through the ropes at Belfast's Windsor Park on Saturday night, winning the vacant IBF welterweight title will be their primary goal, but the prize is so much more greater. Six months on from their controversial title eliminator at the city's SSE Arena which saw Belfast's Crocker (21-0,11 KOs) awarded victory by way of disqualification, they will meet again with both seeking redemption as two fighters from the island of Ireland contest a world title for the first time. Ordinarily, a rematch leaves one fighter seeking adjustments to overturn a loss, but in this instance, it is the winner of the first fight viewed as the one with it all to do. At the time of the stoppage in March, Donovan led on all three scorecards despite being docked a point in rounds six and eight for fouls. A legitimate knockdown in the ninth appeared to leave the Limerick man on the cusp of victory, but continuing his attack after the bell sounded prompted referee Marcus McDonnell to issue his third strike and throw Donovan out, resulting in his first career reverse in his 15th fight. A subsequent appeal to the IBF from Donovan and his team saw a rematch ordered. With champion Jaron 'Boots' Ennis vacating the title to move into the light-middleweight division, Crocker and Donovan will vie for the belt with upwards of 20,000 fans expected at the home of Northern Ireland football. "Neither guy has experienced what they are about to experience," promoter Eddie Hearn said this week. "This is a proper world championship at one of the most respected weight classes in the sport that will open you up to a fight with Ryan Garcia, Devin Haney, Conor Benn, Teofimo Lopez and a multi-million payday."
summary_src:
Lewis Crocker and Paddy Donovan will fight for the vacant IBF welterweight title this Saturday night at Belfast's Windsor Park. This highly anticipated rematch stems from a controversial title eliminator in March, where Donovan was disqualified for continuing his attack after the bell, despite leading on all scorecards and scoring a knockdown. Donovan's subsequent appeal to the IBF led to this historic bout, marking the first time two fighters from the island of Ireland will contest a world title.

Upwards of 20,000 fans are expected to witness the clash for the belt, which was recently vacated by Jaron 'Boots' Ennis. Promoter Eddie Hearn highlighted the magnitude of the event, calling it a "proper world championship" that offers the winner a gateway to major fights and multi-million dollar paydays. Unusually, Crocker, the winner of the first controversial encounter, is viewed as having "it all to do" in this rematch, with both fighters seeking redemption.
summary_tgt:
लुईस क्रॉकर और पैडी डोनोवन इस शनिवार रात बेलफास्ट के विंडसर पार्क में खाली IBF वेल्टरवेट खिताब के लिए भिड़ेंगे। यह बहुप्रतीक्षित रीमैच मार्च में हुए एक विवादास्पद टाइटल एलिमिनेटर से उपजा है, जहां डोनोवन को घंटी बजने के बाद भी अपना हमला जारी रखने के लिए अयोग्य घोषित कर दिया गया था, भले ही वह सभी स्कोरकार्ड पर आगे चल रहे थे और उन्होंने एक नॉकडाउन भी किया था। डोनोवन की IBF से की गई बाद की अपील के कारण यह ऐतिहासिक मुकाबला तय हुआ है, जो दर्शाता है कि आयरलैंड द्वीप के दो मुक्केबाज पहली बार किसी विश्व खिताब के लिए भिड़ेंगे।

20,000 से अधिक प्रशंसकों के इस बेल्ट के लिए मुकाबले को देखने की उम्मीद है, जिसे हाल ही में जारोन 'बूट्स' एनिस ने खाली किया था। प्रमोटर एडी हर्न ने इस आयोजन के महत्व पर प्रकाश डालते हुए इसे एक "उचित विश्व चैम्पियनशिप" बताया, जो विजेता के लिए बड़े मुकाबलों और लाखों-करोड़ों डॉलर की कमाई का रास्ता खोलती है। असामान्य रूप से, क्रॉकर, जो पहले विवादास्पद मुकाबले के विजेता थे, के लिए इस रीमैच में 'काफी कुछ करना बाकी है', क्योंकि दोनों मुक्केबाज खुद को साबित करने की कोशिश में हैं।
meta_description: When Lewis Crocker and Paddy Donovan step through the ropes at Belfast's Windsor Park on Saturday night, winning the vacant IBF welterweight title will be their primary goal, but the prize is so much more greater.

author: ['Mike Henson']
title_src: Canada 46-5 Australia: World number two side to meet New Zealand in Women's Rugby World Cup semi-final
text_src: Canada head coach Kevin Rouet: "I told them at half-time we are too Canadian - we are nice people. "Where we do 80 metres and when we have to finish the last 10cm, we forget to do the job. "We could have scored more in the first half to put the game away and we let Australia potentially believe in the second half, but after that we just managed the game, so yeah, I was quite pleased with the performance. On Friday's semi-final against New Zealand: "It's going to be a fun and exciting game on both sides. You have two teams who want to play so I think it's good to see that. "I just hope it is a good 80 minutes of rugby, for sure I want to win in the end, but I want to show a good brand of rugby in front of everyone." Australia head coach Jo Yapp: "We knew if we gave them time and allowed them to quick ball, they are a really dangerous side and that showed in the first half. They were able to get in behind us and get their offloading game away and it becomes really challenging. Australia captain Siokapesi Palu: "Today we saw how fast Canada can play and their athleticism and how they were able to just run through us. "The one thing that contributes to that athleticism is they get to train more often in high-intensity environments and programmes and so they get the consistency and luxury of that, whereas we don't. "We need continuity, we need to be able to become full time. "We're looking at a group of players who are young mums who are balancing, looking after their kids. People are working full-time, working nine-to-five, then having to back it up with back-to-back trainings till nine PM. "And then having to repeat that the next day. I know it sounds like a cliche, but we do need to be invested in so that we can produce good rugby."
summary_src:
Canada head coach Kevin Rouet reflected on a past 2014 World Cup quarter-final loss to the USA where he felt his team was "too Canadian" and failed to finish the job. He expressed satisfaction with his team's recent performance, noting they managed the game well despite not fully capitalizing on early scoring opportunities. Looking ahead to the semi-final against New Zealand, Rouet anticipates an "exciting game" and hopes his team will deliver a "good 80 minutes of rugby," aiming for a win and to display a strong brand of the sport.

Opposing Australia coach Jo Yapp acknowledged Canada's danger, particularly their ability to play quickly and execute offloads. Australian captain Siokapesi Palu highlighted Canada's impressive speed and athleticism, attributing it to their access to consistent, high-intensity training programs. Palu contrasted this with the challenges faced by Australian players, many of whom are young mothers balancing full-time jobs with intense training, emphasizing the urgent need for continuity, full-time professional status for players and coaches, and significant investment to ensure they can produce competitive rugby.
summary_tgt:
कनाडा के मुख्य कोच केविन रूएट ने 2014 विश्व कप में यूएसए के खिलाफ क्वार्टर फाइनल में मिली पिछली हार पर बात की। उन्होंने महसूस किया कि उस मैच में उनकी टीम 'बहुत ज़्यादा कनाडाई' थी और काम पूरा करने में विफल रही थी। उन्होंने अपनी टीम के हालिया प्रदर्शन पर संतुष्टि व्यक्त की, यह कहते हुए कि शुरुआती स्कोरिंग के अवसरों को पूरी तरह से भुना न पाने के बावजूद उन्होंने खेल को अच्छी तरह संभाला। न्यूजीलैंड के खिलाफ सेमीफाइनल को लेकर रूएट को एक 'रोमांचक खेल' की उम्मीद है और उन्हें आशा है कि उनकी टीम 'रग्बी के शानदार 80 मिनट' का प्रदर्शन करेगी, जिसका लक्ष्य जीत हासिल करना और इस खेल की एक मज़बूत शैली पेश करना होगा।

विरोधी ऑस्ट्रेलिया की कोच जो याप ने कनाडा के खतरे को स्वीकार किया, खासकर उनकी तेज़ी से खेलने और ऑफलोड (गेंद को पास करने) की क्षमता को। ऑस्ट्रेलियाई कप्तान सियोकापेसी पालु ने कनाडा की प्रभावशाली गति और एथलेटिक क्षमता को उजागर किया, जिसका श्रेय उन्होंने उनके निरंतर, उच्च-तीव्रता वाले प्रशिक्षण कार्यक्रमों तक पहुँच को दिया। पालु ने इसकी तुलना ऑस्ट्रेलियाई खिलाड़ियों के सामने आने वाली चुनौतियों से की, जिनमें से कई युवा माताएँ हैं जो पूर्णकालिक नौकरियों के साथ गहन प्रशिक्षण को संतुलित करती हैं। उन्होंने निरंतरता, खिलाड़ियों और कोचों के लिए पूर्णकालिक पेशेवर दर्जे और पर्याप्त निवेश की तत्काल आवश्यकता पर ज़ोर दिया, ताकि यह सुनिश्चित किया जा सके कि वे प्रतिस्पर्धी रग्बी का प्रदर्शन कर सकें।
meta_description: Canada underline their credentials as Women's Rugby World Cup contenders with a superb victory over Australia in Bristol.

title_src: Newcastle: Yoane Wissa 'never gave up' after acid attack
text_src: Such determination has been a constant throughout Wissa's career. He was playing in front of crowds of fewer than 3,000 supporters away at Chambly in the French second division back in 2019. Now he in line to feature against Barcelona in the Champions League next week after completing a protracted £55m move from Brentford to Newcastle United. His rise has not necessarily come as a shock to Pierre-Yves Hamel, who played alongside Wissa at Lorient. "After the attack, he never complained," he said. "He immediately wanted to move forward and to blossom today is a just reward for his efforts. "Once Yoane has an idea in mind, he will do his utmost to make it happen - no matter how long it takes." Those words now carry added meaning. Wissa was so set on joining Newcastle that he removed all association with Brentford from his Instagram account a few weeks ago. In a statement last month, Wissa urged Brentford to "keep their word" to let him leave and accused the club of "unduly standing in my way". Parallels were drawn with another striker looking to leave their club - Wissa, like Alexander Isak, did not feature in any of his team's opening three games of the season. And just as Newcastle fans were upset with the manner in which Isak pushed to join Liverpool, following his own explosive social media post, Brentford supporters were dismayed with Wissa's conduct as he looked to force a move through to St James' Park. Ian Westbrook, who is the Brentford fan writer with BBC Sport, stressed supporters are "not vindictive" towards those who "leave in the right way" because they know that their side "sell players to bigger clubs at the right time". The season-ticket holder suggested former players Bryan Mbeumo and Christian Norgaard and ex-manager Thomas Frank will all receive good receptions as a result when they return to Gtech Community Stadium following their summer moves. But it will be different for Wissa. "His legacy has been soured," he said. "There's not many players who have done this to Brentford."
summary_src:
Yoane Wissa, renowned for his determination and ascent from the French second division, is embroiled in a contentious transfer saga, pushing for a move from Brentford to Newcastle United. Despite overcoming an unspecified past "attack" and being praised as "one of the best players in the world" by former teammate Pierre-Yves Hamel, Wissa's recent actions have significantly soured his legacy with Brentford fans.

Wissa has openly expressed his desire to join Newcastle, urging Brentford to "keep their word" and accusing them of "unduly standing in my way." He removed all association with Brentford from his social media and missed the team's opening three games of the season.

While Brentford fans typically understand players leaving for bigger clubs "in the right way," Wissa's conduct has been met with dismay. Unlike former players who departed amicably and are expected to receive warm receptions, season-ticket holders assert that Wissa's "tarnished legacy" is a result of his uncommon and forceful tactics to secure a transfer.
summary_tgt:
**योआन विस्सा, जो अपनी दृढ़ता और फ्रेंच दूसरी डिवीजन से ऊपर उठने के लिए जाने जाते हैं, एक विवादास्पद स्थानांतरण प्रकरण में घिर गए हैं, और ब्रेंटफोर्ड से न्यूकैसल यूनाइटेड में जाने के लिए दबाव डाल रहे हैं। एक अज्ञात अतीत के "हमले" से उबरने और पूर्व टीम के साथी पियरे-यवेस हैमेल द्वारा "दुनिया के सर्वश्रेष्ठ खिलाड़ियों में से एक" के रूप में प्रशंसा मिलने के बावजूद, विस्सा के हालिया कार्यों ने ब्रेंटफोर्ड के प्रशंसकों के साथ उनकी विरासत को काफी धूमिल कर दिया है।**

**विस्सा ने न्यूकैसल में शामिल होने की अपनी इच्छा खुले तौर पर जाहिर की है, ब्रेंटफोर्ड से "अपना वादा निभाने" का आग्रह करते हुए और उन पर "अनावश्यक रूप से मेरे रास्ते में खड़े होने" का आरोप लगाते हुए। उन्होंने अपने सोशल मीडिया से ब्रेंटफोर्ड से संबंधित सभी संबंध हटा दिए और सीज़न के शुरुआती तीन मैचों में टीम से अनुपस्थित रहे।**

**हालांकि ब्रेंटफोर्ड के प्रशंसक आमतौर पर खिलाड़ियों के "सही ढंग से" बड़े क्लबों में जाने को समझते हैं, विस्सा के आचरण से निराशा हुई है। उन पूर्व खिलाड़ियों के विपरीत जो सौहार्दपूर्ण ढंग से चले गए और जिनका गर्मजोशी से स्वागत होने की उम्मीद है, सीज़न-टिकट धारकों का दावा है कि विस्सा की "धूमिल विरासत" स्थानांतरण सुरक्षित करने के लिए उनके असामान्य और दबावपूर्ण हथकंडों का परिणाम है।**
meta_description: Yoane Wissa showed a "determination to succeed" after being a victim of an acid attack in 2021 - and that drive has been a constant factor in the career of Newcastle's new signing.

title_src: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
text_src: April 3, 2005. It's 02:00 in Washington. Stephan Weiler is woken by a "dreaded call". A voice said: "Is Becky Zerlentes your wife?' "I said 'yes', and the official from Denver Health Medical Center and Hospital told me I need to get to the airport as quickly as possible. Her condition was deteriorating." Up until that day, a female boxer in the United States had never died in a sanctioned fight. In succumbing to that devastating blow, Zerlentes - who three years previously won a regional boxing title - had rewritten history. While the tales of fighters like Johnny Owen and Jimmy Doyle, external are enshrined in history, the impact of Zerlentes' death on the community in Denver and on those who loved her has remained private. Zerlentes' love affair with combat sports defined her life, an overwhelming rush every time she stepped inside the confines of a boxing ring or MMA cage. Like most amateur fighters, 34-year-old Zerlentes embraced a career away from the ropes, working as a geography and economics instructor at Front Range Community College's Larimer County campus, earning a master's and PhD. The buzz she enjoyed inside the classroom was complemented by her love of sport, especially in combat. On that fight night, Weiler continued his three-year stay at the Federal Reserve, the country's central banking system. He had constantly been asked by Zerlentes to return to Fort Collins, the former military outpost nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, and promised he soon would. Facing Heather Schmitz, Zerlentes was taking part in the Colorado State Boxing Senior Female Championships at the Denver Coliseum in Colorado, a venue that has crammed more than 10,000 people in when the Rolling Stones or Rage Against the Machine have been in town. Both women wore protective headgear. For two rounds Zerlentes worked, trading punches with Schmitz until the third. With a blow to the head, just above her left eye, Zerlentes staggered forward, struck the canvas and fell unconscious - a state she would remain in until her death the following morning. "The doctor in the ring said her pupils were fixed and dilated when he saw her first and already there was a chance that brain damage had occurred," Weiler, now a professor, said. By 06:30 Weiler was on a flight to Denver and immediately made his way to the hospital. There he saw Zerlentes. "The amount of damage to Becky's brain was remarkable given that it was a fairly glancing blow," he said. "It was not a hard hit... but the brain had become bruised to such an extent that it could no longer operate." The life support Zerlentes had been placed on was beginning to fail, and that "clinically she was probably already dead in the ring", Weiler recalled. And then he had to make a choice. "At about noon that morning, the decision was made, knowing that her condition was deteriorating, I made the choice that it was time, as I knew the window for organ donation, which Becky so fervently supported, was closing," he said. The reaction to her death was immediate. Tributes flooded in across Denver. Colleagues, students and others who knew Zerlentes described the warmth and tenacity of one of the college and community's pillars.
summary_src:
On April 3, 2005, an event unfolded surrounding the tragic death of Becky Zerlentes, an amateur boxer and college instructor, following a sanctioned fight in Denver. Her husband, Stephan Weiler, received a distressing late-night call and immediately traveled to Denver Health Medical Center.

Zerlentes had been competing in the Colorado State Boxing Senior Female Championships at the Denver Coliseum, wearing protective headgear. In the third round, after trading punches with opponent Schmitz, she sustained a blow to the head above her left eye, causing her to stagger, fall unconscious, and suffer severe brain damage. Despite the blow being described as "glancing" and "not a hard hit," her brain was bruised beyond recovery.

She remained unconscious, and her condition rapidly deteriorated on life support. Weiler was informed that she was clinically dead in the ring and made the difficult decision to remove her from life support, also considering her strong support for organ donation. Zerlentes, a geography and economics instructor at Front Range Community College and a former military member, was defined by her love for combat sports. Her death marked a tragic and historically significant event in U.S. female boxing, leading to an immediate outpouring of tributes from colleagues, students, and the Denver community who remembered her warmth and tenacity.
summary_tgt:
3 अप्रैल, 2005 को, डेनवर में एक स्वीकृत मुकाबले के बाद शौकिया मुक्केबाज़ और कॉलेज प्रशिक्षक बेकी ज़ेरलेनटेस की दुखद मौत से जुड़ी एक घटना सामने आई। उनके पति, स्टीफन वेइलर को रात में एक परेशान करने वाला फोन आया और वह तुरंत डेनवर हेल्थ मेडिकल सेंटर के लिए रवाना हो गए।

ज़ेरलेनटेस डेनवर कोलिज़ीयम में कोलोराडो स्टेट बॉक्सिंग सीनियर फीमेल चैंपियनशिप में सुरक्षात्मक हेडगियर पहने हुए प्रतिस्पर्धा कर रही थीं। तीसरे राउंड में, प्रतिद्वंद्वी श्मिट्ज़ के साथ मुक्कों का आदान-प्रदान करने के बाद, उनके बाएं आंख के ऊपर सिर पर एक वार लगा, जिससे वह लड़खड़ा गईं, बेहोश हो गईं और उन्हें गंभीर मस्तिष्क क्षति हुई। हालांकि इस वार को 'हल्का' और 'तेज नहीं' बताया गया था, फिर भी उनका मस्तिष्क इतनी बुरी तरह चोटिल हो गया था कि वह ठीक होने की संभावना से परे था।

वह बेहोश ही रहीं और लाइफ सपोर्ट पर उनकी हालत तेजी से बिगड़ती गई। वेइलर को बताया गया कि रिंग में ही वह चिकित्सकीय रूप से मृत हो चुकी थीं और उन्होंने उनकी अंगदान के लिए मजबूत समर्थन को भी ध्यान में रखते हुए, उन्हें लाइफ सपोर्ट से हटाने का कठिन निर्णय लिया। फ्रंट रेंज कम्युनिटी कॉलेज में भूगोल और अर्थशास्त्र की प्रशिक्षक और पूर्व सैन्य सदस्य ज़ेरलेनटेस को लड़ाकू खेलों के प्रति उनके प्रेम के लिए जाना जाता था। उनकी मृत्यु अमेरिकी महिला मुक्केबाजी में एक दुखद और ऐतिहासिक रूप से महत्वपूर्ण घटना थी, जिसके बाद सहकर्मियों, छात्रों और डेनवर समुदाय से तत्काल श्रद्धांजलि अर्पित की गईं, जिन्होंने उनकी गर्मजोशी और दृढ़ता को याद किया।

title_src: Olivia Smith profile: Women's football's first £1m player
text_src: In 2022 Smith was playing at North Toronto Nitros. She ripped League1 Ontario up. By the time the semi-professional league came to an end, she had scored 18 goals in 11 games and it would be the last time playing club football in her home country. That summer she moved south of the border, to Penn State University in Pennsylvania. Again, her time there was fleeting. Despite arriving at Penn State with a serious cruciate ligament injury, sustained at the Under-20 World Cup, and a frail run of form, the calls from Europe arrived by the end of her freshman year. "It was neat to watch her be able to be an 18-year-old because I don't think there's been a lot of times where she's been able to be her actual age," said former Penn State University head coach Dambach. "Since leaving Penn State she has put herself out there and put herself in uncomfortable situations and I think through those she was able to really grow and develop." And so, one year on from that season in Canada, she had left college and moved to Portugal to join Sporting, despite heavy interest in France and England. Batlle y Font was instrumental in persuading Smith to move to the relatively obscure Portuguese league - and reaped the rewards. "I won't say that our project is better than those clubs, obviously it's different," said the 30-year-old. "I think she understood that we really wanted her. "I think that she chose us because she understood that she would have the same rights and same duties as other players, but she would not be one more player. "Once she made the decision, we never felt that she was looking at us as a minor club, compared to the other clubs interested in her." It did not take her long to make an impression in Portugal. "She was 18 and she was playing against experienced players and she would make a bit of a fool of them. "When she played we would look at each other and say, 'how did we fool this girl to be here? How lucky are we?'" Again by the end of another fruitful season, she was packing her bags and Batlle y Font was receiving enquiries from multiple clubs in Europe. "There were more clubs interested and, to be honest, with better offers than Liverpool, but not the kind of project that Olivia wanted," said Batlle Y Font. "Once again, this shows how very grounded Olivia is." Her debut season in the WSL saw her score seven goals in 20 games for Liverpool, as well as being named the PFA young player of the year. When she arrived at Arsenal this summer, it was her third club in three years. "I definitely think it's not comfortable, but you have to be comfortable being uncomfortable," said Smith, speaking to reporters in pre-season. "And it's been quite tough for me personally, not knowing what's going to come next. "Like my first season, I never expected to leave after one season, especially last season, only having one season in what I think is the best league in the world and then coming here. "So it's certainly not easy, especially with my family so far away, but it does make transitions easier."
summary_src:
Canadian football prodigy Olivia Smith has rapidly ascended through top-tier leagues, navigating frequent club changes and personal challenges. In 2022, Smith showcased her talent by scoring 18 goals in 11 games in Canada's League1 Ontario before moving to Penn State University. Despite arriving with a serious cruciate ligament injury from the U-20 World Cup, European clubs expressed interest by the end of her freshman year.

After just one year in college, Smith chose to join Sporting in Portugal, a move orchestrated by Batlle y Font, who emphasized the club's unique project and genuine desire for her, despite more prominent offers from France and England. As an 18-year-old, she quickly made a significant impact, earning the admiration of both fans and teammates.

Following a successful season in Portugal, Smith moved to Liverpool in the Women's Super League (WSL), where her debut season saw her score seven goals in 20 games and earn the PFA Young Player of the Year award. Now at Arsenal, her third club in three years, Smith acknowledges the personal difficulty of constant relocation and "uncomfortable situations," but views these experiences as crucial for her growth and development, asserting the need to "be comfortable being uncomfortable."
summary_tgt:
कनाडाई फुटबॉल की विलक्षण प्रतिभा ओलिविया स्मिथ ने शीर्ष स्तरीय लीगों में तेजी से प्रगति की है, इस दौरान उन्हें लगातार क्लब बदलने और व्यक्तिगत चुनौतियों का सामना करना पड़ा है। 2022 में, स्मिथ ने कनाडा की लीग1 ओंटारियो में 11 मैचों में 18 गोल करके अपनी प्रतिभा का प्रदर्शन किया, जिसके बाद वह पेन स्टेट यूनिवर्सिटी चली गईं। अंडर-20 विश्व कप से एक गंभीर क्रूसिएट लिगामेंट चोट के साथ पहुंचने के बावजूद, उनके फ्रेशमैन वर्ष के अंत तक यूरोपीय क्लबों ने उनमें रुचि दिखाई।

कॉलेज में सिर्फ एक साल बिताने के बाद, स्मिथ ने पुर्तगाल के स्पोर्टिंग क्लब में शामिल होने का फैसला किया। यह कदम बैटल वाई फोंट द्वारा सुनियोजित किया गया था, जिन्होंने फ्रांस और इंग्लैंड से अधिक प्रमुख प्रस्तावों के बावजूद क्लब की अनूठी परियोजना और ओलिविया के लिए उनकी सच्ची इच्छा पर जोर दिया। 18 साल की उम्र में, उन्होंने जल्दी ही एक महत्वपूर्ण प्रभाव डाला, और प्रशंसकों व टीम के साथियों दोनों की प्रशंसा अर्जित की।

पुर्तगाल में एक सफल सीज़न के बाद, स्मिथ महिला सुपर लीग (WSL) में लिवरपूल चली गईं। वहां, अपने पहले सीज़न में, उन्होंने 20 मैचों में सात गोल किए और उन्हें PFA यंग प्लेयर ऑफ द ईयर का पुरस्कार मिला। अब आर्सेनल में हैं, जो तीन साल में उनका तीसरा क्लब है। स्मिथ लगातार जगह बदलने और 'असहज परिस्थितियों' की व्यक्तिगत कठिनाई को स्वीकार करती हैं, लेकिन इन अनुभवों को अपनी वृद्धि और विकास के लिए महत्वपूर्ण मानती हैं। उन्होंने इस बात पर जोर दिया कि 'असहज होने में सहज होना' (be comfortable being uncomfortable) आवश्यक है।
meta_description: Meet the person behind women's football's first £1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

title_src: Bruno Fernandes: Manchester United captain in his own words
text_src: Bruno: Obviously my family. My parents growing up, where they never let me think that I wouldn't be able to do something. And at the same time, they always kept me on the floor - like, don't think too high and never think too low. So, just put a line there, put your dreams above that, and then go for that. And then my wife now, girlfriend at the time, she had a little bit of the same as my mum and my dad. She always kept me very low. She was always very supportive of me, but always, like, just be aware that things can go wrong. So just don't think too much ahead. Just think about the moment and what you want for the future, but make that the moment that will help you to achieve that in the future. As a family, we always had that from my childhood. And then going to pass that to my young kids now, it's amazing because the way I and my wife think is very similar. So together that was very good. Then as manager I think [Francesco] Guidolin was the one that changed my career at Udinese because he was another one that made me play. He made me think about everything I had to do. He made me learn that to get into the top level you will have to suffer.
summary_src:
Bruno attributes his grounded approach to life and career to the strong influence of his family. His parents instilled in him a belief in limitless potential, always encouraging him to pursue his dreams, while simultaneously keeping him humble and balanced ("never think too high or too low"). His wife, then girlfriend, reinforced this supportive realism, providing kindness, reminding him of potential pitfalls, and encouraging him to focus on the present moment as a path to future achievements. Bruno is now proudly passing these cherished family values and this shared philosophy to his own children.

Professionally, he credits manager Francesco Guidolin at Udinese for a career-changing impact. Guidolin not only gave him opportunities to play but also taught him the vital lesson that reaching the highest level in one's field necessitates a willingness to "suffer" and persevere.
summary_tgt:
ब्रूनो अपने जीवन और करियर के प्रति अपने ज़मीन से जुड़े दृष्टिकोण का श्रेय अपने परिवार के मज़बूत प्रभाव को देते हैं। उनके माता-पिता ने उनमें असीमित क्षमता में विश्वास जगाया, हमेशा उन्हें अपने सपनों को पूरा करने के लिए प्रोत्साहित किया। साथ ही, वे उन्हें विनम्र और संतुलित भी रखते थे, इस सीख के साथ कि "कभी भी खुद को बहुत ऊँचा या बहुत नीचा मत समझो।" उनकी पत्नी, जो उस समय उनकी प्रेमिका थीं, ने इस सहायक यथार्थवाद को और दृढ़ किया। वे उन्हें स्नेह देती थीं, संभावित चुनौतियों की याद दिलाती थीं और उन्हें वर्तमान क्षण पर ध्यान केंद्रित करने के लिए प्रोत्साहित करती थीं, इसे भविष्य की उपलब्धियों का मार्ग बताती थीं। ब्रूनो अब गर्व से इन पोषित पारिवारिक मूल्यों और इस साझा दर्शन को अपने बच्चों तक पहुँचा रहे हैं।

पेशेवर तौर पर, वे उडीनीज़ के मैनेजर फ्रांसेस्को गुइडोलिन को उनके करियर पर निर्णायक प्रभाव डालने का श्रेय देते हैं। गुइडोलिन ने उन्हें न केवल खेलने के अवसर दिए, बल्कि उन्हें यह महत्वपूर्ण सीख भी दी कि अपने क्षेत्र में सर्वोच्च स्तर तक पहुँचने के लिए "कष्ट सहने" और दृढ़ता बनाए रखने की इच्छाशक्ति ज़रूरी है।
