title_src: Canelo vs Crawford: 'Terence Crawford is the new face of boxing'
text_src: Terence Crawford never wanted to be the face of boxing. He said it in fight week. But after dismantling Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez on Mexican Independence weekend, in front of 70,000 in Las Vegas and a likely record-breaking global audience on Netflix, he has no choice. It wasn't just a win. It was a career-defining, legacy-cementing, history-making performance. Crawford became the first male fighter to be undisputed champion across three weight divisions in the four-belt era. Before the fight Alvarez had dismissed Crawford's resume, claiming he had "fought nobody". Within an hour of victory Crawford fired back on social media. "For all the nobodies," he said. Cue a figurative mic drop.
summary_src:
Terence Crawford has solidified his status as the new face of boxing, a role he initially shunned, following his dominant and career-defining victory over Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez. The historic win, witnessed by a massive global audience, saw Crawford become the first male fighter in the four-belt era to be an undisputed champion across three weight divisions, as well as the first to win titles in three different weight classes.

Prior to the fight, Alvarez had dismissed Crawford's resume. In a defiant response on social media shortly after his triumph, Crawford fired back at his detractors, stating, "For all the nobodies." Now the WBC welterweight champion, Crawford is scheduled to fight Wladimir Klitschko in New York on Saturday.
summary_tgt:
टेरेंस क्रॉफर्ड ने सॉल 'कैनेलो' अल्वारेज़ पर अपनी दबदबे वाली और करियर-परिभाषित जीत के बाद बॉक्सिंग के नए चेहरे के रूप में अपनी स्थिति मजबूत कर ली है, एक ऐसी भूमिका जिससे वह शुरू में कतराते थे। एक विशाल वैश्विक दर्शक वर्ग द्वारा देखी गई इस ऐतिहासिक जीत ने क्रॉफर्ड को चार-बेल्ट युग में तीन वेट डिवीजनों में निर्विवाद चैंपियन बनने वाले पहले पुरुष फाइटर के रूप में स्थापित किया। साथ ही, वह तीन अलग-अलग वेट क्लास में खिताब जीतने वाले पहले फाइटर भी बन गए।

इस फाइट से पहले, अल्वारेज़ ने क्रॉफर्ड के करियर रिकॉर्ड को कम आँका था। अपनी जीत के तुरंत बाद सोशल मीडिया पर एक करारा जवाब देते हुए, क्रॉफर्ड ने अपने आलोचकों पर पलटवार किया और कहा, "उन सभी के लिए जो कुछ भी नहीं हैं।" अब डब्ल्यूबीसी वेल्टरवेट चैंपियन क्रॉफर्ड का मुकाबला शनिवार को न्यूयॉर्क में व्लादिमीर क्लिट्स्को से होना तय है।
meta_description: Terence Crawford's win over Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez was a career-defining, legacy-cementing, history-making performance, writes BBC Sport's Kal Sajad.

title_src: World Athletics Championships 2025: Jakob Ingebrigtsen suffers shock 1500m exit
text_src: Jakob Ingebrigtsen described his performance as "terrible" after he suffered a shock exit in the men's 1500m heats at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo. The world outdoor title is the only international 1500m gold medal missing from the Norwegian star's collection after he was beaten by Great Britain's Josh Kerr and Jake Wightman at the past two editions. But the 24-year-old will not have the chance to end that wait inside the stadium where he triumphed in the Olympic 1500m four years ago after finishing eighth in his heat on Sunday. Ingebrigtsen, a two-time Olympic and world champion, has endured an injury-disrupted season and did not race for six months prior to these championships. "I was terrible," Ingebrigtsen told BBC Sport. "The race itself was perfect, especially how it turned out, it was gifted to me. "Unfortunately I have lost too much and I have not been able to prepare. "Of course I'm disappointed but it's a reality check that it was never really going to happen. I was holding on for dear life because I love to compete. "I've been glued to the floor unfortunately. I've not been able to do what is needed, clearly. I just have to look forward."
summary_src: Olympic and two-time world champion Jakob Ingebrigtsen suffered a shock exit in the men's 1500m heats at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, describing his eighth-place finish as "terrible" and "horrible." This outdoor world title is the only 1500m gold medal missing from the Norwegian star's collection, having been beaten in the past two editions. Ingebrigtsen, who famously won Olympic gold at the same stadium four years ago, attributed his performance to an injury-disrupted season, revealing he hadn't raced for six months prior to the championships and lacked sufficient preparation. While disappointed and calling it a "reality check," he expressed his continued love for competition despite acknowledging he has "lost too much" and is uncertain about his future, though he intends to "look forward."
summary_tgt:
ओलंपिक और दो बार के विश्व चैंपियन याकूब इंगब्रिगेत्सेन को टोक्यो में विश्व एथलेटिक्स चैंपियनशिप में पुरुषों की 1500 मीटर हीट में एक चौंकाने वाली हार का सामना करना पड़ा। उन्होंने अपने आठवें स्थान पर रहने को "भयानक" और "खराब" बताया।

यह आउटडोर विश्व खिताब नॉर्वेजियन स्टार के संग्रह में एकमात्र 1500 मीटर स्वर्ण पदक है जो उन्हें अब तक नहीं मिला है, क्योंकि वह पिछले दो संस्करणों में हार चुके हैं। इंगब्रिगेत्सेन, जिन्होंने चार साल पहले उसी स्टेडियम में प्रसिद्ध रूप से ओलंपिक स्वर्ण जीता था, ने अपने प्रदर्शन का कारण चोट से बाधित सीज़न को बताया। उन्होंने खुलासा किया कि उन्होंने चैंपियनशिप से छह महीने पहले कोई दौड़ नहीं लगाई थी और उनकी तैयारी पर्याप्त नहीं थी।

निराश होते हुए और इसे "रियलिटी चेक" बताते हुए, उन्होंने प्रतियोगिता के प्रति अपने निरंतर प्रेम को व्यक्त किया, हालांकि उन्होंने यह भी स्वीकार किया कि उन्होंने "बहुत कुछ खो दिया है" और अपने भविष्य के बारे में अनिश्चित हैं, लेकिन उनका इरादा "आगे देखने" का है।
meta_description: Gold medal contender Jakob Ingebrigtsen says he was "terrible" after suffering a shock exit in the men's 1500m heats at the World Championships in Tokyo.

title_src: World Athletics Championships 2025: Julia Paternain wins marathon bronze
text_src: When Julia Paternain took a surprise third in the women's marathon in Tokyo to claim Uruguay's first medal in World Athletics Championships history, it was winning the English Schools 3,000m title which flashed through her mind. The 25-year-old's family are from Uruguay but she moved to the UK with her parents aged two. She won back-to-back national schools 3,000m titles in 2017 and 2018 and ran for Great Britain at the 2019 European Under-23s Championships, where she finished sixth in the 10,000m. Ranked 288th in the world in the marathon and in only her second competitive race at the distance, Paternain was not expected to vie for a medal in Japan. "My whole family is from Uruguay, but I was thinking back to the English Schools when I ran the 3k," she told BBC Sport. "I remembered the last 200m and this felt just like English Schools." Kenya's Peres Jepchirchir, Olympic champion in Tokyo in 2021, won gold in a time of two hours 24 minutes 43 seconds, beating Ethiopia's Tigst Assefa by two seconds in a thrilling sprint finish. Paternain came home in 2:27.23 but said she was unsure what position she was in as she crossed the line. "I was in shock. This is my second marathon and I was just trying to get from A to B and get to the finish line without my legs giving way," said Paternain, whose father is a professor at Cambridge University. "At halfway I realised I was in the top 12, maybe, and from then I was kind of picking people off. "Usually in races you have people yelling at you that you are in this position, but everything was in Japanese so I had no idea where I was. "When I came into the track I couldn't see a soul, so I was like, 'I have no clue where I am'. "I knew I was somewhere in the top - I was assuming six or five. I didn't know exactly where. I didn't really want to think there was a medal, just in case there wasn't. "I was terrified that that wasn't the finish and that someone was going to be behind me, and I was going to stop and I had another lap to go. "I'm a little bit clueless when I run so I wanted to make sure. I was trying to check with the officials that was definitely the finish."
summary_src:
Julia Paternain made history by securing a surprise bronze medal for Uruguay in the women's marathon at the Tokyo World Athletics Championships, marking the nation's first-ever medal in the event. The 25-year-old, ranked 288th globally and competing in only her second competitive marathon, delivered an unexpected performance, finishing in an impressive 2:27.23.

Paternain, whose family hails from Uruguay but moved to the UK at age two, previously represented Great Britain. She expressed profound shock and disbelief at her unexpected podium finish, revealing her primary goal was simply to complete the race without her legs giving way. She was largely unaware of her position throughout, only realizing she was in the top 12 at the halfway mark and then steadily "picking people off." Confused by the Japanese signage and lack of clear positional updates, she even had to confirm with officials that she had indeed reached the finish line.

Kenya's Peres Jepchirchir clinched the gold medal in a thrilling sprint finish, clocking 2:24.43, just two seconds ahead of Ethiopia's Tigst Assefa.
summary_tgt:
**टोक्यो विश्व एथलेटिक्स चैंपियनशिप: उरुग्वे की जूलिया पटरेनैन ने महिला मैराथन में इतिहास रचा**

टोक्यो विश्व एथलेटिक्स चैंपियनशिप में महिला मैराथन में उरुग्वे के लिए एक अप्रत्याशित कांस्य पदक हासिल कर जूलिया पटरेनैन ने इतिहास रच दिया है। यह इस स्पर्धा में देश का अब तक का पहला पदक है। वैश्विक स्तर पर 288वें स्थान पर रहीं और अपनी केवल दूसरी प्रतिस्पर्धी मैराथन में भाग ले रहीं यह 25 वर्षीय एथलीट ने 2:27.23 के प्रभावशाली समय के साथ दौड़ पूरी कर एक अप्रत्याशित प्रदर्शन किया।

पटरेनैन का परिवार उरुग्वे से है, लेकिन वे दो साल की उम्र में यूके चली गई थीं। उन्होंने पहले ग्रेट ब्रिटेन का प्रतिनिधित्व किया था। उन्होंने अपने अप्रत्याशित पोडियम स्थान पर गहरा सदमा और अविश्वास व्यक्त किया, यह खुलासा करते हुए कि उनका प्राथमिक लक्ष्य केवल दौड़ को पूरा करना था और यह सुनिश्चित करना था कि उनके पैर जवाब न दें। वह पूरी दौड़ के दौरान अपनी स्थिति से काफी हद तक अनजान थीं; उन्हें केवल बीच रास्ते में (हाफवे मार्क) एहसास हुआ कि वे शीर्ष 12 में थीं और फिर उन्होंने धीरे-धीरे अन्य प्रतिभागियों को पीछे छोड़ना शुरू किया। जापानी संकेतों और स्पष्ट स्थिति अपडेट की कमी से भ्रमित होकर, उन्हें अधिकारियों से यह भी पुष्टि करनी पड़ी कि वे वास्तव में फिनिश लाइन तक पहुँच गई थीं।

केन्या की पेरेस जेपचिरचिर ने 2:24.43 का समय दर्ज करते हुए एक रोमांचक स्प्रिंट फिनिश में स्वर्ण पदक जीता, जो इथियोपिया की तिगिस्ट असेफा से सिर्फ दो सेकंड आगे रहीं।
meta_description: Ex-English Schools champion Julia Paternain finishes third in the women's marathon to claim Uruguay's first medal in World Championships history.

title_src: World Series of Darts: Luke Littler fights back to beat Jonny Clayton
text_src: Defending champion Luke Littler had to come from behind to beat Jonny Clayton 6-4 and advance to the World Series of Darts quarter-finals. Clayton stormed into a 3-0 lead but Littler responded, winning the next five legs, which included back-to-back 180s, before seeing out victory in Amsterdam. Littler will face Ross Smith, a 6-4 winner over Dave Chisnall, next. "It was not easy and I can pull myself out of situations, I know I can do it," said Littler. "I would rather get off to a good start, but Jonny did there. I managed to get over the line." Elsewhere, Michael van Gerwen hit back-to-back 100-plus finishes to edge out Rob Cross 6-5, setting up a quarter-final against Luke Humphries, the world number one coming through 6-4 against Kevin Doets. Gerwyn Price beat Raymond van Barneveld 6-4, setting up a tie with Chris Dobey, who cruised to a 6-1 win over Cameron Menzies. The remaining quarter-final sees Josh Rock, who routed Danny Noppert 6-0 in a match that lasted just nine minutes, take on Mike de Decker after he beat Damon Heta 6-4.
summary_src:
Defending champion Luke Littler has advanced to the quarter-finals in Amsterdam, coming from 3-0 down to defeat Jonny Clayton 6-4. Littler mounted a strong comeback, winning five consecutive legs, which included back-to-back 180s, before securing his victory. He will next face Ross Smith, who beat Dave Chisnall 6-4. Littler expressed his satisfaction, acknowledging the difficulty of the match but confident in his ability to overcome tough situations, adding, "I managed to get over the line. I'm happy."

In other quarter-final action, Michael van Gerwen overcame Rob Cross 6-5 to set up a clash with Luke Humphries. Gerwyn Price defeated Raymond van Barneveld 6-4, and Chris Dobey cruised past Cameron Menzies 6-1. Josh Rock delivered a dominant performance, routing Danny Noppert 6-0 in just nine minutes, and will play Mike de Decker. Kevin Doets also progressed with a 6-4 win.
summary_tgt:
यहाँ अंग्रेजी समाचार सारांश का हिंदी अनुवाद है:

**ल्यूक लिटलर क्वार्टर फाइनल में, 3-0 से पिछड़कर की शानदार वापसी**

मौजूदा चैंपियन ल्यूक लिटलर एम्स्टर्डम में क्वार्टर फाइनल में पहुंच गए हैं। उन्होंने 3-0 से पिछड़ने के बाद वापसी करते हुए जॉनी क्लेटन को 6-4 से हराया। लिटलर ने लगातार पांच लेग जीतकर एक ज़बरदस्त वापसी की, जिसमें लगातार दो 180 भी शामिल थे, और अपनी जीत सुनिश्चित की। वह अब रॉस स्मिथ से भिड़ेंगे, जिन्होंने डेव चिसनॉल को 6-4 से हराया था। लिटलर ने अपनी संतुष्टि व्यक्त की, मैच की कठिनाई को स्वीकार करते हुए भी उन्होंने मुश्किल परिस्थितियों से उबरने की अपनी क्षमता पर विश्वास जताया। उन्होंने कहा, "मैं जीत की रेखा पार करने में कामयाब रहा। मैं खुश हूं।"

क्वार्टर फाइनल के अन्य मुकाबलों में:
*   माइकल वैन गेर्वेन ने रॉब क्रॉस को 6-5 से हराकर ल्यूक हम्फ्रीज़ के साथ मुकाबले के लिए अपनी जगह बनाई।
*   गेरविन प्राइस ने रेमंड वैन बार्नेवेल्ड को 6-4 से मात दी।
*   क्रिस डोबे ने कैमरून मेंज़िस को आसानी से 6-1 से शिकस्त दी।
*   जोश रॉक ने प्रभावशाली प्रदर्शन करते हुए सिर्फ नौ मिनट में डैनी नोपर्ट को 6-0 से करारी शिकस्त दी। वह अब माइक डी डेकर से भिड़ेंगे।
*   केविन डोट्स भी 6-4 की जीत के साथ अगले दौर में पहुंचे।
meta_description: Defending champion Luke Littler fights back to beat Jonny Clayton 6-4 and reach the World Series of Darts quarter-finals.

title_src: Barcelona: Why is first home game not at Nou Camp?
text_src: Marcus Rashford could play his first home game of the season for Barcelona in a stadium far smaller than the one he was expecting. Despite hopes that Barcelona would begin the defence of their title at the newly renovated Nou Camp stadium, they will instead play their first home match at the much smaller 6,000-seater Johan Cruyff Stadium. That is because the Nou Camp is still not ready for fans, despite the club saying they would be back playing games there in November 2024, to coincide with the club's 125th anniversary. The club had been granted permission to play their first three fixtures away from home to allow the completion of construction work. But even with a little extra time thanks to the international break that followed, the club haven't yet obtained documents that allow it to open. The Olympic Stadium, used as their substitute home ground for the past two seasons, is the venue for a Post Malone concert two days before the match – ruling it out of use for Sunday. Barcelona last played at the Nou Camp in May 2023 – a stadium which could hold up to 100,000 people. Here, we look at what renovations the club is making, why it is taking so long and how fans feel about it.
summary_src: Barcelona will play their first home game of the season, potentially featuring new signing Marcus Rashford, at the significantly smaller 6,000-seater Johan Cruyff Stadium due to extensive delays in the Nou Camp's renovation. The 100,000-capacity Nou Camp, last used in May 2023, was initially slated to reopen by November 2024 to coincide with the club's 125th anniversary. However, construction is behind schedule, and the club has yet to obtain the necessary documents to allow fans back in, despite being granted permission to play their initial three fixtures away and having extra time from an international break. Further complicating matters, their usual substitute home ground for the past two seasons, the Olympic Stadium, is unavailable due to a concert.
summary_tgt:
बार्सिलोना इस सीज़न का अपना पहला घरेलू मैच, जिसमें संभवतः नए हस्ताक्षरित खिलाड़ी मार्कस रैशफोर्ड भी शामिल होंगे, काफी छोटे 6,000 सीटों वाले जोहान क्रूइफ स्टेडियम में खेलेगा। ऐसा नोउ कैंप के नवीनीकरण में व्यापक देरी के कारण हो रहा है।

100,000 दर्शकों की क्षमता वाले नोउ कैंप, जिसका उपयोग आखिरी बार मई 2023 में किया गया था, को शुरू में क्लब की 125वीं वर्षगांठ के अवसर पर नवंबर 2024 तक फिर से खोलने की योजना थी। हालांकि, निर्माण कार्य तय समय से पीछे चल रहा है, और क्लब को अभी तक प्रशंसकों को वापस स्टेडियम में प्रवेश की अनुमति देने के लिए आवश्यक दस्तावेज़ प्राप्त नहीं हुए हैं, भले ही उन्हें अपने शुरुआती तीन मैच बाहर खेलने की अनुमति दी गई थी और अंतरराष्ट्रीय ब्रेक के कारण अतिरिक्त समय भी मिला था। मामले को और पेचीदा बनाते हुए, पिछले दो सीज़न से उनका सामान्य वैकल्पिक घरेलू मैदान, ओलंपिक स्टेडियम, एक संगीत समारोह के कारण अनुपलब्ध है।
meta_description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team look at why Barcelona's first home game of the season is not taking place at their Nou Camp home.

title_src: Molly McCann: Former UFC star starts professional boxing career with TKO win
text_src: Molly McCann said she "didn't even get out of second gear" as the former UFC star launched her professional boxing career with an impressive technical knockout victory. The 35-year-old Liverpool native stopped Ireland's Kate Radomska in the final round of their six-round super bantamweight contest on the undercard of Lewis Crocker and Paddy Donovan's world title fight at Belfast's Windsor Park. McCann landed several heavy shots during an impressive debut and dropped Radomska in the fifth round with a hard right hand. However, she was also forced to compose herself after Radomska appeared to kick out at her in the second round while defending an attack from McCann in the corner. "It was very different so I was happy with it," McCann told BBC Radio 5 Live. "I think I took a kick and a headbutt and I give out some knocks as well so I'm happy. I didn't even get out of second gear there so that was nice."
summary_src:
Former UFC star Molly McCann successfully launched her professional boxing career with an impressive technical knockout (TKO) victory. The 35-year-old Liverpool native defeated Ireland's Kate Radomska in the final round of their six-round super bantamweight contest, held on the undercard of a world title fight.

McCann showcased her power throughout, dropping Radomska in the fifth round with a hard right hand. The bout saw a brief disruption when Radomska appeared to kick McCann in the second round, but McCann quickly regained her composure. Post-fight, McCann expressed satisfaction with her performance, stating she "didn't even get out of second gear" and was "very proud" of her debut as she now sets her sights on winning her first major title.
summary_tgt:
पूर्व यूएफसी स्टार मॉली मैककैन ने एक प्रभावशाली तकनीकी नॉकआउट (TKO) जीत के साथ अपने पेशेवर मुक्केबाजी करियर की सफल शुरुआत की। 35 वर्षीय लिवरपूल निवासी ने आयरलैंड की केट रेडोम्स्का को उनके छह-राउंड के सुपर बैंटमवेट मुकाबले के अंतिम राउंड में हराया। यह मुकाबला एक विश्व खिताब लड़ाई के अंडरकार्ड पर आयोजित किया गया था।

मैककैन ने पूरे मुकाबले में अपनी शक्ति का प्रदर्शन किया, पांचवें राउंड में एक जोरदार दाहिने हाथ से रेडोम्स्का को गिरा दिया। मुकाबले में दूसरे राउंड में उस समय थोड़ा व्यवधान आया जब रेडोम्स्का ने मैककैन को लात मार दी। हालांकि, मैककैन ने तुरंत अपनी एकाग्रता वापस पा ली।

मुकाबले के बाद, मैककैन ने अपने प्रदर्शन पर संतोष व्यक्त करते हुए कहा कि वह "अभी दूसरे गियर में भी नहीं आईं" और अपने पदार्पण को लेकर "बहुत गर्व" महसूस कर रही हैं। उन्होंने अब अपना पहला बड़ा खिताब जीतने का लक्ष्य रखा है।
meta_description: Molly McCann says she "didn't even get out of second gear" as the former UFC star launches her professional boxing career with an impressive technical knockout victory.

title_src: World's first AI minister will eliminate corruption, says Albania's PM
text_src: World's first AI minister will eliminate corruption, says Albania's PM 2 days ago Share Save Guy Delauney BBC Balkans correspondent Share Save ADNAN BECI/AFP The new minister, named Diella, has already been active as a bot, guiding applicants through a process to obtain official documents. For government officials, being called "heartless" is an occupational hazard. But Albania has chosen to turn that insult into a positive quality, by appointing an AI minister. Not a minister for artificial intelligence. Rather, a cabinet member who is, literally, the work of AI. The new addition is, like a pop star, known simply by the single name: Diella. Prime Minister Edi Rama introduced her as a member of his new cabinet on Thursday, four months after securing his fourth term in office in May elections. However, the move was symbolic rather than official, as Albania's constitution insists that government ministers must be mentally competent citizens aged at least 18. Still, the advantages of appointing a bot over a human are obvious. Diella, whose name means sun in Albanian, is unlikely to be the source of any unflattering leaks about the government. She will only be power-hungry in the sense of the electricity she consumes. And a damaging expenses scandal would appear to be out of the question. In fact, corruption was uppermost in Rama's mind when he made Diella part of his team as minister for public procurement. Her role will be to ensure that Albania will become "a country where public tenders are 100% free of corruption". "We're working with a brilliant team, which is not only Albanian but also international, to come out with the first full AI model in public procurement," the prime minister told the BBC. "Not only will we wipe out every potential influence on public biddings – we will also make the process much faster, much more efficient and totally accountable." Diella had already been working in Albania even before the government "appointment". Her first incarnation was as an AI-powered virtual assistant, guiding applicants through the process to obtain official documents. Reuters Albania's prime minister, Edi Rama, won a fourth term in office in May and introduced his cabinet on Thursday
summary_src:
Albanian Prime Minister Edi Rama has symbolically appointed "Diella," an AI bot, as the country's first "minister for public procurement," aiming to eliminate corruption and enhance efficiency in government tenders. Diella, whose name means "sun," has previously served as a virtual assistant guiding citizens through official document processes.

While the appointment is non-official due to constitutional requirements for human ministers, Rama, who recently secured his fourth term, emphasized Diella's advantages: she is immune to political ambition, leaks, or expense scandals. Her primary role will be to ensure public tenders are "100% free of corruption," faster, more efficient, and fully accountable, working with a combined Albanian and international team on an AI model for procurement. This move comes as Albania has faced recent political instability, and Rama positions it as a bold step to combat long-standing issues like corruption.
summary_tgt:
अल्बानियाई प्रधानमंत्री एडी रामा ने भ्रष्टाचार को खत्म करने और सरकारी निविदाओं में दक्षता बढ़ाने के उद्देश्य से, 'डिएला' नामक एक एआई बॉट को देश के पहले 'सार्वजनिक खरीद मंत्री' के रूप में प्रतीकात्मक रूप से नियुक्त किया है। डिएला, जिसके नाम का अर्थ 'सूर्य' है, पहले भी नागरिकों को आधिकारिक दस्तावेज़ प्रक्रियाओं में मार्गदर्शन करने वाले एक वर्चुअल असिस्टेंट के रूप में सेवा दे चुकी है।

हालांकि, यह नियुक्ति मानव मंत्रियों के लिए संवैधानिक आवश्यकताओं के कारण अनौपचारिक है, रामा, जिन्होंने हाल ही में अपना चौथा कार्यकाल सुरक्षित किया है, ने डिएला के लाभों को रेखांकित किया है: वह राजनीतिक महत्वाकांक्षा, जानकारी के लीक होने या खर्चों से जुड़े घोटालों से प्रतिरक्षित है। उसकी प्राथमिक भूमिका यह सुनिश्चित करना होगा कि सार्वजनिक निविदाएँ '100% भ्रष्टाचार मुक्त', तेज, अधिक कुशल और पूरी तरह से जवाबदेह हों, जिसके लिए वह खरीद के लिए एक एआई मॉडल पर एक संयुक्त अल्बानियाई और अंतर्राष्ट्रीय टीम के साथ काम करेगी। यह कदम ऐसे समय आया है जब अल्बानिया ने हाल ही में राजनीतिक अस्थिरता का सामना किया है, और रामा इसे भ्रष्टाचार जैसे लंबे समय से चले आ रहे मुद्दों से निपटने के लिए एक साहसिक कदम के रूप में प्रस्तुत करते हैं।
meta_description: Named Diella, the new minister will help Albania "leapfrog" bigger, more advanced countries, says Edi Rama.

title_src: Seagate creates 30 jobs through £115m investment
text_src: Seagate creates 30 jobs through £115m investment 3 days ago Share Save Keiron Tourish BBC News NI Share Save BBC Seagate vice president Fergus O'Donnell chatting to First Minister Michelle O'Neill and Deputy First Minister Emma Little-Pengelly at Thursday's announcement The US-owned technology company Seagate has announced a £115m investment at its factory in Londonderry, creating around 30 jobs. The money will fund research and development at the plant on the Buncrana Road in Springtown. The First and Deputy First Ministers, Michelle O'Neill and Emma Little-Pengelly, as well as the Economy Minister Caoimhe Archibald were at the site on Thursday morning and welcomed the development. The Derry operation opened in 1993 and currently employs 1,500 people, making it one of the largest employers in the north west. The Seagate plant in Derry is one of the biggest employers in the north west The company announced an investment of £100m with an additional £15m from Invest NI. The money will be used for research and development over the next five years. It's seen as crucial for a company at the cutting edge of developing new technology for the home and business sector. In Springtown Seagate manufactures a tiny specialised part for hard drives called a recording head. The company believes the investment will "usher in the next generation" of hard drive innovation and research and development at the plant. Vice president Fergus O'Donnell said the investment would "drive opportunity" as they continued to invest in a world-class team and facility at the site. "Innovation and partnerships are central to our success and will strengthen our regional and global leadership in technology and manufacturing excellence," he said.
summary_src:
Seagate has announced a significant £115 million investment in its Derry plant, primarily for research, development, and manufacturing over the next five years. The funding comprises £100 million from Seagate and an additional £15 million from Invest NI. This investment is expected to create 30 new jobs, bolstering the facility which currently employs 1,500 people and is one of the North West's largest employers.

The Springtown plant, operational since 1993, specializes in manufacturing tiny recording heads for hard drives. This capital injection is deemed crucial for developing new technology, staying at the cutting edge for home and business sectors, and driving the "next generation" of hard drive innovation. Seagate Vice President Fergus O'Donnell emphasized the investment will "drive opportunity" and strengthen their "regional and global leadership in technology and manufacturing excellence." First Minister Michelle O'Neill, Deputy First Minister Emma Little-Pengelly, and Economy Minister Caoimhe Archibald attended the announcement.
summary_tgt:
**सीगेट का डेरी संयंत्र में 115 मिलियन पाउंड का निवेश, 30 नई नौकरियों का सृजन**

सीगेट (Seagate) ने अगले पांच वर्षों में मुख्य रूप से अनुसंधान, विकास और विनिर्माण के लिए अपने डेरी संयंत्र में 115 मिलियन पाउंड के एक महत्वपूर्ण निवेश की घोषणा की है। इस वित्तपोषण में सीगेट से 100 मिलियन पाउंड और इन्वेस्ट एनआई (Invest NI) से अतिरिक्त 15 मिलियन पाउंड शामिल हैं। इस निवेश से 30 नए रोज़गार सृजित होने की उम्मीद है, जिससे इस सुविधा को बल मिलेगा जहाँ वर्तमान में 1,500 लोग कार्यरत हैं और यह उत्तर-पश्चिम के सबसे बड़े नियोक्ताओं में से एक है।

स्प्रिंगटाउन संयंत्र, जो 1993 से कार्यरत है, हार्ड ड्राइव के लिए छोटे रिकॉर्डिंग हेड (recording heads) के निर्माण में माहिर है। पूंजी का यह प्रवाह नई तकनीक विकसित करने, घरेलू और व्यावसायिक क्षेत्रों के लिए अत्याधुनिक बने रहने और हार्ड ड्राइव नवाचार की "अगली पीढ़ी" को आगे बढ़ाने के लिए महत्वपूर्ण माना जाता है। सीगेट के उपाध्यक्ष फर्गस ओ'डॉनेल (Fergus O'Donnell) ने इस बात पर ज़ोर दिया कि यह निवेश "अवसरों को बढ़ावा देगा" और प्रौद्योगिकी और विनिर्माण उत्कृष्टता में उनके "क्षेत्रीय और वैश्विक नेतृत्व" को मज़बूत करेगा।

इस घोषणा में प्रथम मंत्री मिशेल ओ'नील (Michelle O'Neill), उप-प्रथम मंत्री एम्मा लिटिल-पेंगली (Emma Little-Pengelly) और अर्थव्यवस्था मंत्री कैओइम्हे आर्चीबाल्ड (Caoimhe Archibald) शामिल हुए।
meta_description: The US-owned technology company Seagate has announced a major investment of £115m at its factory in Londonderry.

title_src: Watch: What's happening with Trump's Tesla parked at White House?
text_src: As US President Donald Trump expressed disappointment in Elon Musk on Thursday, he proposed an explanation for the tech billionaire's opposition to his signature spending bill. He said Musk was only against the legislation because his company, Tesla, will be hurt by the push to end electric vehicle tax credits. Just three months ago, Trump showed off a Tesla on the White House lawn he said he purchased. Now it's reported by CBS, the BBC's US partner, that Trump is considering selling the car. The BBC's Gary O'Donoghue went to see the car in a White House parking lot.
summary_src: US President Donald Trump has expressed disappointment in Elon Musk, attributing the tech billionaire's opposition to his signature spending bill to the proposed elimination of electric vehicle tax credits, which Trump said would hurt Musk's company, Tesla. This comes just three months after Trump showcased a Tesla, which he claimed to have purchased for $100,000, on the White House lawn. Reports now suggest Trump is considering selling that car, along with a Range Rover, with a BBC reporter having located the Tesla in a White House parking lot.
summary_tgt:
अमेरिकी राष्ट्रपति डोनाल्ड ट्रंप ने एलन मस्क को लेकर निराशा व्यक्त की है। ट्रंप ने तकनीकी अरबपति (मस्क) द्वारा अपने प्रमुख खर्च विधेयक का विरोध करने का कारण इलेक्ट्रिक वाहन कर छूट को खत्म करने के प्रस्ताव को बताया है। ट्रंप ने कहा कि इससे मस्क की कंपनी, टेस्ला को नुकसान होगा।

यह घटना तब सामने आई है जब ठीक तीन महीने पहले ट्रंप ने व्हाइट हाउस के लॉन पर एक टेस्ला कार प्रदर्शित की थी, जिसे उन्होंने $100,000 में खरीदने का दावा किया था।

अब खबरें बताती हैं कि ट्रंप उस टेस्ला कार को एक रेंज रोवर के साथ बेचने पर विचार कर रहे हैं। एक बीबीसी रिपोर्टर ने उस टेस्ला को व्हाइट हाउस के पार्किंग स्थल में स्थित पाया है।

title_src: Tesco to Victoria's Secret: India's booming back-offices worry about rising trade barriers
text_src: Tesco to Victoria's Secret: India's booming back-offices worry about rising trade barriers 5 days ago Share Save Nikhil Inamdar BBC News, Mumbai and Devina Gupta BBC News, Delhi Share Save Getty Images India's GCCs employ two million people and bring in $65bn in annual revenue Twenty years ago when British retail giant Tesco entered India with a back-office, its team largely performed IT and finance functions to support the firm's operations in the UK. Two decades later, the retailer's sprawling campus in Bengaluru city - often called India's Silicon Valley - has almost entirely transformed in both scale and scope. It is a "strategic engine" that delivers some of the most complex tasks - from due diligence of vendors to data analytics that predict demand, better inventory planning and forecasting customer behaviour, says Sumit Mitra, CEO of Tesco Business Solutions Even the store design of a neighbourhood Tesco Express or super store in the UK now happens thousands of miles away in India. Tesco's expansion reflects the spectacular boom in India's Global Capability Centres (GCCs) - offshore back-office units of global multinational companies that started as captive call centres or help desk outposts, but now perform a plethora of strategic tasks from IT to finance, design, research and development, and even AI-led automation. While global trade protectionism could derail some of this growth, the GCCs have become a major force to reckon with. They provide not just "labour arbitrage" but also "intellectual arbitrage", Mr Mitra told the BBC in an email interview, when asked why Tesco is expanding its footprint. To put it simply, it's the abundance of talent available across domains and not just cost savings that is driving this boom. Getty Images Tesco's GCC in India even designs the store layout of its supermarkets Dhruva Advisors, which helps GCCs navigate the complex task of global tax compliance, calls these outposts "digital twins" of parent companies, situated across the oceans. Everyone from Google to Goldman Sachs and the lingerie brand Victoria's Secret now has a GCC in India. The number of multinationals that operate these centres has ballooned from 700 in 2010 to more than 1,700 as of last year. They employ two million people and bring in $65bn in annual revenue. While challenges loom - with trade barriers going up globally and a strong backlash against outsourcing to countries like India - the future appears heady: consulting firm EY expects the market for GCCs to top $100bn by 2030 as the sector grows at a compounded rate of 14%. So what's powering this growth? Besides its growing base of engineers, designers and digitally skilled workers, India is now among the fastest-growing artificial intelligence (AI) talent hubs in the world. The depth of digital, data, AI, and engineering expertise all coalescing at one location makes India highly sought after, say industry leaders. "You could hire these people in the US. But the availability of talent in one location made Bengaluru very attractive for us and we could build a big footprint quickly," said Dan Schiappa of Arctic Wolf, an American cybersecurity company which opened its first GCC in Bengaluru and in Noida - a suburb of Delhi - last year. Couple the availability of a tech-savvy workforce with supportive government policies, including individual state-level support - and new GCCs are springing up beyond the metro cities in tier-II towns as well. Smaller towns offer cheaper talent, and also cheaper real estate, prompting several firms like French spirits maker Pernod Ricard to look beyond the metros. It has opened a GCC in Nashik, a city in Maharashtra state. The trend has sparked a property boom. "Around 31% of overall office leasing space demand in India last year came from GCCs, and it is growing," Anuj Puri of ANAROCK, a property consultancy, told the BBC. Getty Images From Goldman Sachs to the lingerie brand Victoria's Secret, there are 1,700 multinationals operating GCCs in India
summary_src:
India's Global Capability Centres (GCCs) have experienced a spectacular transformation, evolving from initial back-office functions into strategic hubs that are now critical "digital twins" for global multinationals. Companies ranging from Tesco and Google to Goldman Sachs and Victoria's Secret utilize these centres for highly complex tasks, including vendor due diligence, data analytics, and even store design for their global operations.

This boom is primarily driven by India's vast pool of highly skilled talent in engineering, digital, and artificial intelligence, offering not just "labour arbitrage" but "intellectual arbitrage." The sector has seen the number of multinational-operated centres surge from 700 in 2010 to over 1,700, collectively employing two million people and generating $65 billion in annual revenue, with projections to reach $100 billion by 2030.

Fuelled by supportive government policies and the availability of a tech-savvy workforce, GCCs are expanding beyond major tech hubs like Bengaluru and Noida into smaller cities such as Nashik, where they are also sparking a significant property boom. While India's GCCs are a major force expected to outpace global growth, they face potential challenges from rising global trade protectionism and a growing backlash against outsourcing.
summary_tgt:
भारत के ग्लोबल कैपेबिलिटी सेंटर्स (जीसीसी) में शानदार परिवर्तन आया है। ये शुरुआत में केवल बैक-ऑफिस कार्य संभालते थे, लेकिन अब रणनीतिक केंद्र बन गए हैं और वैश्विक बहुराष्ट्रीय कंपनियों के लिए महत्वपूर्ण 'डिजिटल ट्विन्स' की भूमिका निभाते हैं। टेस्को (Tesco) और गूगल (Google) से लेकर गोल्डमैन सैक्स (Goldman Sachs) और विक्टोरियाज़ सीक्रेट (Victoria's Secret) जैसी कंपनियां अपने वैश्विक ऑपरेशन्स के लिए इन केंद्रों का उपयोग अत्यधिक जटिल कार्यों जैसे विक्रेता ड्यू डिलिजेंस (vendor due diligence), डेटा एनालिटिक्स (data analytics) और यहाँ तक कि स्टोर डिज़ाइन के लिए भी करती हैं।

इस उछाल का मुख्य कारण इंजीनियरिंग, डिजिटल और आर्टिफिशियल इंटेलिजेंस (AI) के क्षेत्र में भारत के उच्च कुशल प्रतिभाओं का विशाल भंडार है। यह केवल 'लेबर आर्बिट्रेज' (श्रम मध्यस्थता) ही नहीं, बल्कि 'इंटेलेक्चुअल आर्बिट्रेज' (बौद्धिक मध्यस्थता) भी प्रदान करता है। इस क्षेत्र में बहुराष्ट्रीय कंपनियों द्वारा संचालित केंद्रों की संख्या 2010 में 700 से बढ़कर अब 1,700 से अधिक हो गई है। ये सामूहिक रूप से 20 लाख लोगों को रोजगार देते हैं और सालाना 65 बिलियन डॉलर का राजस्व उत्पन्न करते हैं, जिसके 2030 तक 100 बिलियन डॉलर तक पहुँचने का अनुमान है।

सहायक सरकारी नीतियों और तकनीकी रूप से कुशल कार्यबल की उपलब्धता के कारण, जीसीसी अब बेंगलुरु और नोएडा जैसे प्रमुख तकनीकी केंद्रों से आगे बढ़कर नासिक जैसे छोटे शहरों में भी विस्तार कर रहे हैं, जहाँ वे एक महत्वपूर्ण प्रॉपर्टी उछाल को भी जन्म दे रहे हैं। हालाँकि, भारत के जीसीसी एक प्रमुख शक्ति हैं जिनसे वैश्विक विकास को पीछे छोड़ने की उम्मीद है, फिर भी उन्हें बढ़ते वैश्विक व्यापार संरक्षणवाद और आउटसोर्सिंग के खिलाफ बढ़ते विरोध से संभावित चुनौतियों का सामना करना पड़ सकता है।

title_src: Meta covered up potential child harms, whistleblowers claim
text_src: Meta covered up potential child harms, whistleblowers claim Meta, the parent company of Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, denies the allegations and in a statement referred to the "claims at the heart" of the hearing as "nonsense." The hearing comes a day after the Washington Post reported the whistleblowers' allegations that Meta lawyers intervened to shape internal research that could have flagged risks. "Meta has chosen to ignore the problems they created and bury evidence of users' negative experiences," said Jason Sattizahn. Two former Meta safety researchers told a US Senate committee on Tuesday that the social media giant covered up potential harms to children stemming from its virtual reality (VR) products. Mr Sattizahn and Cayce Savage, who once lead research on the youth user experience for Meta's VR platforms, told senators that the company demanded researchers erase evidence of sexual abuse risk on those products. They also alleged the company told in-house researchers to avoid work that could produce evidence of harm from its VR products to children. Ahead of the hearing, Meta knocked back the allegations. The claims, the company said, are "based on selectively leaked internal documents that were picked specifically to craft a false narrative." There were also no bans or limits on carrying out research, a spokesperson added – saying the company has in recent years approved "nearly 180 Reality Labs-related studies on issues including youth safety and well-being." Mr Sattizahn, who worked at the company from 2018 to 2024, responded in testimony to the committee by calling Meta's response to the Washington Post report a "lie by avoidance." "It's pointing out some rote number that means nothing," he said, insisting that Meta's research is being "pruned and manipulated." During one exchange with US Senator John Hawley, a Republican from Missouri, Ms Savage alleged that during her research, she identified that Roblox, the online game platform popular among children, was being used by coordinated paedophile rings. "They set up strip clubs and they pay children to strip" with Robux, the app's currency, which can be converted into real money, Ms Savage said. "I flagged this to Meta and said that under no circumstances should we host the app Roblox on their headset," Ms Savage said. Roblox is still available in the Meta VR app store, she noted. Roblox told the BBC it strongly disagreed with the allegations made on Tuesday, saying they were "based on ill-informed and outdated information". "At Roblox, safety is a top priority," a company spokesperson said. "We work tirelessly to remove violative content and bad actors from the platform through our 24/7 moderation system and respond swiftly to abuse reports, including banning accounts and reporting to law enforcement." Meta offers parental supervision tools on its Quest headsets, as well as on the VR game, Horizon Worlds. These allow parents and guardians to see and adjust safety features and track which other players their children follow and are followed by. But during the hearing, Republican Senator Ashley Moody of Florida said she was unable to navigate the parental controls despite being one of the first attorneys general in the country to sue Meta in court for allegedly harming children online. "It doesn't surprise you that someone like me who has all this knowledge had to go to my own child and say 'how do I find the parental controls?'" she asked the former researchers. "Not at all," they both responded. Mr Sattizahn and Ms Savage are just the latest former Meta employees to come forward with explosive allegations about the company. In 2021, Frances Haugen who once worked as a product manager on the company's civic integrity team, said Instagram was impacting the mental health of teenagers but did not share its own findings suggesting that the platform was a "toxic" place for many youngsters. Ms Haugen had copied a trove of internal memos and documents prior to departing the company. Meta boss Mark Zuckerberg said that the time that her claims that Meta prioritizes profit above safety are "just not true".
summary_src:
Social media giant Meta is facing renewed accusations of covering up potential harms to children from its virtual reality (VR) products, following testimony by two former safety researchers before a US Senate committee.

Jason Sattizahn and Cayce Savage, both former Meta safety researchers, alleged that the company demanded they erase evidence of sexual abuse risks on VR platforms and instructed in-house researchers to avoid work that could produce evidence of harm to children. Sattizahn further accused Meta of "pruning and manipulating" its research and responding to a Washington Post report on the allegations with a "lie by avoidance."

Ms. Savage specifically cited identifying coordinated pedophile rings using the Roblox app on Meta's VR platforms to pay children to strip with virtual currency (Robux) convertible to real money. Despite her flagging this issue, Roblox remains available in the Meta VR app store.

Meta vehemently denies the allegations, calling them "nonsense" and claiming they are based on "selectively leaked internal documents...picked specifically to craft a false narrative." The company stated it has approved nearly 180 youth safety-related studies and offers parental supervision tools on its Quest headsets.

Roblox strongly disputed Ms. Savage's claims, stating they were "ill-informed and outdated," and emphasized its commitment to safety through 24/7 moderation and swift action against violators.

The hearing also highlighted difficulties with Meta's parental controls, with Republican Senator Ashley Moody admitting she struggled to navigate them. These allegations echo those made in 2021 by former Meta product manager Frances Haugen, who claimed Instagram impacted teen mental health and that Meta prioritized profit over safety, a claim Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg denied.
summary_tgt:
यहां अंग्रेजी समाचार सारांश का हिंदी अनुवाद है:

**मेटा पर बच्चों को वीआर उत्पादों से होने वाले नुकसान को छिपाने के नए आरोप, पूर्व शोधकर्ताओं ने गवाही दी**

सोशल मीडिया दिग्गज मेटा एक अमेरिकी सीनेट समिति के समक्ष दो पूर्व सुरक्षा शोधकर्ताओं की गवाही के बाद, अपने वर्चुअल रियलिटी (वीआर) उत्पादों से बच्चों को होने वाले संभावित नुकसान को छिपाने के नए आरोपों का सामना कर रहा है।

मेटा के पूर्व सुरक्षा शोधकर्ताओं, जेसन सैटिज़ाह्न और केसी सैवेज, दोनों ने आरोप लगाया कि कंपनी ने उनसे वीआर प्लेटफॉर्म पर यौन शोषण के जोखिमों के सबूत मिटाने की मांग की थी और आंतरिक शोधकर्ताओं को ऐसे काम से बचने का निर्देश दिया था जिससे बच्चों को नुकसान होने के सबूत मिल सकें। सैटिज़ाह्न ने मेटा पर अपने शोध में "काट-छांट और हेरफेर" करने और आरोपों पर वाशिंगटन पोस्ट की एक रिपोर्ट का जवाब "टालमटोल से झूठ" के साथ देने का भी आरोप लगाया।

सुश्री सैवेज ने विशेष रूप से मेटा के वीआर प्लेटफॉर्म पर रोबॉक्स ऐप का उपयोग करके समन्वित बाल यौन शोषण करने वाले गिरोहों की पहचान करने का हवाला दिया, जो बच्चों को वर्चुअल मुद्रा (रोबक्स) से कपड़े उतारने के लिए भुगतान करते थे, जिसे वास्तविक धन में बदला जा सकता है। उनके द्वारा इस मुद्दे को उजागर करने के बावजूद, रोबॉक्स मेटा वीआर ऐप स्टोर में उपलब्ध है।

मेटा ने इन आरोपों का पुरजोर खंडन किया है, उन्हें "बकवास" करार दिया है और दावा किया है कि वे "चुनिंदा रूप से लीक हुए आंतरिक दस्तावेजों...जिन्हें विशेष रूप से एक झूठी कहानी गढ़ने के लिए चुना गया है," पर आधारित हैं। कंपनी ने कहा कि उसने लगभग 180 युवा सुरक्षा-संबंधी अध्ययनों को मंजूरी दी है और अपने क्वेस्ट हेडसेट पर माता-पिता की निगरानी के उपकरण प्रदान करती है।

रोबॉक्स ने सुश्री सैवेज के दावों का जोरदार खंडन किया, उन्हें "गलत जानकारी वाले और पुराने" बताते हुए, और 24/7 मॉडरेशन तथा उल्लंघन करने वालों के खिलाफ त्वरित कार्रवाई के माध्यम से सुरक्षा के प्रति अपनी प्रतिबद्धता पर जोर दिया।

इस सुनवाई में मेटा के पैरेंटल कंट्रोल्स (माता-पिता के नियंत्रण) के साथ आने वाली कठिनाइयों पर भी प्रकाश डाला गया, जिसमें रिपब्लिकन सीनेटर एशले मूडी ने स्वीकार किया कि उन्हें उन्हें उपयोग करने में परेशानी हुई। ये आरोप 2021 में मेटा की पूर्व उत्पाद प्रबंधक फ्रांसिस हौगेन द्वारा लगाए गए आरोपों की प्रतिध्वनि हैं, जिन्होंने दावा किया था कि इंस्टाग्राम ने किशोरों के मानसिक स्वास्थ्य पर असर डाला था और मेटा ने सुरक्षा से ऊपर लाभ को प्राथमिकता दी थी, एक ऐसा दावा जिसे मेटा के सीईओ मार्क जुकरबर्ग ने नकारा था।
meta_description: Meta denies the allegations and described the "claims at the heart" of the Senate hearing as "nonsense".

title_src: Wolverhampton charity secures funding for creative projects
text_src: Charity secures funding for creative projects A Wolverhampton homelessness charity has secured funding to start a series of creative projects for those in recovery from addiction and their families. The Good Shepherd Wolverhampton has won a grant of £89,000 from Arts Council England, which will fund three years of work. Some of the projects have already started in partnership with Wolverhampton 360, which ran recovery art workshops, led by local artists Ewan Johnson and Charlotte Webb. Kate Penman, the project lead at Good Shepherd, said: "These workshops with Ewan, Charlotte and Wolverhampton 360 have been joyful and it's been wonderful to see how children fearlessly approach the task in hand."
summary_src: The Good Shepherd Wolverhampton, a homelessness charity, has secured a three-year grant of £89,000 from Arts Council England. The funding will support a series of creative projects and workshops designed for individuals in recovery from addiction. Some recovery art workshops, led by local artists Ewan Johnson and Charlotte Webb, have already commenced in partnership with Wolverhampton 360. Kate Penman, project lead at Good Shepherd, lauded these initial workshops as "joyful," highlighting the participants' enthusiastic engagement.

यहाँ अंग्रेजी समाचार सारांश का हिंदी अनुवाद है:

बेघरता के लिए काम करने वाली चैरिटी द गुड शेफर्ड वॉल्वरहैम्प्टन को आर्ट्स काउंसिल इंग्लैंड से 89,000 पाउंड का तीन साल का अनुदान मिला है। यह धनराशि नशे की लत से उबर रहे व्यक्तियों के लिए तैयार की गई रचनात्मक परियोजनाओं और कार्यशालाओं की एक श्रृंखला का समर्थन करेगी।

स्थानीय कलाकार इवान जॉनसन और शार्लोट वेब के नेतृत्व में कुछ रिकवरी कला कार्यशालाएँ वॉल्वरहैम्प्टन 360 के साथ साझेदारी में पहले ही शुरू हो चुकी हैं। गुड शेफर्ड की परियोजना प्रमुख केट पेनमैन ने इन शुरुआती कार्यशालाओं को "आनंददायक" बताया और प्रतिभागियों की उत्साही भागीदारी की सराहना की।
meta_description: The Good Shepherd Wolverhampton says the funding will pay for projects over the next three years.

title_src: Studio chief recalls Queen's Bohemian Rhapsody recording 50 years on
text_src: Studio chief recalls Bohemian Rhapsody recording 50 years on 4 hours ago Share Save Oliver Slow BBC Wales Share Save Getty Images Queen, seen here performing in 1975, recorded Bohemian Rhapsody the same year at Rockfield Studios near Monmouth Fifty years ago the rock band Queen arrived at Rockfield Studios, the iconic recording venue in countryside just outside Monmouth. The band had stayed there a year earlier, in 1974, but returned the following summer after the success of their song Killer Queen. "They hadn't been very financially well off in [1974], but when they came back in 1975, they were very famous and very well off," said Kingsley Ward, co-founder of the studio. During the later visit, Kingsley said the band had been staying at the studio for a week and "hadn't done much", something he mentioned to guitarist Brian May as they were playing frisbee outside. May responded that frontman Freddie Mercury was in the house "writing something". Kingsley went back inside and sidled up to the piano where Mercury was practising - it was a new song with the working title Freddie's Thing. "I had no idea… but it was Bohemian Rhapsody," he told BBC Radio Wales. This week marks 50 years since recording was completed on the song – one of the most iconic of all time – in the Welsh countryside. To celebrate, last night May and fellow band member Roger Taylor took to the stage with the BBC Symphony Orchestra for the Last Night of the Proms Finale. The song has also been a recent hit on social media, after a flash mob performance of the song by French pianist Julien Cohen and a group of 30 musicians he assembled brought a Parisian street to a standstill – since gaining more than 11 million likes on Instagram. Olly Pearson, an electric guitarist from Wrexham, performed in the video, including an energetic take on May's famous guitar solo. "It was just so amazing – I don't even have words for it," Olly said of the experience. Kingsley Ward co-founded the studios with his brother Charles in the 1960s Rockfield is part of rock royalty, born in the 1960s after Kingsley and his brother Charles chose to go alone after being turned down for a recording opportunity by legendary producer and "fifth Beatle" George Martin. As well as Queen, it is where Oasis have forged some of their biggest hits, and where the late Ozzy Osbourne, the Prince of Darkness, arrived in 1970 with his new band Black Sabbath. "We were very loud and Rockfield allowed us the freedom," Osbourne once said. "No-one would allow us to play as loud as that. The roof tiles were rattling." Of all the musical memories made at Rockfield, Kingsley said hearing Mercury's solo while recording Bohemian Rhapsody is one of his favourites. "I remember that particular solo because it was so outstanding," he said. Even when Queen finished recording and left the studio, he had still not heard the song - with its range of styles including a ballad, operatic and hard rock components – in full. "It was done [in the studio] in three sections, and when it left here I only ever heard the sections. They were never actually put together as a unit," he said. Kingsley said he first heard it in full on the radio when he was driving down the M4 motorway. "I was amazed when I heard it. I thought it was fantastic," he recalled. Simon Pearson Electric guitarist Olly Pearson performed as part of the flash mob in Paris
summary_src:
This week marks 50 years since Queen completed the recording of their iconic song "Bohemian Rhapsody" at Rockfield Studios near Monmouth. Studio co-founder Kingsley Ward recalls the band's return in 1975, financially successful after their 1974 struggles, and witnessing Freddie Mercury begin writing the song, then known as "Freddie's Thing." Ward, initially unaware of its significance, later heard the multi-sectional masterpiece in its entirety for the first time on the radio.

Rockfield Studios, founded by Kingsley and his brother Charles in the 1960s, boasts a rich history, having hosted legendary bands like Oasis and Black Sabbath, with Ozzy Osbourne praising the freedom it offered for loud, uninhibited recording. Among his many memories, Ward cherishes hearing Mercury's outstanding solo during the "Bohemian Rhapsody" sessions.

The song continues to resonate globally, recently celebrated with Brian May and Roger Taylor performing at the Last Night of the Proms, and gaining new viral fame through a Parisian flash mob featuring electric guitarist Olly Pearson performing Brian May's famous solo.

**यहां उस अंग्रेजी समाचार सारांश का हिंदी अनुवाद है:**

**क्वीन के "बोहेमियन रैप्सोडी" की रिकॉर्डिंग के 50 साल पूरे**

इस हफ़्ते मॉनमाउथ के पास रॉकफ़ील्ड स्टूडियोज़ में क्वीन द्वारा अपने प्रतिष्ठित गीत "बोहेमियन रैप्सोडी" की रिकॉर्डिंग पूरी होने के 50 साल पूरे हो गए हैं। स्टूडियो के सह-संस्थापक किंग्स्ले वार्ड 1975 में बैंड की वापसी को याद करते हैं, जब वे 1974 की अपनी कठिनाइयों के बाद आर्थिक रूप से सफल हो चुके थे। उन्होंने फ़्रेडी मर्करी को गीत लिखना शुरू करते देखा, जिसे तब "फ़्रेडीज़ थिंग" के नाम से जाना जाता था। वार्ड, जो शुरुआत में इसके महत्व से अनजान थे, ने बाद में रेडियो पर इस बहु-खंडीय उत्कृष्ट कृति को पहली बार पूरी तरह से सुना।

1960 के दशक में किंग्स्ले और उनके भाई चार्ल्स द्वारा स्थापित रॉकफ़ील्ड स्टूडियोज़ का एक समृद्ध इतिहास रहा है, जिसने ओएसिस और ब्लैक सब्बाथ जैसे दिग्गज बैंड्स की मेज़बानी की है। ऑज़ी ऑस्बॉर्न ने तो यहाँ ज़ोरदार और बेरोकटोक रिकॉर्डिंग के लिए मिली आज़ादी की भी प्रशंसा की थी। अपनी कई यादों में से, वार्ड "बोहेमियन रैप्सोडी" के सत्रों के दौरान मर्करी के असाधारण सोलो को सुनने को विशेष रूप से संजोते हैं।

यह गीत आज भी वैश्विक स्तर पर लोगों के साथ जुड़ता है, हाल ही में ब्रायन मे और रोजर टेलर ने 'लास्ट नाइट ऑफ़ द प्रॉम्‍स' में प्रदर्शन करके इसका जश्न मनाया। साथ ही, इसने एक पेरिसियन फ्लैश मॉब के माध्यम से नई वायरल ख्याति भी प्राप्त की है, जिसमें इलेक्ट्रिक गिटारिस्ट ऑली पियर्सन ने ब्रायन मे का प्रसिद्ध सोलो बजाया।

title_src: The unknown Manchester lady who funded a Hogwarts-style library
text_src: Unknown lady who funded a Hogwarts-style library 10 hours ago Share Save Rumeana Jahangir North West Share Save University of Manchester Enriqueta Rylands lived in Cuba and France before moving to England Often compared to Hogwarts school in the Harry Potter novels, the John Rylands Library frequently elicits a whisper of "wow" when visitors step in from the bustle of Manchester city centre. The shrine to knowledge, which cost the equivalent of about £100 million in today's money at its 1900 opening, holds archives including ancients fragments of scriptures and the notes of computing pioneer Alan Turing. It is celebrating its 125th anniversary this year but little is known about its Cuban-born founder who, on her death, left an estate worth a staggering £376 million. Born Enriqueta Augustina Tennant in 1843, she was the daughter of a French-American woman and a merchant from northern England. Dr Elizabeth Gow, who is a manuscript curator at John Rylands Library, says: "In Cuba, she was part of the privileged class of white plantation owners - the family did own enslaved people." Following her father's death in a rail accident, Enriqueta moved to New York where her mother Camila married the exiled Polish musician Julian Fontana, better known for his work with the composer Frederic Chopin. University of Manchester The John Rylands Library cost the equivalent of about £100m in today's money The family later lived in Paris, until Camila's death in 1855. Enriqueta was then sent with her younger siblings to live with her father's family in England. Dr Gow says her Cuban-born identity was seen as "less prestigious" and "viewed as being tainted and not quite British, even though her father was British". "It's unclear whether she inherited anything or much. Her uncle and, for a while, her stepfather both received money from the estate for caring for the children and giving them an education." Despite growing up among affluence, it seems that Enriqueta did not possess much wealth and she later became a companion and aide to Martha, the second wife of the Lancashire textile manufacturer John Rylands - dubbed "Manchester's first multi-millionaire". Dr Gow, who is writing a biography of Enriqueta, describes him as a "Lancashire man through and through" whose father's firm Rylands & Sons grew from a small setup into one of the most successful in Britain. Getty Images John Rylands was possibly Britain's first self-made multimillionaire Known for working up to 19 hours a day, John Rylands was also rated for his business acumen. "I think he's actually Britain's first self-made multimillionaire, because in Britain at the time most of the people with huge amounts of wealth were aristocrats," Dr Gow says. "In Victorian terms, he'd made himself rich off his own work. Obviously we know that a lot of people laboured to produce that wealth both in Britain but also in America and India, growing cotton. "By the 1890s, when Enriqueta Rylands had inherited his share in the company, slavery had been abolished, but there were still exploitative working practices which underpinned the huge wealth that went into building the library." Yet John Rylands, who had a strong Christian faith, supported the abolition of slavery and sold cotton by people who were not enslaved in a movement similar to the current fair trade trend. He was known to have built model mills in Wigan and donated to the needy across Manchester and in Rome, to the extent that he was granted an award by Italian royalty. University of Manchester Based in Deansgate, the John Rylands Library took 10 years to construct Following the death of his wife Martha, the 75-year-old married Enriqueta, then aged 32. "She wasn't considered a young wife, so if she'd intended to marry and have children, she was older than you'd expect." Rylands' seven children from his first marriage died during his lifetime and along with Enriqueta, he adopted a son and daughter. The couple supported educational projects locally and, a year after his death at their Longford Hall home in Stretford, Enriqueta commissioned the library in Deansgate. She inherited most of her husband's wealth - estimated at £291 million in current money - and invested a significant part in the collections and 10-year construction of the library, which opened on New Year's Day 1900. University of Manchester The library's collection includes early Biblical scrolls and illuminated Turkish manuscripts There are no records of Enriqueta's diaries, making it "difficult to get a sense of her as a person", says Dr Gow. "What we know first-hand is what she was like when she was founding the library, when she was in her 40s and 50s. "I think especially to do that as a woman in the 1890s, you get the impression a lot of people didn't take her seriously and she got frustrated with that sometimes. "She usually moderated what she said but, at the same time, found ways to generally get her own way, mostly by being the one with the money." About 27,000 people visited the library in its first year and Dr Gow says "some commentators in London couldn't comprehend why rare books and manuscripts were going to Manchester" when Enriqueta bought collections. "But I think the Manchester press was quite unified in explaining that it was a cultured city and this cultural philanthropy would benefit the city, and shouldn't just be hived off to London." 'Never-ending' archive The archive now includes Babylonian tablets that date from 3,000 years ago, fragments of early Biblical scrolls and Chinese printing. Among the library's staff was the Iraqi-born historian Alphonse Mingana, who posthumously achieved fame after it was recently revealed he acquired one of the earliest surviving fragments of the Quran, which is kept in Birmingham. Dr Gow believes the Rylands archive has a "never-ending supply of amazing things", adding: "One of the things which we're going to show regularly is a copy of the Gutenberg Bible, which is the first substantial book printed with movable type in Europe." She says she "can't name just one" highlight of the collection but says one of her favourite items is a "beautifully illuminated Turkish manuscript with the love story of Layla and Majnoon from the 15th Century". More than a century after its launch, the library continues to wow 350,000 visitors every year.

## Manchester's 'Hogwarts-Style' Library Celebrates 125 Years, Unveiling Founder Enriqueta Rylands' Remarkable Story

The University of Manchester's John Rylands Library, a Gothic architectural marvel often likened to a "Hogwarts-style" institution, is celebrating its 125th anniversary this year. At its opening in 1900, the library cost the equivalent of £100 million in today's money and was the ambitious vision of its enigmatic founder, Enriqueta Rylands.

Housing an extraordinary collection of archives, including ancient scripture fragments, notes from computing pioneer Alan Turing, Babylonian tablets, and a Gutenberg Bible, the library continues to draw 350,000 visitors annually to its Manchester home.

Born Enriqueta Augustina Tennant in Cuba in 1843 to a privileged white plantation-owning family, her early life involved significant travel from New York to Paris before settling in England with her father's family after her mother's death. Despite a seemingly affluent upbringing, Dr. Elizabeth Gow, a manuscript curator and biographer, notes that Enriqueta initially possessed little personal wealth and faced social challenges due to her Cuban identity being perceived as "less prestigious" in Victorian Britain.

Her path changed when she became a companion to Martha, the second wife of John Rylands, a pioneering Lancashire textile manufacturer and arguably Britain's first self-made multimillionaire. Known for his intense work ethic, strong Christian faith, and philanthropic efforts, John Rylands was a vocal abolitionist who supported ethical, fair trade-like practices. After Martha's death, the 75-year-old John married Enriqueta, then 32.

Upon John's death, Enriqueta inherited most of his immense fortune, an estimated £291 million in current money. She dedicated a significant portion to commissioning and constructing the library in Manchester, a ten-year undertaking. Dr. Gow highlights Enriqueta's resolute character, noting that despite facing dismissiveness as a woman in the 1890s, she often leveraged her financial independence to ensure her plans for the library came to fruition.

The John Rylands Library quickly gained renown, with its "never-ending supply of amazing things" challenging the prevailing notion that such significant cultural treasures should be confined to London. More than a century later, it stands as a testament to Enriqueta's enduring philanthropic legacy, a global shrine to knowledge in the heart of Manchester.
