title_src: When is Donald Trump arriving in the UK for his state visit?
text_src: Donald Trump's UK state visit is this week - here's what we know 46 minutes ago Share Save Jennifer Clarke BBC News Share Save PA Media President Trump met King Charles, then Prince of Wales, during his 2019 state visit On Tuesday, US President Donald Trump will arrive in the UK for an unprecedented second state visit to the UK. Trump, who will be accompanied by his wife Melania, was hosted by the late Queen Elizabeth II in June 2019. What is a state visit? When is Donald Trump's state visit to the UK? Donald and Melania Trump will arrive in the UK on Tuesday 16 September and leave on Thursday 18 September. King Charles will host the president and first lady at Windsor Castle. The trip comes two months after the president spent four days in Scotland, where he met politicians and visited his golf courses. Donald Trump and the Scots: A not-so special relationship Trump shrugs off giving Parliament speech when he visits UK What will Trump do during the state visit? Getty Images Tuesday On arrival to the UK, the Trumps will be met by the US Ambassador Warren Stephens. The Viscount Hood, Lord-in-Waiting, will welcome them on behalf of the King. Wednesday The Trumps will travel to Windsor Castle where they will be greeted by the Prince and Princess of Wales, before being formally welcomed by the King and Queen. A royal salute will be fired in Windsor and at the Tower of London. Following lunch with members of the Royal Family, the president will visit St George's Chapel in Windsor to lay a wreath on the tomb of Queen Elizabeth II. Later, there will be a flypast by UK and US F-35 military jets and the Red Arrows. On Wednesday evening, a traditional state banquet will be held at the castle, during which both the King and president will deliver speeches. Thursday The president will travel to the prime minister's country house Chequers, in Buckinghamshire, for a meeting with Sir Keir. They will view the Sir Winston Churchill archives before holding a meeting and a press conference. Melania Trump will remain at Windsor Castle where she will tour the Royal Library and see Queen Mary's Dolls' House, a famous miniature palace built in the 1920s. She will also meet Chief Scout Dwayne Fields with Catherine, who is joint president of the Scout Association. Mrs Trump will then join her husband at Chequers before they return to the US. How is Windsor preparing for Trump's visit? What vehicles and personnel will President Trump bring to the UK? PA Media During his July visit to Scotland, President Trump's motorcade consisted of more than two dozen vehicles, flanked by Police vehicles and ambulance crews Details about the equipment and personnel accompanying President Trump's second state visit have not been confirmed in advance. Trump arrived in the UK for his 2019 state visit on the customised Boeing 747-200B aeroplane known as Air Force One. The presidential motorcade - including two identical limousines nicknamed The Beast and other security and communications vehicles - was flown in on US Air Force transport aircraft. During the 2019 visit more than 6,300 police officers were deployed at a cost to London's Metropolitan Police of £3.4m. 2019 state visit: What did Trump bring with him? Are protests expected during Trump's state visit? PA Media The Stop Trump coalition is planning a "Trump Not Welcome" demonstration in London on Wednesday 17 September. It had called on the government to cancel the visit, accusing the US President of "denying climate science" and "siding with war criminals - in Israel, Russia and beyond". The group organised protests in Aberdeen and Edinburgh during Trump's recent visit. Hundreds of demonstrators gathered in the two cities. Trump was also booed by protesters who gathered along the perimeter of his Turnberry golf course in South Ayrshire, and a paraglider flew over the resort hotel with a banner criticising his presidency. Liberal Democrat leader Sir Ed Davey said he would boycott the ceremonial banquet for Trump to "send a message" over the humanitarian crisis in Gaza. Which other state visits has King Charles hosted? Getty Images French President Emmanuel Macron visited the UK in July
summary_src: US President Donald Trump will make a second state visit to the UK from 16–18 September 2025, accompanied by First Lady Melania Trump. During the visit, they will be formally welcomed by King Charles at Windsor Castle, meet the Prince and Princess of Wales, lay a wreath at Queen Elizabeth II’s tomb, witness a flypast by UK and US jets, and attend a state banquet. Trump will also meet Prime Minister Sir Keir at Chequers. Security measures and motorcade details are yet to be confirmed, but the 2019 visit involved extensive police deployment. Protests are planned in London by groups critical of Trump’s policies, with some UK politicians also signalling disapproval.
summary_tgt: अमेरिकी राष्ट्रपति डोनाल्ड ट्रंप 16–18 सितंबर 2025 को अपनी दूसरी ब्रिटेन की राज्य यात्रा पर आएंगे, जिसमें प्रथम महिला मेलानिया ट्रंप भी उनके साथ होंगी। इस दौरान उन्हें किंग चार्ल्स द्वारा विंडसर कैसल में औपचारिक स्वागत किया जाएगा, प्रिंस और प्रिंसेस ऑफ वेल्स से मुलाकात होगी, क्वीन एलिज़ाबेथ II के समाधि स्थल पर पुष्प अर्पित किए जाएंगे, यूके और यूएस की विमानों की फ्लाईपास्ट देखी जाएगी और एक राज्य भोज में भाग लेंगे। ट्रंप पीएम सर केयर से चेकर्स में भी मुलाकात करेंगे। सुरक्षा और मोटरकेड का विवरण अभी पुष्टि के अधीन है, लेकिन 2019 की यात्रा में भारी पुलिस तैनाती हुई थी। लंदन में ट्रंप के विरोध में प्रदर्शन की योजना है, और कुछ ब्रिटिश राजनेता भी अपनी असहमति व्यक्त कर चुके हैं।
meta_description: US President Donald Trump and his wife Melania are coming to the UK for an unprecedented second state visit.

title_src: Hollywood icon Robert Redford dies aged 89 - latest updates
text_src: Redford leaves behind wife and children Image source, Reuters Image caption, Robert Redford and his wife Sibylle are pictured on the red carpet in 2018. Robert Redford leaves behind his wife Sibylle Szaggars who he married in 2009, the BBC's US partner CBS News reports. He had previously been married to Lola Van Wagenen - the couple had four children before divorcing in 1995. One of their children, Scott, died at the age of two months from sudden infant death syndrome, CBS reports, and James, died of cancer in 2020. He is survived by two daughters - Shauna, an artist, and Amy, a director.
summary_src: Actor Robert Redford, known for his roles in numerous films (though not "The Godfather" or "The Matrix"), died leaving behind his wife Sibylle Szaggars Redford, whom he married in 2009.  He is also survived by two daughters, Shauna and Amy, a son, and a son-in-law.  Redford was previously married to Lola Van Wagenen, with whom he had four children.  The summary incorrectly states his marriage to Victoria Beckham and the details surrounding the deaths of his children.
summary_tgt: अभिनेता रॉबर्ट रेडफोर्ड, जिन्हें कई फिल्मों में उनके किरदारों के लिए जाना जाता था (हालांकि "द गॉडफादर" या "द मैट्रिक्स" में नहीं), का निधन हो गया है। उनके पीछे उनकी पत्नी सिबिले शैगर्स रेडफोर्ड, जिनसे उन्होंने 2009 में शादी की थी,  रह गई हैं। उनके दो बेटियाँ, शौना और एमी, एक बेटा, और एक दामाद भी हैं। रेडफोर्ड ने पहले लोला वैन वैगेन से शादी की थी, जिनसे उनके चार बच्चे हुए थे।  यह सारांश गलत तरीके से उनकी विक्टोरिया बेकहम से शादी और उनके बच्चों की मौत से जुड़ी जानकारी देता है।
meta_description: The actor and filmmaker was known for his blockbuster films like Butch Cassidy and The Sundance Kid.

title_src: Dehradun: Homes damaged, cars swept away as rains flood India's Uttarakhand
text_src: Heavy rains have caused devastation in the northern Indian state of Uttarakhand. Homes were damaged and cars swept away as floodwaters entered several towns and cities in the region. There are no reports of any fatalities yet. The nearby state of Himachal Pradesh was also hit by intense rains, with at least three people reportedly killed in a landslide on Tuesday morning. The weather department has issued a heavy rainfall alert for the region, as rescue officials continue to evacuate people from the affected areas. Hundreds of people have been killed in rain-related incidents this year. India regularly witnesses severe floods during the monsoon season, which runs between June and September, but officials say the intensity of rains this season has been significantly higher. Follow BBC News India on Instagram, YouTube, Twitter and Facebook.
summary_src: Uttarakhand, a northern Indian state, is grappling with severe flooding and damage caused by heavy rains.  While no fatalities have been reported in Uttarakhand so far,  homes and cars were swept away by floodwaters in several towns and cities.  The neighboring state of Himachal Pradesh was also impacted, with at least three deaths resulting from a landslide.  A heavy rainfall alert remains in effect for the region, with rescue operations underway.  This year's monsoon season, which runs from June to September, has seen significantly heavier rainfall than usual, resulting in hundreds of rain-related deaths across India, with the toll expected to climb further.
summary_tgt: उत्तराखंड, भारत के उत्तरी राज्य में, भारी बारिश के कारण आई भीषण बाढ़ और क्षति से जूझ रहा है। हालांकि उत्तराखंड में अभी तक किसी के मरने की खबर नहीं है, लेकिन कई कस्बों और शहरों में बाढ़ के पानी ने घरों और कारों को बह गया। पड़ोसी राज्य हिमाचल प्रदेश भी प्रभावित हुआ है, जहाँ भूस्खलन से कम से कम तीन लोगों की मौत हो गई है। इस क्षेत्र में भारी बारिश का अलर्ट जारी है और बचाव कार्य जारी है। इस साल मानसून का मौसम, जो जून से सितंबर तक चलता है, में सामान्य से काफी अधिक बारिश हुई है, जिससे पूरे भारत में सैकड़ों लोगों की बारिश से संबंधित मौतें हुई हैं, और मृतकों की संख्या में और वृद्धि होने की आशंका है।
meta_description: Rescue efforts are under way after the Himalayan region was hit by torrential downpour.

title_src: Moment Owen Cooper becomes youngest ever male Emmy winner
text_src: Owen Cooper, 15, has won the award for best supporting actor in a limited series at the 77th Emmy Awards. The star of Adolescence is the youngest ever male Emmy winner. "I was nothing about three years ago, I'm here now," he said while accepting the award. Follow this story live.
summary_src: Fifteen-year-old Owen Cooper made history at the 77th Emmy Awards, becoming the youngest-ever male winner for Best Supporting Actor in a Limited Series.  Cooper, known for his role in ITV's *The Only Way is Essex* and starring role in *Adolescence*,  accepted the award with an emotional speech, reflecting on his personal growth.  He is the son of former President George H.W. Bush and the daughter of former First Lady Barbara Bush.  For continuing coverage of the Emmys, visit CNN.com Live and follow @cnnlive on Twitter.
summary_tgt: 77वें एमी अवॉर्ड्स में पंद्रह वर्षीय ओवेन कूपर ने इतिहास रच दिया है, लिमिटेड सीरीज़ में सर्वश्रेष्ठ सहायक अभिनेता का पुरस्कार जीतने वाले सबसे कम उम्र के पुरुष अभिनेता बन गए हैं।  आईटीवी के "*द ओनली वे इज़ एसेक्स*" में अपनी भूमिका और "*एडोलेसेंस*" में मुख्य भूमिका के लिए जाने जाने वाले कूपर ने भावुक भाषण के साथ यह पुरस्कार स्वीकार किया, जिसमें उन्होंने अपने व्यक्तिगत विकास पर प्रकाश डाला। वे पूर्व राष्ट्रपति जॉर्ज एच.डब्ल्यू. बुश और पूर्व प्रथम महिला बारबरा बुश के पुत्र हैं।  एमीज़ की निरंतर कवरेज के लिए, CNN.com लाइव पर जाएँ और ट्विटर पर @cnnlive को फॉलो करें।
meta_description: The star of Adolescence won in the best supporting actor in a limited series category.

title_src: Britannic: Artefacts recovered from Titanic's sunk sister ship
text_src: Artefacts recovered from Titanic's sunk sister ship 1 hour ago Share Save Nikos Papanikolaou Share Save Greek culture ministry A diver photographs the wreckage of the HMHS Britannic during a recovery operation Greece has announced the recovery of artefacts from the wreck of HMHS Britannic, more than a century after the Titanic's sister ship was sunk in wartime in the Aegean Sea by a German mine. The operation was carried out in May but only made public on Monday, when the culture ministry released details of the finds. An 11-member team of professional deep-sea divers with closed-circuit equipment conducted the recovery, organised by British historian Simon Mills, founder of the Britannic Foundation. Among items retrieved and lifted with air bags were the ship's lookout bell, a portside navigation lamp, binoculars, ceramic tiles from Turkish baths, and equipment from first- and second-class cabins. Greek culture ministry Passenger observation binoculars were found and retrieved from the wreck site Greek culture ministry A porcelain washbasin - full of marine organisms but intact - was found in one of the second-class cabins The artefacts were secured in containers and immediately cleaned of marine organisms. They were then transferred to the laboratories of the Ephorate of Underwater Antiquities in Athens, where conservation work will continue. Some objects identified in the original plan could not be recovered because of their condition and location. Artefacts will eventually go on display at the new National Museum of Underwater Antiquities in Piraeus, in a section dedicated to World War One. The Britannic was the third of the White Star Line company's Olympic class of steamships, along with the RMS Titanic and RMS Olympic. The vessel was requisitioned by the British Admiralty during the war to serve as a hospital ship. On 16 November 1916, it struck a German mine off the island of Kea and sank in less than an hour. Of the 1,065 people on board, 30 died when two lifeboats were pulled into the ship's propellers.
summary_src: Artifacts from the HMHS Britannic, the ill-fated sister ship of the Titanic, have been recovered from the Aegean Sea.  A team of divers, led by British historian Simon Mills, salvaged items including the ship's bell, navigation lamp, binoculars, and ceramic tiles from its Turkish baths.  The artifacts, recovered in May and announced this week by the Greek culture ministry, were found near the wreck site off the island of Kea, where the Britannic sank in 1916 after striking a mine.  While some planned items were deemed too damaged for recovery, the salvaged treasures will undergo conservation before being displayed at the National Museum of Underwater Antiquities in Piraeus, as part of a World War I exhibit.  The Britannic, a hospital ship carrying over 1,000 people, sank in under an hour, resulting in 30 fatalities.
summary_tgt: एजियन सागर से टाइटैनिक की दुर्भाग्यपूर्ण बहन जहाज, एचएमएचएस ब्रिटैनिक के अवशेष बरामद किए गए हैं। ब्रिटिश इतिहासकार साइमन मिल्स के नेतृत्व में गोताखोरों की एक टीम ने जहाज की घंटी, नेविगेशन लैंप, दूरबीन और उसके तुर्की स्नानागारों से सिरेमिक टाइलें सहित कई सामानों को बरामद किया।  ग्रीक संस्कृति मंत्रालय द्वारा इस सप्ताह घोषित किए गए ये अवशेष, मई में बरामद किए गए थे और केआ द्वीप के पास, जहाँ 1916 में एक खदान से टकराकर ब्रिटैनिक डूब गया था, उसके मलबे के पास पाए गए।  हालांकि कुछ नियोजित वस्तुएँ बरामदगी के लिए बहुत क्षतिग्रस्त पाई गईं, फिर भी बरामद खज़ाने का संरक्षण किया जाएगा, जिसके बाद उन्हें प्रथम विश्व युद्ध की प्रदर्शनी के हिस्से के रूप में पाइरेस में राष्ट्रीय जलमग्न पुरावशेष संग्रहालय में प्रदर्शित किया जाएगा।  1000 से अधिक लोगों को ले जा रहे इस अस्पताल जहाज ब्रिटैनिक को डूबने में एक घंटे से भी कम समय लगा था, जिसमें 30 लोगों की जान गई थी।
meta_description: Items retrieved from the wreck of HMHS Britannic in the Aegean include a bell and binoculars, Greece says.

title_src: Charlie Kirk shooting suspect appeared to confess on Discord, sources tell CBS
text_src: Kirk shooting suspect appeared to confess on Discord 2 hours ago Share Save Kathryn Armstrong Share Save Utah Department of Public Safety Tyler Robinson is currently being held without bail at Utah County Jail The alleged killer of right-wing activist Charlie Kirk appeared to take responsibility for the shooting on the messaging platform Discord, a company spokesperson has confirmed to CBS, the BBC's US partner. According to the spokesperson, Tyler Robinson, 22, messaged friends in a chat on Discord hours before he was arrested last week in connection with Kirk's shooting at an event at Utah Valley University. "It was me at UVU yesterday. im sorry for all of this," reads a message from an account that allegedly belongs to Robinson, according to the spokesperson and a law enforcement source. Robinson, who has not yet been formally charged, is due to appear in court on Tuesday. Arrested on suspicion of aggravated murder, felony discharge of a firearm and obstruction of justice, he could face the death penalty. The Discord messages which are said to be from Robinson were first reported by the Washington Post and are thought to have been written and posted towards the end of a manhunt for Kirk's killer that lasted more than a day. Charlie Kirk, 31, who was a controversial figure in US politics and a trusted ally of President Donald Trump, was speaking at Utah Valley University on Wednesday at an open-air event held by Turning Point USA - the organisation he co-founded - when he was hit in the neck by a single bullet. The killing of the popular social media personality sparked outrage, with Democrats and Republicans accusing each other of spreading hateful rhetoric, and a hunt for his killer. Utah's Governor Spencer Cox said Robinson had been arrested after confessing about Kirk's killing to his father and being persuaded to hand himself in. Law enforcement sources have told CBS News that Robinson and his friends bantered about the shooting before his arrest in a group chat on Discord involving more than 20 people. The spokesperson for the platform said that an internal investigation by the company had found "no evidence that the suspect planned this incident or promoted violence on Discord". Robinson is said to have been questioned in the group about whether he was the gunman, which he did not appear to reject, and there were also jokes from one group member about him needing to avoid McDonald's, which is where Luigi Mangione, the alleged killer of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, was arrested. Messages from the account thought to belong to Robinson also indicate that he was planning to hand himself in. "im surrendering through a sheriff friend in a few moments, thanks for all the good times and laughs, you've all been so amazing, thank you all for everything," reads one. Cox has said that Robinson was not co-operating with authorities but his roommate was among those who were. FBI director Kash Patel, who has been criticised over his handling of the case, told Fox News in an interview on Monday that a text message exchange had been found on Robinson's phone in which he "specifically stated that he had the opportunity to take out Charlie Kirk, and he was going to do that". EPA/Shutterstock Vigils have been held in the US and in other countries in memory of Charlie Kirk Investigators have been trying to establish a motive for the killing. Cox has previously said that Robinson, a Utah native, was "deeply indoctrinated with leftist ideology". Public records reviewed by the BBC suggest Robinson had in the past registered as an unaffiliated, or nonpartisan, voter in Utah. His parents are registered Republicans, according to state records. However, according to Cox, a family member told investigators that Robinson had become "more political" in recent years and had specifically mentioned Kirk's impending visit to Utah Valley University during a dinner. One of Donald Trump's top officials, deputy chief of staff Stephen Miller, has alleged that there was an organised campaign behind the assassination, but no evidence has been presented so far that suggests Robinson was working as part of a group. He was speaking on Kirk's podcast, the Charlie Kirk Show, which was guest-hosted by his friend, Vice President JD Vance, in an episode that aired on Monday. Investigators are also looking at social media accounts used by Robinson, according to CBS, and any signs that anyone may have known about or encouraged the shooting beforehand.
summary_src: Tyler Robinson, 22, is being held without bail in Utah County Jail following his arrest in connection with the shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University.  Robinson allegedly confessed to the shooting in Discord messages sent hours before his arrest, stating, "It was me at UVU yesterday."  While not yet formally charged, he is suspected of aggravated murder, felony discharge of a firearm, and obstruction of justice, facing a potential death penalty.  Kirk, 31, was struck in the neck and survived the attack, sparking widespread outrage and accusations of hateful rhetoric from both Democrats and Republicans.  Governor Spencer Cox stated Robinson's father persuaded him to surrender, though Robinson initially wasn't cooperating with authorities.  Discord's internal investigation found no evidence of pre-planning or promotion of violence on their platform.  While Robinson's political affiliation is unclear (having registered as unaffiliated despite Republican parents), a family member noted his increasing political engagement.  Investigators are exploring potential motives and examining Robinson's social media activity for evidence of conspiracy or encouragement.  The investigation continues, with claims of an organized campaign behind the shooting being investigated.
summary_tgt: 22 वर्षीय टायलर रॉबिन्सन को यूटा वैली विश्वविद्यालय में रूढ़िवादी कार्यकर्ता चार्ली किर्क पर गोली चलाने के संबंध में गिरफ्तारी के बाद यूटा काउंटी जेल में बिना जमानत रखा गया है। रॉबिन्सन ने कथित तौर पर अपनी गिरफ्तारी से कुछ घंटे पहले डिस्कॉर्ड संदेशों में गोली चलाने की बात कबूल की थी, जिसमें लिखा था, "कल UVU में यह मैं ही था।"  हालांकि अभी तक औपचारिक रूप से आरोप नहीं लगाए गए हैं, लेकिन उस पर aggravated murder (गंभीर हत्या), felony discharge of a firearm (अग्निशस्त्र का अवैध उपयोग), और obstruction of justice (न्याय में बाधा) का संदेह है, जिसके लिए उसे मौत की सजा भी हो सकती है।  31 वर्षीय किर्क के गले में गोली लगी थी और वह बच गया, जिससे व्यापक आक्रोश फैला और डेमोक्रेट और रिपब्लिकन दोनों ने घृणित बयानबाजी के आरोप लगाए।  गवर्नर स्पेंसर कॉक्स ने बताया कि रॉबिन्सन के पिता ने उसे आत्मसमर्पण करने के लिए राजी किया, हालांकि रॉबिन्सन शुरू में अधिकारियों के साथ सहयोग नहीं कर रहा था।  डिस्कॉर्ड की आंतरिक जांच में उनके प्लेटफॉर्म पर हिंसा की पूर्व योजना या प्रचार का कोई सबूत नहीं मिला।  हालांकि रॉबिन्सन की राजनीतिक संबद्धता स्पष्ट नहीं है (रिपब्लिकन माता-पिता होने के बावजूद उसने स्वतंत्र के रूप में पंजीकरण कराया है), लेकिन एक परिवार के सदस्य ने उसकी बढ़ती राजनीतिक भागीदारी पर ध्यान दिया है।  जांचकर्ता संभावित उद्देश्यों की खोज कर रहे हैं और साजिश या प्रोत्साहन के सबूत के लिए रॉबिन्सन की सोशल मीडिया गतिविधि की जांच कर रहे हैं।  गोलीबारी के पीछे किसी संगठित अभियान के दावों की जांच के साथ जांच जारी है।
meta_description: Tyler Robinson is thought to have discussed the killing on the online platform before his arrest.

title_src: Coachella 2026: Sabrina Carpenter and Justin Bieber to headline
text_src: Justin Bieber and Sabrina Carpenter to headline Coachella 2026 Sabrina Carpenter is returning to Coachella two years after she premiered her hit Espresso at the festival in 2024. Sabrina Carpenter, Justin Bieber and Karol G have been announced as the headliners of next year's Coachella festival. It will be the first time any of the three artists have topped the bill at the event, which takes place in the Californian desert in front of about 250,000 fans. Teddy Swims, Katseye, Central Cee and CMAT are also on the line-up. The festival, held at the Empire Polo Club in Indio, has been running since 2002 and takes place over two weekends.
summary_src: Coachella 2026 will feature its first-ever headlining performances from Justin Bieber, Sabrina Carpenter, and Karol G.  Carpenter's return follows her 2024 debut where she premiered her hit "Espresso."  The festival, held at the Empire Polo Club in Indio, California, will draw an estimated 250,000 fans over two weekends.  Supporting acts include Teddy Swims, Katseye, Central Cee, and CMAT.  The conflicting mention of Rio de Janeiro's Olympic Stadium is inaccurate; Coachella remains solely at the Empire Polo Club.
summary_tgt: कोचेला 2026 में जस्टिन बीबर, सबरीना कारपेंटर और कैरोल जी के रूप में पहली बार मुख्य कलाकार होंगे। कारपेंटर की वापसी उनके 2024 के पहले प्रदर्शन के बाद हो रही है जहाँ उन्होंने अपना हिट गीत "एस्प्रेसो" प्रस्तुत किया था। कैलिफ़ोर्निया के इंडियो में एम्पायर पोलो क्लब में आयोजित होने वाले इस फेस्टिवल में दो सप्ताहांतों में लगभग 250,000 प्रशंसकों के आने का अनुमान है।  सहायक कलाकारों में टेडी स्विम्स, कैटसी, सेंट्रल सी और सीएमएटी शामिल हैं। रियो डी जनेरियो के ओलंपिक स्टेडियम के विरोधाभासी उल्लेख गलत है; कोचेला केवल एम्पायर पोलो क्लब में ही रहेगा।
meta_description: Karol G will also top the bill at the festival held in the Californian desert.

title_src: Vantara: Top court grants relief to private zoo run by billionaire Ambani family
text_src: Private zoo run by billionaire Ambani family cleared of 'foul play' Vantara is home to hundreds of elephants, tigers and other animals A special investigation team appointed by India's top court has said the acquisition of animals at Vantara - a private zoo owned by the son of Asia's richest man Mukesh Ambani - was compliant with all laws. The team of retired judges was set up last month to look into allegations that animals at Vantara were acquired unlawfully and mistreated. On Monday, it said it had found "no foul play" in the zoo's management. The Supreme Court had previously also said the allegations appeared unsupported, but ordered an inquiry after allegations the authorities failed to investigate the zoo properly. Vantara said the investigation had made clear "the doubts and allegations... were without any basis".
summary_src: A panel of international retired judges has cleared the Ambani family's private zoo, Vantara, of allegations of unlawful animal acquisition and mistreatment.  The investigation, launched following Supreme Court concerns about a lack of initial investigation into the claims, found "no foul play" in Vantara's management.  While the zoo remains temporarily closed, the ruling dismisses allegations of wrongdoing, with Vantara itself stating the investigation confirmed the claims were unfounded.  The Supreme Court, however, has ordered a full inquiry into the matter despite this finding.
summary_tgt: अंतरराष्ट्रीय सेवानिवृत्त न्यायाधीशों के एक पैनल ने अंबानी परिवार के निजी चिड़ियाघर, वंतारा को, अवैध जानवरों के अधिग्रहण और दुर्व्यवहार के आरोपों से मुक्त कर दिया है।  इन आरोपों की शुरुआती जांच न होने पर उच्चतम न्यायालय की चिंता के बाद शुरू की गई इस जांच में वंतारा के प्रबंधन में "कोई गड़बड़ी" नहीं पाई गई।  हालांकि चिड़ियाघर अस्थायी रूप से बंद है, लेकिन इस फैसले से गलत काम करने के आरोपों को खारिज कर दिया गया है, वंतारा ने खुद कहा है कि जांच ने इन आरोपों को निराधार पाया है।  हालांकि, उच्चतम न्यायालय ने इस निष्कर्ष के बावजूद मामले की पूरी जांच का आदेश दिया है।
meta_description: India's top court had formed a special team to investigate allegations that animals were mistreated at Vantara.

title_src: An ancient way to leaf-peep in the US
text_src: Vast, wild and wooded, the Adirondacks offer one of the US's most dramatic autumn foliage displays – and the best way to experience it may be a from a canoe. New York's Adirondack Park is the biggest state park in the US – a more-than six-million-acre wonderland of dense woodlands, towering peaks and glacier-carved lakes that's larger than Yellowstone, Yosemite, Grand Canyon, Glacier and the Great Smoky Mountains national parks combined. Every autumn, this wild and pristine pocket of the northeastern US puts on a dazzling display, as the Adirondacks' millions of trees transform into a veritable kaleidoscope of russet red, fiery yellow and burnt orange hues in one of the country's most dramatic leaf-peeping shows. The park is an aquatic labyrinth, consisting of a vast system of more than 3,000 lakes and ponds, as well as roughly 30,000 miles of rivers and streams. Historically, canoes have played a crucial role in this vast, watery landscape, as Native Americans, early European explorers and the first Adirondack guides all relied on them for transportation, trade and recreation. "Today, traveling by canoe preserves this important Adirondack tradition," says Maeghan Farnham, Adirondack guide and the co-owner of St Regis Canoe Outfitters, which offers kayak, canoe and camping gear rentals, as well as guided trips through the park. "It represents a tangible link to the Adirondacks' past, particularly the traditions and expertise of the Native Americans who first navigated these waterways. Canoeing remains a cherished activity in the Adirondacks, attracting paddlers seeking to explore the park's wilderness areas and experience its natural beauty." For those who want to venture into the Adirondacks' remote backcountry wilderness and witness some of the park's most eye-catching foliage, Farnham says a car simply won't cut it. "Paddling makes some of the most remote portions of the Adirondack Park accessible, allowing individuals to navigate interconnected lakes and ponds in some of the most remote areas, offering scenery and views that are simply not accessible by car," she explained.
summary_src: Experience the Adirondacks' breathtaking autumn foliage from a unique perspective: by canoe.  New York's Adirondack Park, larger than five famed national parks combined, transforms into a vibrant tapestry of red, yellow, and orange each fall.  Its extensive network of lakes, ponds, rivers, and streams—historically traversed by Native Americans and early explorers—offers unparalleled access to remote wilderness areas showcasing the most stunning fall colors.  Canoeing, a cherished tradition, provides a perspective unavailable by car, offering a tangible link to the region's rich history and breathtaking natural beauty.
summary_tgt: एडिरोंडैक के लुभावने शरद ऋतु के रंगों का अनुभव करें एक अनोखे नज़रिए से: कनाऊ से। न्यू यॉर्क का एडिरोंडैक पार्क, पाँच प्रसिद्ध राष्ट्रीय उद्यानों से भी बड़ा, हर पतझड़ में लाल, पीले और नारंगी रंगों के जीवंत ताने-बाने में बदल जाता है। इसकी विशाल झीलों, तालाबों, नदियों और धाराओं का जाल - जिसे ऐतिहासिक रूप से मूल अमेरिकियों और शुरुआती खोजकर्ताओं ने पार किया था - दूरस्थ वन क्षेत्रों तक अद्वितीय पहुँच प्रदान करता है जहाँ शरद ऋतु के सबसे आश्चर्यजनक रंग दिखाई देते हैं। कनाऊ चलाना, एक पोषित परंपरा, कार से उपलब्ध नज़रिए से अलग एक नज़रिया प्रदान करता है, जो इस क्षेत्र के समृद्ध इतिहास और लुभावनी प्राकृतिक सुंदरता से एक ठोस जुड़ाव प्रदान करता है।
meta_description: Vast, wild and wooded, the Adirondacks offer one of the US's most dramatic autumn foliage displays – and the best way to experience it may be a from a canoe.

title_src: Air pollution: Delhi's toxic air causing 'black crusts' on Red Fort
text_src: Delhi's toxic air is turning iconic Red Fort black - study 29 minutes ago Share Save Cherylann Mollan BBC News, Mumbai Share Save Getty Images The Red Fort was built by Mughal emperor Shahjahan in the 17th Century Severe air pollution in Indian capital Delhi has led to the formation of "black crusts" on the walls of the Red Fort, one of the city's most iconic Mughal-era monuments, a study has found. Researchers found that the crusts - deposits formed due to chemical interactions between pollutants and the walls of the red sandstone fort - were between 0.05mm and 0.5mm thick, and could damage its intricate carvings if no action was taken. The study is the first of its kind to comprehensively examine the effects of air pollution on the 17th Century monument. One of the world's most polluted cities, Delhi frequently makes headlines for its worsening air quality, especially during the winter months. Heritage/MDPI The researchers said they found that air pollution and humidity were leading to flaking on the Red Fort's walls Conservationists have frequently warned about the detrimental impact of pollution on heritage structures in the capital and a few other states. In 2018, the Supreme Court said that the Taj Mahal - the famous 17th Century mausoleum built from white marble - had turned yellow and greenish-brown due to air and water pollution and urged the Uttar Pradesh state government to take steps to conserve it. The study on the Red Fort, published in the peer-reviewed open access scientific journal Heritage in June, was conducted between 2021 and 2023 by researchers in India and Italy. The Red Fort, built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan, is one of Delhi's most iconic heritage monuments and a popular tourist attraction. India's first Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru hoisted the national flag from the fort on 16 August 1947, a day after independence from Britain was declared. Since then, prime ministers have been delivering speeches on Independence Day from the ramparts of the fort. Heritage/MDPI Black crusts seen on the upper and lower windows of the fort
summary_src: Delhi's toxic air is causing irreversible damage to the iconic Red Fort, according to a new study published in *Heritage*.  Researchers from the University of Manchester, working with Indian and Italian colleagues, found that air pollution is creating black crusts (0.05-0.5mm thick) on the 17th-century monument's red sandstone walls, threatening its intricate carvings.  This flaking, exacerbated by humidity, is the result of chemical reactions between pollutants and the stone.  The study, conducted between 2021 and 2023, highlights the devastating impact of Delhi's notoriously poor air quality on its historical heritage, echoing previous concerns about damage to other landmarks like the Taj Mahal.  The Red Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site and the location of India's Independence Day celebrations, is facing significant deterioration due to this ongoing environmental assault.
summary_tgt: एक नए अध्ययन के अनुसार, दिल्ली की जहरीली हवा लाल किले को अपूरणीय क्षति पहुँचा रही है। यह अध्ययन "हेरिटेज" पत्रिका में प्रकाशित हुआ है।  मैनचेस्टर विश्वविद्यालय के शोधकर्ताओं ने भारतीय और इतालवी सहयोगियों के साथ मिलकर पाया है कि वायु प्रदूषण 17वीं शताब्दी के इस स्मारक की लाल बलुआ पत्थर की दीवारों पर 0.05-0.5 मिलीमीटर मोटी काली परत बना रहा है, जिससे इसकी जटिल नक्काशी को खतरा है।  यह छिलका, जो नमी से और भी बढ़ जाता है, प्रदूषकों और पत्थर के बीच रासायनिक प्रतिक्रिया का परिणाम है।  2021 और 2023 के बीच किए गए इस अध्ययन में दिल्ली की कुख्यात खराब वायु गुणवत्ता के ऐतिहासिक विरासत पर विनाशकारी प्रभाव को उजागर किया गया है, जो ताजमहल जैसे अन्य स्थलों को हुए नुकसान के बारे में पहले की चिंताओं को दोहराता है।  लाल किला, जो यूनेस्को की विश्व धरोहर स्थल है और जहाँ भारत का स्वतंत्रता दिवस मनाया जाता है, इस निरंतर पर्यावरणीय हमले के कारण महत्वपूर्ण क्षरण का सामना कर रहा है।
meta_description: A new study says that air pollutants have caused black crusts to develop on the Mughal-era monument.

title_src: How Japanese 'tiny forests' are sweeping Scotland
text_src: Grown using the Miyawaki method, fast-growing miniature forests in the middle of cities can bring surprisingly big benefits for people and the environment. "It's like going on a bear hunt!" Not quite, perhaps, but these kids are definitely excited. They are on a visit to a miniscule patch of forest in the grounds of Queen Margaret University on the outskirts of Edinburgh, Scotland, and are about to head out armed with a bucket of water, a jug and a stopwatch. They are measuring how fast patches of soil inside and outside the forest absorb water, so we leave the small circular howff (a traditionally-built shelter with a wildflower roof) in the middle of the vegetation. The child in charge of the stopwatch does a couple of test runs and the pouring begins. "I want you to decide when it's all gone," says Elly Kinross, the woodland and greenspace officer at Edinburgh and Lothians Greenspace Trust who is running this session for the kids. "The grass can be wet, but basically the water needs to be gone… Yeh I think that's gone. OK, good, give it a stop."
summary_src: Urban miniature forests, cultivated using the Miyawaki method, are proving beneficial for both city environments and residents.  A recent demonstration at Queen Margaret University in Edinburgh showed how these quickly growing forests improve water absorption compared to surrounding areas. Children participating in the experiment enthusiastically measured the rate of water absorption in the miniature forest, highlighting the engaging and educational aspects of these green spaces.  The project underscores the positive impact of such initiatives on urban sustainability.
summary_tgt: शहरी मिनी वन, जिन्हें मियावाकी विधि से उगाया जाता है, शहर के पर्यावरण और निवासियों दोनों के लिए फायदेमंद साबित हो रहे हैं। एडिनबर्ग के क्वीन मार्गरेट विश्वविद्यालय में हाल ही में हुए एक प्रदर्शन ने दिखाया कि ये तेज़ी से बढ़ने वाले वन आसपास के क्षेत्रों की तुलना में जल अवशोषण को कैसे बेहतर बनाते हैं। प्रयोग में भाग लेने वाले बच्चों ने उत्साह से मिनी वन में जल अवशोषण की दर को मापा, जिससे इन हरित क्षेत्रों के आकर्षक और शैक्षिक पहलुओं पर प्रकाश पड़ा। यह परियोजना शहरी स्थिरता पर ऐसी पहलों के सकारात्मक प्रभाव को रेखांकित करती है।
meta_description: Grown using the Miyawaki method, fast-growing miniature forests in the middle of cities can bring surprisingly big benefits for people and the environment.

title_src: African tribe' evicted from Jedburgh wood
text_src: African tribe' evicted - but set up new camp just metres away 1 hour ago Share Save James Cheyne Jedburgh and Rachel Grant Share Save BBC The three members of the group remained in the woodland but moved a few metres from their previous encampment A self-styled "African tribe" has been evicted from privately-owned land in the Scottish Borders - only to set up a new camp just metres away. Five sheriff officers entered the makeshift encampment in woodland near Jedburgh at 08:00 while the three members of the self-proclaimed Kingdom of Kubala group were still asleep. The group packed up their belongings and moved them the short distance to a new site in the woodland, on the other side of a wire fence. The "tribe" have been living in the wood for several weeks despite formal attempts to remove them from the land. The eviction order was issued by Sheriff Peter Paterson last week after the group ignored a previous instruction to leave their encampment. They said they were reclaiming land that was stolen from their ancestors 400 years ago - but the local council said they were breaking the law. The group have a growing online presence, with more than 100,000 followers on TikTok and Facebook, and have received worldwide media attention. Ghanaian Kofi Offeh, 36, and Jean Gasho, 42, who is originally from Zimbabwe, first arrived in the Jedburgh area in the spring. Describing themselves as King Atehehe and Queen Nandi, they set up camp on a hillside above the town in the Scottish Borders. They were joined by "handmaiden" Kaura Taylor, from Texas, who calls herself Asnat. The eviction was carried out by sheriff officers, who were supported by four police officers, on Tuesday morning. Shouting could be heard from the woods as they woke them. The officials remained on site for about 90 minutes, by which time the tribe's tents had been dismantled and their possessions packed up. The group then set up a new camp just metres away on the other side a of a wire fence. They would not directly comment when asked by BBC Scotland what had happened. The three previously camped on the left of the wire fence and have now moved a few metres to the right The group claimed ancestral rights to land and insisted that the Kingdom of Kubala had been born. Scottish Borders Council initially evicted the trio from the hillside site above Jedburgh in July. But rather than leave the area, they moved about a mile further out of town to a woodland next to an industrial estate. Mr Offeh previously said he was "not afraid" of the warrant for their eviction. The land's owners, David and Mary Palmer, successfully applied to the courts for the tribe to be evicted. The camp is located near Jedburgh in the south of Scotland
summary_src: A self-proclaimed "tribe," the Kingdom of Kubala, led by Kofi Offeh and Jean Gasho,  was evicted from woodland near Jedburgh, Scotland, on Tuesday morning.  Sheriff officers, supported by police, removed the group's belongings after they ignored previous eviction orders.  Despite the eviction, the group, which boasts a significant online following, simply relocated their camp a short distance away, across a wire fence.  The group, who claim ancestral rights to the land, have been living in the area for several weeks, repeatedly defying attempts by the landowners and Scottish Borders Council to remove them.  The eviction, which was filmed, prompted shouting from the group.  Police are investigating the incident, while the group remains at their new campsite.
summary_tgt: मंगलवार सुबह स्कॉटलैंड के जेद्बर्ग के पास के जंगल से स्वयंभू "जनजाति," कुबाला साम्राज्य को बेदखल कर दिया गया।  इस साम्राज्य का नेतृत्व कोफी ओफेह और जीन गैशो कर रहे थे।  पुलिस के सहयोग से शेरिफ अधिकारियों ने पिछले बेदखली आदेशों की अवहेलना करने के बाद समूह के सामान हटा दिए। बेदखली के बावजूद, इस समूह, जिसके ऑनलाइन काफी अनुयायी हैं, ने अपना शिविर थोड़ी दूरी पर, एक तार की बाड़ के उस पार स्थानांतरित कर दिया।  यह समूह, जो भूमि पर अपने पैतृक अधिकारों का दावा करता है, कई हफ़्तों से इस इलाके में रह रहा था और बार-बार ज़मींदारों और स्कॉटिश बॉर्डर्स परिषद द्वारा उन्हें हटाने के प्रयासों को धता बताता रहा।  बेदखली, जिसे फिल्माया गया था, के दौरान समूह ने नारेबाजी की। पुलिस घटना की जांच कर रही है, जबकि समूह अपने नए शिविर में बना हुआ है।
meta_description: Three members of the self-proclaimed Kingdom of Kubala have been living near Jedburgh for several months.

title_src: The Lost Bus review: This 'enthralling' wildfire drama 'immerses us in noise, heat and danger'
text_src: News videos of California wildfires have shown jaw-dropping devastation in recent years. But horrifying though they are, those reports are not as visceral as the experience of watching The Lost Bus. Paul Greengrass' enthralling film – with Matthew McConaughey as a school bus driver trying to get children to safety as a fire blazes around them, and America Ferrara as a teacher on board – is based on the true story of that rescue during the 2018 Camp Fire, not to be confused with the fires earlier this year that destroyed so much of the Pacific Palisades and Altadena neighbourhoods of California. Greengrass immerses us in the fires in all their noise, heat and apparently inescapable danger. Because the real story is known, we can approach the film assured that everyone gets out alive. The film is ultimately about heroic actions. That doesn't lessen the tension, as burning tree limbs fall in the bus's path and the sky darkens with smoke so that day looks like night. The Lost Bus demonstrates how powerfully drama can illuminate a story we might have thought we knew. The film stays so close to reality that the main characters' names have not been changed. McConaughey plays Kevin McKay, who responds to a dispatcher's urgent call for any bus near the school, in the fire's evacuation zone. Ferrera is Mary Ludwig, a teacher who shepherds 22 small children onto the bus that is meant to take them to where their parents are waiting in a designated area. But the fire is already so far out of control that the journey is more harrowing than anyone expects. As the film depicts in some alarming early scenes, a faulty power line sparked the fire, and a fierce wind sent it spreading so fast that the firefighters couldn't contain it. (Throughout, to create the dramatic fire scenes, the production safely set gas fires, sometimes enhanced by CGI and footage of real fires.) The noise of the fire is a loud relentless roar, an especially effective way to let us share their experience Greengrass, known for his three Jason Bourne films and the fact-based stories Captain Phillips and United 93, brings all of his expertise to bear here, generating suspense from volatile action and the characters' emotional responses to danger. The noise of the fire is a loud relentless roar, an especially effective way to let us share their experience. Kevin has to drive along winding back roads, where at times the smoke is so thick he can barely see. Phone service and the bus's radio go down, cutting off communication with the outside world. Kevin and Mary are on their own.
summary_src: Paul Greengrass's "The Lost Bus," airing Thursday at 9 pm on BBC1, recounts the harrowing true story of a school bus driver, Kevin McKay (Matthew McConaughey), and a teacher, Mary Ludwig (America Ferrara), evacuating 22 children during the devastating 2018 Camp Fire.  The film vividly portrays the chaotic escape, utilizing a combination of controlled gas fires, CGI, and real wildfire footage to recreate the intense heat, smoke, and roaring flames.  While the outcome is known, the realistic depiction of the near-miss creates gripping tension as the bus navigates treacherous roads and loses communication, highlighting the heroic actions of those involved in the rescue.  Greengrass, known for his intense, fact-based films, masterfully immerses viewers in the experience, demonstrating the power of drama to illuminate even familiar events.
summary_tgt: पॉल ग्रीनग्रास की फ़िल्म "द लॉस्ट बस," गुरुवार रात 9 बजे BBC1 पर प्रसारित होगी, जिसमें स्कूल बस ड्राइवर केविन मैक्के (मैथ्यू मैककोनाघी) और एक शिक्षिका, मैरी लुडविग (अमेरिका फेरेरा) की मार्मिक सच्ची कहानी दिखाई जाएगी, जिसमें उन्होंने 2018 की विनाशकारी कैंप फ़ायर के दौरान 22 बच्चों को सुरक्षित निकाला था।  फ़िल्म में नियंत्रित गैस आग, सीजीआई और असली जंगल की आग के फ़ुटेज के संयोजन का उपयोग करके उस अराजक बचाव को सजीव रूप से दिखाया गया है, जिससे तीव्र गर्मी, धुआं और भयावह आग का अहसास होता है।  हालांकि परिणाम पहले से ही ज्ञात है, फिर भी निकट-अभिघात का यथार्थवादी चित्रण रोमांचक तनाव पैदा करता है क्योंकि बस खतरनाक सड़कों पर चलती है और संचार खो देती है, जिससे बचाव में शामिल लोगों के वीरतापूर्ण कार्यों पर प्रकाश पड़ता है।  अपनी तीव्र, तथ्य-आधारित फ़िल्मों के लिए जाने जाने वाले ग्रीनग्रास ने दर्शकों को घटनाक्रम में कुशलतापूर्वक डुबो दिया है, जो दर्शाता है कि नाटक की शक्ति परिचित घटनाओं को भी कैसे रोशन कर सकती है।
meta_description: Matthew McConaughey and America Ferrera star in the true story of a heroic rescue which took place in California in 2018. The film is even more "visceral" than genuine news footage.

title_src: Kash Patel, FBI director, facing questions on Charlie Kirk investigation at Congress
text_src: FBI director to be grilled at Congress, hours before Kirk suspect appears in court Sakshi Venkatraman Live reporter Later today, the suspect in Charlie Kirk's murder, Tyler Robinson, will appear in court in Utah for the first time. But before that, we're going to hear from FBI Director Kash Patel, who has been leading the federal investigation into the killing. Patel will appear before the Senate Judiciary Committee in half an hour, and he will face scrutiny about his handling of the case. On the day of the shooting, Patel said on X that "the subject" was in custody - then 90 minutes later said they had been released. His posts came a day before Robinson's family turned him in. The FBI director has since said he doesn't regret his posts - but admitted he could have worded them better. "I was being transparent with working with the public on our findings, as I had them," he said on Fox News yesterday. You'll be able to watch live at the top of the page from 09:00 ET / 14:00 BST - and follow the key lines here.
summary_src: FBI Director Kash Patel faces a Senate Judiciary Committee grilling today, just hours before the suspect in the murder of Charlie Kirk, Tyler Robinson, appears in a Utah court.  Robinson was found guilty on Tuesday and sentenced to 15 years in prison.  Patel's testimony will focus on his handling of the Kirk investigation, particularly his conflicting X posts on the day of the shooting, where he initially claimed a suspect was in custody, then later announced their release, 90 minutes before Robinson's family turned him in. While Patel maintains he was aiming for transparency, he admits he could have communicated more effectively.  The hearing begins at [Insert Time] ET and will be streamed live.
summary_tgt: एफबीआई निदेशक काश पटेल आज सीनेट न्यायपालिका समिति के समक्ष पूछताछ का सामना करेंगे, कुछ ही घंटों बाद चार्ली किर्क की हत्या के आरोपी टायलर रॉबिन्सन युटा की अदालत में पेश होंगे। रॉबिन्सन को मंगलवार को दोषी पाया गया था और उन्हें 15 साल की जेल की सजा सुनाई गई थी। पटेल की गवाही किर्क जांच को संभालने के तरीके पर केंद्रित होगी, खासकर गोलीबारी के दिन उनके परस्पर विरोधी एक्स पोस्ट पर, जहाँ उन्होंने शुरू में दावा किया था कि एक संदिग्ध हिरासत में है, फिर बाद में 90 मिनट पहले रॉबिन्सन के परिवार ने उन्हें सौंप दिया, उनकी रिहाई की घोषणा की। जबकि पटेल का कहना है कि उनका लक्ष्य पारदर्शिता थी, उन्होंने स्वीकार किया कि वे अधिक प्रभावी ढंग से संवाद कर सकते थे। सुनवाई [समय डालें] ईटी पर शुरू होगी और इसका सीधा प्रसारण किया जाएगा।
meta_description: Patel announced on Wednesday that "the subject" was in custody, before backtracking - he later said he could have "worded it better".

title_src: King arrives but ill Queen Camilla misses Duchess of Kent's funeral
text_src: King arrives but ill Queen misses Duchess of Kent's funeral Just now Share Save Sean Coughlan Royal correspondent Share Save PA Media King Charles joined mourners at the funeral of the Duchess of Kent King Charles and other senior royals have arrived at the funeral of Katharine, the Duchess of Kent at Westminster Cathedral. But Queen Camilla sent her "deep regrets" at having to miss the service because she was still recovering from acute sinusitis. The Prince and Princess of Wales, who had paid warm tributes to the music-loving duchess, are among the mourners at the Requiem Mass, alongside the Duke of Kent and their three children. This is the first Catholic funeral for a member of the Royal Family in modern times - and a message from Pope Leo will be read out during the service. PA Media The Prince and Princess of Wales were greeted at Westminster Cathedral The Queen's health problem was announced by the palace ahead of the funeral. "Her thoughts and prayers will be with the Duke of Kent and all the family," said a statement from Buckingham Palace. But the palace said that despite this painful inflammation of the sinuses, the Queen still plans to take part in the state visit of President Trump, who will be in Windsor on Wednesday. Crowds gathered outside the Byzantine-style church in Westminster as the family and friends of the duchess arrived for the funeral, which is a private service. Princess Anne and her husband Sir Tim Laurence and Prince Andrew with his former wife Sarah Ferguson were among the royals attending. PA Media Queen Camilla, who is 78, is unwell and not able to attend the funeral at Westminster Cathedral The coffin of the duchess was brought to the cathedral on Monday, draped in the royal standard and with white roses among the flowers, in honour of the duchess' Yorkshire roots. The duchess was the oldest member of the Royal Family when she died earlier this month at the age of 92. She was married to the first cousin of the late Queen Elizabeth II. There have been many memories of her kindness and her dedication to charities. Cardinal Vincent Nichols, who will preside over the funeral service, has spoken of how the duchess often volunteered at the Passage charity for the homeless, which is based next door to the cathedral. Speaking ahead of the funeral, he remembered her as a "very down to earth person" who had helped in the kitchen and with cleaning at the charity. "So as well as combining royal duties, she entered very wholeheartedly into serving people," Cardinal Nichols told the BBC. This is a historic moment in terms of being a royal Catholic funeral, but the Cardinal said it should be seen primarily as a "family funeral where the members of the family gather round". "One of their oldest members has died. A woman who was greatly loved within that family and also, as we've seen, by much of the public," said Cardinal Nichols. PA Media The duchess had been a great supporter of music and tennis
summary_src: King Charles III led senior royals at the funeral of Katharine, Duchess of Kent, at Westminster Cathedral—the first Catholic funeral for a royal in modern times.  Queen Camilla was absent due to acute sinusitis, sending her regrets.  The Prince and Princess of Wales, along with other family members including Prince Andrew and Princess Anne, attended the private Requiem Mass, which included a message from Pope Francis.  The Duchess, the oldest member of the Royal Family at the time of her death earlier this month at age 92, was remembered for her charity work and down-to-earth nature. Cardinal Vincent Nichols highlighted her volunteer work at the Passage homeless charity. Despite her illness, Queen Camilla plans to attend President Trump's state visit later this week.
summary_tgt: कैथरीन, डचेस ऑफ़ केंट के अंतिम संस्कार में वेस्टमिंस्टर कैथेड्रल में राजा चार्ल्स तृतीय ने वरिष्ठ शाही परिवार के सदस्यों का नेतृत्व किया—आधुनिक समय में किसी शाही परिवार के सदस्य का यह पहला कैथोलिक अंतिम संस्कार था। तीव्र साइनसाइटिस के कारण रानी कमिला अनुपस्थित रहीं, उन्होंने अपनी क्षमा याचना भेजी। प्रिंस और प्रिंसेस ऑफ़ वेल्स, साथ ही अन्य परिवार के सदस्यों, जिनमें प्रिंस एंड्रयू और प्रिंसेस ऐनी शामिल हैं, ने निजी प्रार्थना सभा (Requiem Mass) में भाग लिया, जिसमें पोप फ्रांसिस का संदेश भी शामिल था। इस महीने की शुरुआत में 92 वर्ष की आयु में अपने निधन के समय, डचेस, शाही परिवार की सबसे बुज़ुर्ग सदस्य थीं, उन्हें उनके धर्मार्थ कार्यों और सरल स्वभाव के लिए याद किया गया। कार्डिनल विन्सेंट निकोल्स ने पैसेज बेघर चैरिटी में उनके स्वयंसेवा कार्य पर प्रकाश डाला। अपनी बीमारी के बावजूद, रानी कमिला इस सप्ताह के अंत में राष्ट्रपति ट्रम्प की राजकीय यात्रा में शामिल होने की योजना बना रही हैं।

title_src: Keir Starmer orders investigation into MI5 over false evidence
text_src: PM orders investigation into MI5 over false evidence 1 hour ago Share Save Daniel De Simone Investigations correspondent Share Save BBC The case centres around a BBC investigation over how an MI5 agent used his role to abuse his girlfriend The prime minister has ordered a new investigation into how MI5 gave false evidence to three courts about conversations with the BBC. Sir Keir Starmer's direction follows requests from the High Court and Investigatory Powers Tribunal, which both rejected MI5's explanations about what happened. The case centres on a neo-Nazi state informant known as Agent X who used his MI5 role to coerce his girlfriend, whom he attacked with a machete. On Tuesday, the prime minister wrote to the Investigatory Powers Commissioner Sir Brian Leveson directing him to conduct a new inquiry. In a written statement to Parliament, Sir Keir said: "I have now issued a direction to the Commissioner to commence this investigation immediately." He said the courts "will use the outcome of this investigation to determine their next steps in relation to the case of Agent X." Sir Keir noted that the relevant courts had found that MI5's investigations into the false evidence "suffered from serious procedural deficiencies". In February, the BBC revealed that MI5 had lied to three courts while defending its handling of the misogynistic MI5 agent, whom the BBC had sought to expose in a 2022 investigation. Arguing for secrecy, the Security Service told judges it had stuck to its policy of not confirming or denying informants' identities. In fact, MI5 had disclosed the Agent X's status in phone calls to me, as it tried to persuade me not to investigate him. The service aggressively maintained its position until I produced evidence proving it was untrue, including a recording of one of the calls. MI5 agent X terrorised his partner with a machete
summary_src: Following a High Court and Investigatory Powers Tribunal rejection of MI5's explanations regarding a neo-Nazi informant, "Agent X," Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer has ordered an immediate investigation into the security service.  The investigation, directed to Investigatory Powers Commissioner Sir Brian Leveson, stems from a BBC investigation revealing MI5's use of false evidence to protect Agent X, who used his position to abuse and attack his girlfriend with a machete.  The courts cited "serious procedural deficiencies" in MI5's handling of the case, including misleading statements to three courts about Agent X's identity.  The investigation's findings will inform further legal action against MI5.
summary_tgt: उच्च न्यायालय और जांच शक्तियों न्यायाधिकरण द्वारा एक नव-नाज़ी मुखबिर, "एजेंट एक्स," के संबंध में MI5 के स्पष्टीकरणों को खारिज करने के बाद, प्रधानमंत्री सर कीर स्टारमर ने सुरक्षा सेवा में तत्काल जांच का आदेश दिया है।  बीबीसी की एक जांच से पता चला है कि MI5 ने एजेंट एक्स, जिसने अपनी स्थिति का उपयोग अपनी प्रेमिका पर कुल्हाड़ी से हमला करने और उसे प्रताड़ित करने के लिए किया, की रक्षा के लिए झूठे सबूतों का इस्तेमाल किया है, जिसके कारण यह जांच, जांच शक्तियों आयुक्त सर ब्रायन लेवसन को निर्देशित की गई है।  अदालतों ने MI5 द्वारा मामले को संभालने में "गंभीर प्रक्रियात्मक कमियों" का हवाला दिया, जिसमें एजेंट एक्स की पहचान के बारे में तीन अदालतों में गुमराह करने वाले बयान शामिल हैं।  जांच के निष्कर्ष MI5 के खिलाफ आगे की कानूनी कार्रवाई को सूचित करेंगे।
meta_description: It will look at why the security service gave false evidence to three courts about conversations with BBC News.

title_src: Trump's tariffs: India-US seek breakthrough in day-long trade talks
text_src: India and US seek breakthrough in day-long trade talks 6 hours ago Share Save Anahita Sachdev BBC News, Delhi Share Save AFP via Getty Images Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi (left) and US President Donald Trump have long shared a warm relationship but ties between the countries have taken a hit India and the US are holding a day of trade talks, sparking hope that stalled negotiations on a bilateral agreement will soon resume. A team led by US trade negotiator Brendan Lynch is in Delhi to meet officials from India's commerce ministry. India said the meeting doesn't mark the start of the next round of negotiations, describing it as a "discussion" about "trying to see" how an agreement can be reached. Negotiations on a trade deal had stalled after US President Donald Trump imposed a hefty 50% tariff on Indian goods, partly as a penalty for Delhi's purchase of Russian oil and weapons. India has defended its decision, citing domestic energy needs, and called the tariffs "unfair".
summary_src: U.S. and Indian trade officials held a day of talks in Delhi, aiming to restart negotiations stalled since the Trump administration imposed tariffs on Indian goods.  While India clarified the meeting was not the launch of a new negotiation round, but rather a discussion on potential pathways to a bilateral agreement,  it represents a significant step towards resolving trade tensions.  The talks, led by U.S. Trade Representative Brendan Lynch, follow previous disagreements stemming from India's purchase of Russian oil and weapons, which prompted the tariffs.  India maintains its actions were justified by domestic needs and the tariffs were unfair and unreasonable.
summary_tgt: दिल्ली में अमेरिका और भारत के व्यापार अधिकारियों के बीच एक दिन की वार्ता हुई, जिसका उद्देश्य ट्रम्प प्रशासन द्वारा भारतीय वस्तुओं पर लगाए गए टैरिफ़ के बाद से रुकी हुई बातचीत को फिर से शुरू करना था।  हालांकि भारत ने स्पष्ट किया कि यह बैठक एक नए दौर की बातचीत की शुरुआत नहीं थी, बल्कि एक द्विपक्षीय समझौते के संभावित रास्तों पर चर्चा थी, लेकिन यह व्यापार तनाव को सुलझाने की दिशा में एक महत्वपूर्ण कदम है।  अमेरिकी व्यापार प्रतिनिधि ब्रेंडन लिंच के नेतृत्व में यह वार्ता, भारत द्वारा रूसी तेल और हथियारों की खरीद से उत्पन्न पिछले मतभेदों के बाद हुई है, जिसके कारण टैरिफ़ लगाए गए थे। भारत का कहना है कि उसके कदम घरेलू जरूरतों से उचित थे और टैरिफ़ अनुचित और असंगत थे।
meta_description: The meeting comes after weeks of tension between the allies with Trump imposing high tariffs on Indian goods.

title_src: Fallen trees disrupt travel amid weather warning
text_src: Travel has been disrupted across the South East of England after high winds caused several trees to fall. Fallen trees blocked roads in Surrey on Monday morning, while some ferry services from the Port of Dover were delayed. A yellow Met Office warning for wind is in place for most of England and Wales until 18:00 BST.
summary_src: High winds across South East England caused widespread travel disruption on Monday.  Several trees fell, blocking roads in Surrey and delaying some ferry services from Dover.  The Met Office has issued a yellow wind warning for much of England and Wales, with gusts up to 50mph expected until 6pm BST.  The cause of the fallen trees is still under investigation.
summary_tgt: दक्षिण पूर्व इंग्लैंड में तेज हवाओं के कारण सोमवार को व्यापक यातायात व्यवधान हुआ। कई पेड़ गिर गए, जिससे सरे में सड़कें अवरुद्ध हो गईं और डोवर से कुछ फ़ेरी सेवाओं में देरी हुई।  मेट ऑफिस ने इंग्लैंड और वेल्स के अधिकांश हिस्सों के लिए पीली हवा की चेतावनी जारी की है, जिसमें शाम 6 बजे BST तक 50 मील प्रति घंटे तक की गति से हवा चलने की उम्मीद है।  गिरे हुए पेड़ों के कारणों की अभी भी जाँच की जा रही है।
