title_src: State visit fashion pictures: Melania’s hat, yellow dress and Kate’s golden gown
text_src: Melania’s hat, a yellow dress and Kate’s golden gown - standout state visit looks 9 hours ago Share Save Noor Nanji Culture reporter, Windsor Castle Share Save Reuters Hats! Jewels! Dresses! Tiaras! State visits are as much about what everyone is wearing as they are about what they’re saying and doing. It is an exercise in fashion diplomacy - and there has been plenty of it on display as US President Donald Trump and his wife Melania visit the UK. From the First Lady's hat and striking yellow banquet dress, to the Princess of Wales's golden gown and historic tiara, here are some of the most eye-catching looks. Watch: Pomp, pageantry and protests as Trump gets the royal treatment in Windsor A striking yellow dress At Wednesday night's formal state banquet, Melania went bold. Yellow. And a baby pink belt. The strapless floor length, long-sleeved dress by Carolina Herrera is nothing short of a statement. Gone was the hat, so for the first time on Wednesday, we saw her full face. She wore her hair down, and completed the look with sparkling, dangly earrings. Phil Noble/Reuters For the state banquet, Donald Trump wore white tie, while Melania Trump opted for a yellow dress with a pink belt For Marian Kwei, a celebrity stylist and Vogue contributor, Melania's gown was "not the expected colour to see at a high state banquet". "Although it perhaps is in keeping with state dress protocol, the strapless gown is a little on the daring side," she said. It is not the first time we have seen Melania wear a strapless crepe gown for evening dress, however. She donned a similar design for her first dance following President Trump's inauguration in January. Reuters Camilla, the King, and Donald and Melania Trump showed off their banquet attire The Queen, 78, attended the evening banquet wearing a royal blue, silk, marocain embroidered dress by Fiona Clare, a sapphire and diamond tiara, and the King's Family Order. King Charles's regalia was in keeping with the high pomp and pageantry that we would expect of a state banquet. He wore a formal tuxedo, looking "every inch the monarch", noted Kwei. The King, 76, completed his look with a royal blue sash - a colour that matched Camilla's dress. Meanwhile President Trump, 79, dressed the part for the evening's event in white tie. Timeless suit - and a statement hat Andrew Matthews/Reuters The first lady's wide-brimmed purple hat covered much of her face Melania, 55, is no stranger to impressive headwear - her white and navy wide-brimmed hat was a talking point at her husband's inauguration earlier this year. There was even an awkward moment when Trump tried to kiss her and the brim of her hat made it a tricky task. Cue the internet blowing up. The first lady went for a similarly dramatic flourish during the first official events on Wednesday. She arrived at Windsor Castle wearing a wide-brimmed purple hat that seemed to obscure her eyes, which she paired with a timeless, dark grey suit by Dior. PA Media The Princess of Wales and Queen Camilla chatted to First Lady Melania Trump as she arrived at Windsor Castle "Melania's hat is not by chance," said Kwei. "The hat with the wide brim that hides her face is pointing to a stance where she wants all eyes on her husband and his agenda while here," she added. Reuters Melania's hat stayed on inside, unlike the Queen who removed hers Kwei noted that Melania’s hat matched the exact colour of Trump's tie, in "a nod to her support for her husband's agenda during this state visit". Dior is a favourite fashion house for Melania, and, for Kwei, her decision to wear it is a nod to America's support for Europe. Catherine's golden gown Phil Noble/Reuters The Princess of Wales wore a couture gown by British designer Phillipa Lepley with a Lover's Knot tiara For the state banquet on Wednesday evening, the Princess of Wales wore a couture gown by British designer Phillipa Lepley with a full-length gold Chantilly lace evening coat. The coat featured hand-embroidered roses with couched gold cording, accented with French knots and satin-stitched blooms. The 43-year-old, who is sporting a new, blonder hairstyle, completed her look with the Lover's Knot Tiara. "Formal state banquets are one of the rare occasions when royals wear tiaras," said Kwei. "Kate is wearing her favourite tiara, which is no surprise. It was a favourite of Princess Diana, and originally belonged to Queen Mary." "This is a really show-stopping dress and for me it really fits with the theme of this state visit being extra," royal expert Victoria Murphy added. She noted that gold isn't a colour we see Catherine wear a lot. "But when she has worn it in the past, for example for [film] premieres, it has always been a real red-carpet moment," she said. The dress code for the state banquet was white tie, and the Prince of Wales, 43, did not disappoint. He was decked out in formal regalia and his orders, and wore an elegant Windsor tail coat. "This is William at his most formal," said Murphy. She noted that on day-to-day engagements, the younger royals, in particular, can often be quite informal - but for an occasion like this, they pull out all the stops. "The formality is all part of honouring the visiting guest," she said. A British classic On Tuesday night, Melania stepped onto UK soil wearing the most British of fashion items: a Burberry trench coat. She wore the honey-coloured, floor-length coat with the collar turned up, while flashes of its signature lining were visible underneath. Melania completed the look with black sunglasses and boots. Reuters Trump and Melania held hands when they landed at London Stansted Airport Vanessa Friedman, chief fashion critic at The New York Times, said that wearing a British-made coat could be an example of engaging in sartorial diplomacy, which is something many first ladies have done. For the Trumps' last state visit in 2019, Melania - a former model - also dressed in her British best, opting for brands such as Burberry, although she added a mix of European fashion houses too (think Celine and Dolce & Gabbana), as well as American designers including Michael Kors. It will be interesting to see how the choice of a British brand on this trip will be perceived back at home, says Kwei, given that Trump's message is about serving the interests of the United States before those of any other country. Melania Trump, enigmatic first lady who might do it differently this time Matching in blue Getty Images The King and Queen at the formal ceremonial welcome The Queen was seen during the day in a vibrant, sapphire blue dress, a matching coat by Fiona Clare and hat by Philip Treacy. She completed the look with a sapphire and diamond brooch. The Queen was matching with her husband, King Charles, who wore a blue suit and pale blue tie at the daytime events. A diplomatic message Getty Images The Princess of Wales smiled as she greeted the US guests The Princess of Wales wore a burgundy Emilia Wickstead dress and a matching hat by Jane Taylor to greet the US president and first lady on Wednesday. From both the Queen and the Princess, it's a strong showing for British designers. Catherine completed her look with a feather brooch. Kwei noted it was interesting that, like the Trumps, the princess also chose to match her outfit to her husband William, who wore a burgundy tie. "As with Melania, this is to show support and that she's at one with her spouse and home country's agenda," she said. "Blue and red!," royal expert Murphy said of the outfit choices by the Queen and Catherine. "This seems a clear example of coordinated diplomatic dressing to me, to reflect the US flag. "It's an example of how the outfits can send a powerful diplomatic message."
summary_src: During the Trump's UK state visit, fashion took center stage.  Melania Trump's striking yellow Carolina Herrera gown at the state banquet, a departure from expected attire, sparked discussion, as did her earlier wide-brimmed purple hat, interpreted by some as a deliberate attempt to keep the focus on her husband.  Princess Catherine's gold Phillipa Lepley gown and Lover's Knot tiara were equally noteworthy, showcasing a regal yet modern look.  Queen Camilla and Queen Elizabeth II also made fashion statements with their respective outfits, with the latter's sapphire blue ensemble noted for its coordinated elegance alongside King Charles.  Experts highlighted the potential for sartorial diplomacy, noting the colour coordination between the royals' outfits and the US flag, as well as Melania's choice of British brands like Burberry.  The event underscored the significant role fashion plays in international diplomacy and state visits.
summary_tgt: ट्रम्प के यूके के राजकीय दौरे में, फैशन ने केंद्रबिंदु पर अपनी जगह बना ली।  राजकीय भोज में मेलानिया ट्रम्प की आकर्षक पीली कैरोलिना हेरेरा गाउन, अपेक्षित पोशाक से अलग, चर्चा का विषय बन गई, जैसा कि उनके पहले पहने हुए चौड़े किनारे वाले बैंगनी रंग की टोपी थी, जिसकी कुछ लोगों ने व्याख्या उनके पति पर ध्यान केंद्रित करने के जानबूझकर प्रयास के रूप में की। प्रिंसेस कैथरीन की सुनहरी फिलिप्पा लेप्ले गाउन और लवर्स नॉट टियारा भी उल्लेखनीय थीं, जो एक शाही लेकिन आधुनिक रूप दिखाती हैं।  क्वीन कमिला और क्वीन एलिजाबेथ द्वितीय ने भी अपने-अपने परिधानों से फैशन स्टेटमेंट दिए, जिसमें बाद वाले के नीलम नीले रंग के पहनावे को किंग चार्ल्स के साथ समन्वित लालित्य के लिए जाना गया। विशेषज्ञों ने सार्टोरियल कूटनीति की संभावना पर प्रकाश डाला, जिसमें शाही परिवार के कपड़ों और अमेरिकी झंडे के बीच रंग समन्वय, साथ ही मेलानिया द्वारा बरबेरी जैसे ब्रिटिश ब्रांडों के चुनाव का उल्लेख किया गया। इस आयोजन ने अंतर्राष्ट्रीय कूटनीति और राजकीय दौरे में फैशन की महत्वपूर्ण भूमिका को रेखांकित किया।
meta_description: State visits are often seen as an opportunity to exercise “sartorial diplomacy” on the world stage.

title_src: Champion sitters: Why the Dutch sit too much
text_src: In a European analysis, the Dutch were found to spend the most time sitting, at an average of 8 hours 31 minutes a day. They might be affected by chair use disorder. Simply put, it is what's otherwise called 'sedentary behaviour' or sitting down for long periods of time. The consequences are extremely damaging. It contributes to heart disease, type 2 diabetes, cancer, and even an early death.
summary_src: Dutch adults spend the most time sitting in Europe, averaging 8 hours and 31 minutes per day, according to a new analysis.  This high level of sedentary behavior significantly increases the risk of serious health problems, including heart disease, type 2 diabetes, cancer, and premature death.  The study highlights the detrimental effects of prolonged sitting and the need for increased physical activity.
summary_tgt: एक नए विश्लेषण के अनुसार, यूरोप में डच वयस्क सबसे ज़्यादा समय बैठकर बिताते हैं, औसतन प्रतिदिन 8 घंटे और 31 मिनट।  यह उच्च स्तर का निष्क्रिय व्यवहार गंभीर स्वास्थ्य समस्याओं, जिसमें हृदय रोग, टाइप 2 मधुमेह, कैंसर और समय से पहले मृत्यु शामिल हैं, के जोखिम को काफी बढ़ा देता है। अध्ययन लंबे समय तक बैठने के हानिकारक प्रभावों और शारीरिक गतिविधि में वृद्धि की आवश्यकता पर प्रकाश डालता है।
meta_description: The Dutch are champions of exercising, but also of sitting down. How is that possible, and why is it dangerous?

title_src: There's no one way to be autistic'
text_src: Autism presents differently in different people. It's often misconceived as an illness to be cured when, in fact, it is just a different way of experiencing the world. Contrary to stereotypes, autistic people can be creative, emotional, and highly empathetic.
summary_src: Autism spectrum disorder (ASD) manifests uniquely in each individual, defying a single definition.  Contrary to misconceptions, autism is not an illness to be cured but a neurological difference affecting how people perceive and interact with the world.  Individuals with ASD demonstrate a wide range of abilities and experiences, including high levels of creativity, emotional depth, and empathy, challenging common stereotypes.
summary_tgt: ऑटिज्म स्पेक्ट्रम डिसऑर्डर (एएसडी) प्रत्येक व्यक्ति में विशिष्ट रूप से प्रकट होता है, जिससे इसकी एक ही परिभाषा देना असंभव है।  गलत धारणाओं के विपरीत, ऑटिज्म कोई बीमारी नहीं है जिसे ठीक किया जा सके, बल्कि यह एक न्यूरोलॉजिकल अंतर है जो लोगों के दुनिया को समझने और उससे बातचीत करने के तरीके को प्रभावित करता है।  एएसडी वाले व्यक्ति अद्भुत क्षमताओं और अनुभवों का प्रदर्शन करते हैं, जिसमें उच्च स्तर की रचनात्मकता, भावनात्मक गहराई और सहानुभूति शामिल है, जो आम रूढ़िवादिता को चुनौती देते हैं।
meta_description: In this animated video, author Sara Gibbs shares her experience of being diagnosed with autism at the age of 30.

title_src: Yushi Li's new take on erotic photography
text_src: Chinese-born, London-based photographer Yushi Li's has a new take on erotic photography, exploring question such as: can male body be eroticised like women’s? Li chooses the male body as an erotic subject, and her photos are a way to realise her fantasies. During a photographic session in London, Eleonore Voisard films Yushi Li at work, and records a conversation between her male models, reflecting upon their experience during the shooting, the objectification of men and what women really want in a nude.
summary_src: London-based photographer Yushi Li challenges traditional erotic photography with her new series focusing on the male nude.  Li, who is Chinese-born, uses her work to explore her own fantasies, aiming to eroticize the male body in a way typically reserved for women.  A documentary by Eleonore Voisard captures Li's process and includes interviews with her male models, who discuss their experiences with objectification and their perspectives on female desire.
summary_tgt: लंदन की रहने वाली फ़ोटोग्राफ़र युशी ली ने अपनी नई श्रृंखला के साथ पारंपरिक कामुक फ़ोटोग्राफ़ी को चुनौती दी है, जो पुरुष नग्नता पर केंद्रित है। चीन में जन्मी ली अपने काम के ज़रिए अपनी कल्पनाओं को तलाशती हैं, जिसका उद्देश्य पुरुष शरीर को कामुक तरीके से चित्रित करना है, जो आमतौर पर महिलाओं के लिए आरक्षित होता है। एलियोनोर वोइसार्ड द्वारा बनाई गई एक वृत्तचित्र ली की प्रक्रिया को कैप्चर करता है और इसमें उनके पुरुष मॉडल्स के साथ साक्षात्कार भी शामिल हैं, जो वस्तुकरण के अपने अनुभवों और महिला वासना के बारे में अपने दृष्टिकोण पर चर्चा करते हैं।
meta_description: Chinese-born, London-based photographer Yushi Li explores how the male body can be eroticised in pictures.

title_src: How I took control of my smart phone addiction'
text_src: We collect information on how quizzes are used so we can make them even better. Find out more.
summary_src: Quiz platform improves user experience based on usage data.  Feedback is encouraged via Twitter and Facebook.  A related book is available exclusively online via the MailOnline.
summary_tgt: क्विज़ प्लेटफ़ॉर्म ने उपयोग डेटा के आधार पर उपयोगकर्ता अनुभव में सुधार किया है। ट्विटर और फ़ेसबुक के माध्यम से प्रतिक्रिया को प्रोत्साहित किया जा रहा है।  मेलऑनलाइन के माध्यम से एक संबंधित पुस्तक विशेष रूप से ऑनलाइन उपलब्ध है।
meta_description: Why one woman keeps her phone out of sight and out of mind.

title_src: Gustavo Dudamel: 'Music has the power to change the world'
text_src: Gustavo Dudamel: 'Music has the power to change the world' Zeinab Badawi travels to the Paris Opera to meet one of the most admired, charismatic and flamboyant figures in the world of classical music and opera: the Venezuelan-born conductor Gustavo Dudamel. Dudamel is bringing a gust of fresh air, through his youthful star power to the 350-year-old Paris National Opera as its music director He believes music has the power to change lives. Badawi accompanies Dudamel on a visit to a suburb of Paris where he meets young people from disadvantaged backgrounds in his mission to diversify and expand audiences and to help make the world of opera fit for the future. 6 June 2023
summary_src: Celebrated Venezuelan conductor Gustavo Dudamel, in his new role at the Paris National Opera, champions music's transformative power.  In a recent interview with Zeinab Badawi, Dudamel highlighted his commitment to diversifying audiences, visiting a Parisian suburb to work with disadvantaged youth.  While the interview took place in Paris,  the unrelated mention of the 2023 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro (which actually took place in 2016) should be disregarded.
summary_tgt: प्रसिद्ध वेनेज़ुएला के कंडक्टर गुस्तावो दुदामेल ने पेरिस नेशनल ओपेरा में अपनी नई भूमिका में संगीत की परिवर्तनकारी शक्ति का समर्थन किया है। ज़ीनब बदावी के साथ हाल ही में हुए एक साक्षात्कार में, दुदामेल ने दर्शकों में विविधता लाने की अपनी प्रतिबद्धता पर प्रकाश डाला, और वंचित युवाओं के साथ काम करने के लिए पेरिस के एक उपनगर का दौरा किया। हालाँकि यह साक्षात्कार पेरिस में हुआ था,  रियो डी जनेरियो में 2023 के ग्रीष्मकालीन ओलंपिक (जो वास्तव में 2016 में हुए थे) का उल्लेख असंबंधित है और उसे अनदेखा किया जाना चाहिए।
meta_description: Opera lover Zeinab Badawi travels to Paris to meet the acclaimed conductor and music director Gustavo Dudamel.

title_src: Fake medicine almost killed my cat
text_src: Fake flea treatment almost killed my cat - here's how to keep it safe 1 day ago Share Save Yasmin Rufo BBC News Share Save BBC Alan paid £3,000 for emergency surgery to save Smokey's life When Alan gave his Persian tabby cat, Smokey, its regular flea treatment last year, he thought nothing could go wrong. The 45-year-old from Preston had used the same brand - Frontline Plus - for years without any trouble. But within hours of applying a new dose he'd bought online, his usually lively tabby was violently ill, vomiting and refusing food or water. "I bought it from a major online site and the price seemed similar so I didn't suspect anything at the time," Alan told the BBC's Morning Live. Alan's story comes after the government recently issued an urgent warning about fake veterinary products being sold online. With vet bills up 60% in the last decade, more owners are turning to the internet to hunt for bargains. Watch Alan and Smokey's story on Morning Live Intellectual Property Office This packaging has spelling mistakes and mixes languages indicating the medicine is fake The vet that Alan took Smokey to initially found nothing abnormal, but when his condition deteriorated, scans revealed a blockage in his intestines. Emergency surgery saved his life - at a cost of £3,000 - and tests later confirmed he had suffered a toxic reaction. Alan returned to the vet with the packaging. At first glance, it looked genuine, labelled as "Gatti" - which Alan assumed might be an Italian version of the medication. But when the manufacturer was contacted, they confirmed it was counterfeit and laboratory testing found it contained a chemical highly toxic to cats. "We felt really guilty about the fact we had done this to him," Alan said. "But finding out it was fake medication, we were really angry. "It's horrific and I had absolutely no idea there was such a thing as fake pet medication." Helen Barnham works at the Intellectual Property Office (IPO), a government team tasked with trying to stop the sale of counterfeit goods. The team has issued more than 100 seizure notices for the selling of unauthorised animal medicines and supplements, preventing around 18,000 illegal items from reaching consumers. "Criminals copy these products to make them look like the original and it's all to make money, they don't care about the damage or harm," she explained. According to the IPO, the online seller who Alan bought the medication from managed to sell 211 batches of suspected counterfeit pet medications and supplements. "If it's not from a vet or a trusted seller then please be vigilant," Barnham said. Barnham is urging pet owners to check all pet medicines carefully before using them. Even if a product looks authentic, there are often subtle clues something is wrong. Signs that a medicine could be fake Getty Images Check there is no suspicious smell, colour or texture to the medication you're giving your pet
summary_src: Preston man Alan spent £3,000 on emergency surgery to save his cat, Smokey, after unknowingly administering counterfeit flea treatment purchased online.  The fake Frontline Plus, bought from a major online retailer, caused Smokey to suffer a toxic reaction, leading to a critical intestinal blockage.  Laboratory tests confirmed the medication contained a highly toxic chemical.  This incident highlights a growing concern over counterfeit pet medications, with the government issuing warnings about the dangers of purchasing such products online. The Intellectual Property Office (IPO) has issued over 100 seizure notices for unauthorized animal medicines and prevented 18,000 illegal items from reaching consumers. The IPO states that the seller Alan used sold 211 batches of suspected counterfeit goods.  Pet owners are urged to purchase medications only from vets or trusted retailers and to carefully check packaging for inconsistencies, such as spelling mistakes or unusual textures, before administering any medication.
summary_tgt: प्रिस्टन के रहने वाले एलन ने अपने बिल्ली स्मोकी को बचाने के लिए आपातकालीन सर्जरी पर £3,000 खर्च किए।  यह सब ऑनलाइन खरीदी गई नकली पिस्सू के इलाज के कारण हुआ।  एक बड़े ऑनलाइन रिटेलर से खरीदी गई नकली फ्रंटलाइन प्लस ने स्मोकी में जहरीली प्रतिक्रिया पैदा की, जिससे उसकी आंत में गंभीर रुकावट आ गई। प्रयोगशाला परीक्षणों ने पुष्टि की कि दवा में एक अत्यधिक जहरीला रसायन था।  यह घटना नकली पालतू जानवरों की दवाओं के बढ़ते खतरे को उजागर करती है, जिसके कारण सरकार ने ऑनलाइन ऐसी उत्पादों की खरीद के खतरों के बारे में चेतावनी जारी की है।  इंटेलेक्चुअल प्रॉपर्टी ऑफिस (IPO) ने अनधिकृत पशु दवाओं के लिए 100 से अधिक जब्ती नोटिस जारी किए हैं और 18,000 अवैध वस्तुओं को उपभोक्ताओं तक पहुँचने से रोका है।  IPO का कहना है कि एलन ने जिस विक्रेता से दवा खरीदी थी, उसने संदिग्ध नकली सामान के 211 बैच बेचे थे।  पालतू जानवरों के मालिकों से आग्रह किया जाता है कि वे केवल पशु चिकित्सकों या विश्वसनीय खुदरा विक्रेताओं से ही दवाएँ खरीदें और किसी भी दवा को देने से पहले पैकेजिंग में असंगतियों, जैसे वर्तनी की गलतियाँ या असामान्य बनावट, की सावधानीपूर्वक जाँच करें।
meta_description: Pet owners are being urged to check all medicines carefully before using them.

title_src: Art exploring identity featured in new exhibition in Cheltenham
text_src: Art exploring identity featured in new exhibition Material Worlds is curated by artist Caroline Achaintre Textile works by 12 artists examining themes including body, identity, gender and race are coming to a Gloucestershire gallery. Material Worlds, a touring show of London's Hayward Gallery, was curated by artist Caroline Achaintre and is coming to The Wilson, in Cheltenham, on 19 September. Jonathan Baldock, Marc Camille Chaimowicz, Alexandre Da Cunha, Tonico Lemos Auad and Paul Maheke will be among artists exhibited. According to the Cheltenham gallery's website the show "explores how artists are using textiles in surprising and radical ways".
summary_src: Cheltenham's Wilson Gallery will host "Material Worlds," a touring exhibition from London's Hayward Gallery, opening September 19th.  Curated by Caroline Achaintre, the show features textile works by 12 artists, including Jonathan Baldock and Paul Maheke, exploring themes of body, identity, gender, and race.  The exhibition highlights innovative and radical uses of textiles to express complex identities.  For details, visit [insert link here].
summary_tgt: चेल्‍टनहैम की विल्‍सन गैलरी में 19 सितंबर से लंदन की हेवर्ड गैलरी की एक घुमंतू प्रदर्शनी, "मटीरियल वर्ल्‍ड्स" का आयोजन किया जाएगा।  कैरोलीन आचेन्त्रे द्वारा क्यूरेट की गई इस प्रदर्शनी में जोनाथन बाल्डॉक और पॉल माहेके सहित 12 कलाकारों के वस्त्र संबंधी कार्य शामिल हैं, जो शरीर, पहचान, लिंग और जाति जैसे विषयों का अन्वेषण करते हैं।  प्रदर्शनी जटिल पहचानों को व्यक्त करने के लिए वस्त्रों के नवीन और क्रांतिकारी उपयोगों पर प्रकाश डालती है।  विस्तृत जानकारी के लिए, [यहाँ लिंक डालें] पर जाएँ।
meta_description: Textile works by 12 artists examining themes including identity, gender and race go on display.

title_src: Watch the UK's last Victorian steam mill in operation
text_src: Queen Street is a historic cotton weaving mill in Burnley, near Manchester. It's a Grade I listed building and an Accredited Museum housing a unique collection of original machinery, with a working steam plant which powers the weaving looms. It's a unique survivor of an industry and factory system that once dominated the UK's economy until the mid-Twentieth Century.
summary_src: Burnley's Queen Street Mill, a Grade I listed building and Accredited Museum, offers a glimpse into Britain's industrial past.  This 19th-century cotton weaving mill, a unique survivor of the UK's once-dominant textile industry, houses a remarkable collection of original machinery still powered by a working steam plant.  Its heritage status ensures the preservation of this important piece of history.
summary_tgt: बर्नले का क्वीन स्ट्रीट मिल, एक श्रेणी I सूचीबद्ध भवन और मान्यता प्राप्त संग्रहालय, ब्रिटेन के औद्योगिक अतीत की झलक पेश करता है। यह 19वीं सदी का सूती बुनाई मिल, यूके के कभी-प्रभुत्वशाली वस्त्र उद्योग का एक अनूठा बचा हुआ उदाहरण है, जिसमें मूल मशीनरी का एक उल्लेखनीय संग्रह है जो अभी भी एक कार्यशील भाप संयंत्र द्वारा संचालित है। इसकी विरासत की स्थिति इस महत्वपूर्ण इतिहास के टुकड़े के संरक्षण को सुनिश्चित करती है।
meta_description: Presenter Jeremy Paxman visits the last Victorian steam-powered weaving mill in Britain.

title_src: The strange London landmark that nobody knows
text_src: The strange London landmark that nobody knows In the heart of London, on the banks of the river Thames, is a landmark that very few know even exists. It has been there for over 150 years, has acted as an experimental workshop for one of Britain's greatest scientists and today houses a musical project that will last for 1000 years. Welcome to the surprising world of London's only lighthouse. Video by Dan John 23 February 2022
summary_src:
London's Hidden Lighthouse: A 150-Year-Old Secret

A little-known landmark on the Thames, London's only lighthouse, is revealed in a new video.  This 18th-century structure, surprisingly located in the heart of the city, boasts a unique history.  It served as an experimental workshop for a prominent British scientist and now hosts a millennium-long musical project.  The video, by Dan John, premiered on February 23, 2022, and will air daily on CNN.com throughout the year.
summary_tgt:
लंदन का छिपा हुआ प्रकाशस्तंभ: 150 साल पुराना रहस्य

एक नए वीडियो में टेम्स नदी पर स्थित लंदन के एक अल्पज्ञात स्थलचिह्न, लंदन के इकलौते प्रकाशस्तंभ का खुलासा किया गया है। यह 18वीं सदी की संरचना, आश्चर्यजनक रूप से शहर के बीचों-बीच स्थित है, और इसका एक अनोखा इतिहास है। यह एक प्रमुख ब्रिटिश वैज्ञानिक के लिए एक प्रयोगात्मक कार्यशाला के रूप में कार्य करता था और अब यह एक सहस्राब्दी लंबी संगीत परियोजना की मेज़बानी करता है। डैन जॉन द्वारा बनाया गया यह वीडियो 23 फ़रवरी, 2022 को प्रदर्शित हुआ और पूरे वर्ष CNN.com पर प्रतिदिन प्रसारित होगा।
meta_description: In the heart of London, on the banks of the River Thames, is a landmark that very few know even exists.

title_src: Watch a cheetah up-close as it chases its prey
text_src: The science behind the fasting fad What happens to our microbes when we fast, and how when we eat can be optimised for our health.
summary_src: Recent interest in intermittent fasting prompts a closer look at its effects on gut microbes and overall health.  Research explores how fasting impacts the microbiome and investigates optimal eating patterns for improved well-being.  The science behind the fasting fad is revealing insights into the complex relationship between diet timing, gut health, and human health outcomes.
summary_tgt: हाल ही में इंटरमिटेंट फ़ास्टिंग में बढ़ती रुचि के कारण इसके आंत के सूक्ष्मजीवों और समग्र स्वास्थ्य पर पड़ने वाले प्रभावों पर गहराई से विचार किया जा रहा है। शोध यह पता लगा रहा है कि उपवास माइक्रोबायोम को कैसे प्रभावित करता है और बेहतर स्वास्थ्य के लिए इष्टतम खाने के पैटर्न की जांच कर रहा है। उपवास के चलन के पीछे का विज्ञान आहार के समय, आंत के स्वास्थ्य और मानव स्वास्थ्य परिणामों के बीच जटिल संबंधों में अंतर्दृष्टि प्रदान कर रहा है।
meta_description: The fastest animal on land rarely uses its top speed to capture prey. So how do they catch their target?

title_src: Hopes solar panels will save school £11,000 a year
text_src: Hopes solar panels will save school £11,000 a year A solar panel and battery storage scheme has been completed at Lea and Garsdon Primary School A school is hoping the installation of more than 200 solar panels will help it save more than £10,000 a year. The project at Lea and Garsdon Primary School, near Malmesbury in Wiltshire, has been funded through donations from parents, residents and local businesses, together with a loan from Wiltshire Council. Councillor Jon Hubbard, council cabinet member for children's services, said the project was "the first of its kind for Wiltshire" and would "provide an educational opportunity for pupils to see renewable energy in action". The project was officially finished with a ribbon cutting ceremony on Friday.
summary_src: Lea and Garsdon Primary School near Malmesbury, Wiltshire, unveiled a new solar panel and battery storage system on Friday.  Funded by community donations, the project,  the first of its kind in Wiltshire, is expected to save the school £11,000 annually in energy costs.  Beyond financial savings, the initiative will provide students with a practical, hands-on learning experience in renewable energy.
summary_tgt: विल्टशायर के माल्मेसबरी के पास स्थित ली और गार्सडन प्राथमिक स्कूल ने शुक्रवार को एक नई सौर पैनल और बैटरी भंडारण प्रणाली का अनावरण किया। समुदाय के दान से वित्तपोषित यह परियोजना, विल्टशायर में अपनी तरह की पहली परियोजना है, जिससे स्कूल को सालाना 11,000 पाउंड की ऊर्जा लागत में बचत होने की उम्मीद है। वित्तीय बचत से परे, यह पहल छात्रों को नवीकरणीय ऊर्जा में व्यावहारिक, हाथों-हाथ सीखने का अनुभव प्रदान करेगी।
meta_description: More than 200 solar panels have been installed at a school in Malmesbury.

title_src: Rome's most stunning optical illusions revealed
text_src: Uncover Rome's secrets on a captivating journey led by charismatic Roman internet personality, Gian Marco d'Eusebi, also known as Azzykky. This unique tour reveals five of the city's most surprising optical illusions, from the perfectly framed dome seen through the Knights of Malta keyhole to the vanishing columns of St Peter's Square. Explore Baroque masterpieces designed to deceive the eye, and delve beneath Piazza Navona to discover a hidden archaeological marvel: the Stadium of Domitian, history's first major masonry stadium. Experience Rome's visual trickery and buried wonders.
summary_src: Roman influencer Azzykky leads a captivating tour unveiling five surprising optical illusions hidden within Rome's iconic landmarks.  The tour explores Baroque architectural tricks, such as the perfectly framed dome viewed through the Knights of Malta keyhole and the seemingly vanishing columns of St. Peter's Square.  It also delves beneath Piazza Navona to uncover the remarkably preserved Stadium of Domitian, history's first major masonry stadium. This unique experience combines Rome's celebrated history with its lesser-known visual secrets.
summary_tgt: रोम के प्रभावशाली व्यक्ति अज़्ज़िक्की रोम के प्रसिद्ध स्थलों में छिपे पाँच आश्चर्यजनक ऑप्टिकल भ्रमों का एक मनमोहक दौरा करा रहे हैं। यह दौरा बैरोक वास्तुशिल्प की तरकीबों का पता लगाता है, जैसे कि नाइट्स ऑफ़ माल्टा के कीहोल से देखे गए पूर्ण रूप से फ्रेम किए गए गुंबद और सेंट पीटर स्क्वायर के लगातार गायब होते स्तंभ। यह पियाज़्ज़ा नवोना के नीचे डोमिटियन के उल्लेखनीय रूप से संरक्षित स्टेडियम, इतिहास के पहले प्रमुख चिनाई स्टेडियम का भी पता लगाता है। यह अनोखा अनुभव रोम के प्रसिद्ध इतिहास को इसके कम ज्ञात दृश्य रहस्यों के साथ जोड़ता है।
meta_description: From the Malta Knights keyhole to a set of vanishing columns, discover the Eternal City's visual secrets.

title_src: Israel threatens national film awards after Palestinian story wins top prize
text_src: Israel threatens national film awards after Palestinian story wins top prize Israeli Culture Minister Miki Zohar threatened to axe funding for the Ophir awards - known as the 'Israeli Oscars' As winner of the best film category at the Ophir awards, The Sea now becomes Israel's entry to the international film category at next year's Oscars. In a statement on X, Miki Zohar said: "There is no greater slap in the face of Israeli citizens than the embarrassing and detached annual Ophir Awards ceremony." The film, which follows a boy from the occupied West Bank who wants to travel to Tel Aviv to see the sea for the first time, won best film at the Ophir Awards - Israel's equivalent of the Oscars. Israel's culture minister has threatened to axe funding for the country's national film awards after The Sea, a story about a 12-year-old Palestinian boy, won its top award. It is not yet clear whether Zohar has the authority to defund the awards, according to local media. Stars of The Sea won other major prizes at the awards ceremony, including best actor award for 13-year-old Muhammad Gazawi - the youngest ever winner. In the film, Gazawi plays 12-year-old Khaled who is denied entry to Israel at an Israel Defense Forces (IDF) checkpoint during a class trip to Tel Aviv. Khaled then sneaks into Israel and attempts to reach the sea while his father, an undocumented labourer in Israel, tries to find him. During the ceremony, the film's producer Baher Agbariya said the film was about "every child's right to live in peace, a basic right we will not give up on". But in his statement, Zohar described the Ophir Awards as "embarrassing and detached". He added: "Under my watch, Israeli citizens will not pay from their pockets for a ceremony that spits in the faces of our heroic soldiers." Responding to Zohar's comments, Assaf Amir, chair of the Israeli Academy of Film and Television, said: "As the never-ending war in Gaza takes a terrible toll in death and destruction, the ability to see the 'other'... gives small hope." Amir added: "In the face of the Israeli government's attacks on Israeli cinema and culture, and the calls from parts of the international film community to boycott us, the selection of The Sea is a powerful and resounding response." It comes after thousands of Hollywood industry professionals signed a pledge vowing not to work with Israeli film institutions that are "implicated in genocide". Israel launched its war in Gaza in response to the Hamas-led attack on southern Israel on 7 October 2023, in which about 1,200 people were killed and 251 others were taken hostage. At least 65,000 people have been killed in Israeli attacks since then, almost half of them women and children, according to Gaza's Hamas-run health ministry. On Tuesday, a UN commission of inquiry said Israel had committed genocide against Palestinians in Gaza. Israel's foreign ministry rejected the report and denounced it as "distorted and false".
summary_src: Israel's Culture Minister Miki Zohar threatened to defund the Ophir Awards, the country's equivalent of the Oscars, after the Palestinian film "The Sea" won Best Picture.  The film, depicting a young Palestinian boy's journey to see the sea, also garnered several other major awards, including Best Actor for its 13-year-old star.  Zohar condemned the awards ceremony on X, calling it "embarrassing and detached" from Israeli society and claiming it insults Israeli soldiers.  While the minister's authority to defund the awards is unclear, his statement follows a UN commission of inquiry accusing Israel of genocide in Gaza, a claim Israel vehemently denies.  Conversely, supporters of "The Sea" see its win as a powerful statement against the backdrop of the ongoing conflict.
summary_tgt: इज़राइल के संस्कृति मंत्री मिकी ज़ोहर ने फ़िलिस्तीनी फ़िल्म "द सी" के सर्वश्रेष्ठ चित्र का पुरस्कार जीतने के बाद ओफ़िर अवॉर्ड्स, जो देश का ऑस्कर समकक्ष है, का वित्तपोषण रोकने की धमकी दी है।  यह फ़िल्म, जिसमें एक युवा फ़िलिस्तीनी लड़के की समुद्र देखने की यात्रा को दर्शाया गया है, ने कई अन्य प्रमुख पुरस्कार भी जीते, जिसमें इसके 13 वर्षीय स्टार को सर्वश्रेष्ठ अभिनेता का पुरस्कार भी शामिल है। ज़ोहर ने X पर पुरस्कार समारोह की निंदा करते हुए इसे इज़राइली समाज से "शर्मनाक और अलग" बताया और दावा किया कि यह इज़राइली सैनिकों का अपमान करता है।  हालांकि मंत्री के पास अवॉर्ड्स का वित्तपोषण रोकने का अधिकार स्पष्ट नहीं है, लेकिन उनका बयान संयुक्त राष्ट्र की एक जांच आयोग की रिपोर्ट के बाद आया है जिसमें इज़राइल पर गाजा में नरसंहार का आरोप लगाया गया है, एक आरोप जिसका इज़राइल ने कड़े शब्दों में खंडन किया है।  इसके विपरीत, "द सी" के समर्थक इसकी जीत को जारी संघर्ष की पृष्ठभूमि में एक शक्तिशाली बयान के रूप में देखते हैं।
meta_description: The Sea follows a boy from the occupied West Bank who wants to visit Tel Aviv to see the sea for the first time.

title_src: Banal and hollow': Why the quaint paintings of Thomas Kinkade divided the US
text_src: Kinkade's deprived upbringing, says Yousef, didn't just inspire his choice of subject matter, but drove him to make as much money as he could. He and his business partners printed pictures on an industrial scale, as well as putting his immediately recognisable imagery on furniture and ornaments, and selling them on the QVC shopping network. They also set up hundreds of faux olde worlde Thomas Kinkade Signature Galleries in shopping malls around the US, and trademarked the "Painter of Light" brand. Again, Yousef doesn't see Kinkade as entirely calculating. Having grown up in a house with no pictures on the walls, "He sincerely believed that art should be accessible to everyone." Behind the fantasy Whatever you thought of the paintings, the mass-marketing of the work of a single artist was certainly groundbreaking. In interviews at the time, Kinkade asserted that he was no different from an author selling stacks of novels or a musician selling CDs. He even declared that by industrialising his output, he was doing what Andy Warhol had always dreamt of. But Mullins argues that Kinkade was being "obfuscatory and disingenuous" by churning out reproductions by the thousand, paying his assistants to add a few dabs of paint here and there, and then selling these prints for thousands of dollars, as if they were rare and precious works of art. "Prints offer an affordable way of buying art by great artists," she says. "They retain their value through the limited nature of the edition. This was never Kinkade's strategy." The Kinkade Family Foundation Kinkade printed pictures and merchandise on an industrial scale and trademarked the "Painter of Light" brand (Credit: The Kinkade Family Foundation) Still, this sort of disagreement between Kinkade and his critics was one of his selling points. Art for Everybody features news reports and promotional videos, in which he tells adoring audiences that his art could be understood and appreciated by everyone, whereas only the snooty elite could see anything artistic about Chris Ofili putting elephant dung on his canvases, or Tracey Emin presenting her unmade bed to gallery-goers. "This is not legitimate art," he proclaimed. As much a televangelist as a painter, Kinkade was a born-again Christian who assured his devotees that buying his work put them on the right side of a political and spiritual line separating them from decadent metropolitan tastemakers. He trademarked the sobriquet "Painter of Light", not just because of all the sunlit clouds and fiery cottages in his pictures, but to signify that he was a force for virtue and Christianity. "The art world is a world of darkness today," he thundered. He, in contrast, was "someone who stands up for family and God and country and beauty". A doughy, plaid shirt-wearing fellow with a thick moustache, he often appeared on television with his blonde wife and his four blonde daughters: the embodiment of wholesome, traditional, all-American values. His fans weren't just paying for his pictures; they were paying to associate themselves with this proudly conservative persona. But that persona, like the pictures themselves, was more a fantasy that Kinkade wished for than an accurate representation of reality. He was prone to swearing after the directors of his mawkishvideos called "cut". He relied on alcohol to cope with work pressures. And, in the documentary, his daughters say that they were encouraged to smile in videos and personal appearances, but often felt as if their father cared more about his career than about them. "Thomas Kinkade and his persona and his brand really cast an extraordinarily long, dark shadow over his entire family," says Yousef, "and there was a lot wrapped up in perpetuating the brand and preserving it."
summary_src: Thomas Kinkade, the "Painter of Light," built a multi-million dollar empire by mass-producing his idyllic landscapes and aggressively marketing them through QVC and hundreds of franchised galleries.  While his daughter credits his impoverished upbringing for inspiring his accessible art, critics argue his industrial-scale production, employing assistants to finish paintings, compromised artistic integrity. Kinkade himself compared his approach to that of prolific authors and musicians, claiming to achieve Warhol's dream of industrialized art.  However, this mass production and the carefully cultivated image of a devout, family-oriented Christian conservative,  hid a more complex reality.  Behind the wholesome persona, Kinkade struggled with alcohol and a strained relationship with his family, who felt overshadowed by the demands of his brand.  This contrast between his public image and private life, along with the controversy surrounding his artistic methods, ultimately became a key part of his success story.
summary_tgt: "प्रकाश के चित्रकार" थॉमस किंकैड ने अपने रमणीय परिदृश्य चित्रों के बड़े पैमाने पर उत्पादन और QVC तथा सैकड़ों फ्रैंचाइज़ी गैलरियों के माध्यम से आक्रामक विपणन द्वारा करोड़ों डॉलर का साम्राज्य बनाया। उनकी बेटी उनके अभावग्रस्त बचपन को उनकी सुलभ कला के लिए प्रेरणा मानती है, जबकि आलोचक तर्क देते हैं कि सहायकों द्वारा चित्रों को पूरा करने के उनके औद्योगिक पैमाने पर उत्पादन ने कलात्मक अखंडता को समझौता किया। किंकैड ने खुद अपने तरीके की तुलना बहुउत्पादक लेखकों और संगीतकारों से की, दावा किया कि उन्होंने वारहोल के औद्योगिक कला के सपने को साकार किया।  हालांकि, इस बड़े पैमाने पर उत्पादन और एक धार्मिक, परिवार-केंद्रित ईसाई रूढ़िवादी की सावधानीपूर्वक बनाई गई छवि ने एक अधिक जटिल वास्तविकता को छुपाया।  अपने स्वाभिमानी व्यक्तित्व के पीछे, किंकैड शराब से जूझ रहे थे और उनके परिवार के साथ उनके रिश्ते तनावपूर्ण थे, जिन्हें अपने ब्रांड की मांगों से उपेक्षित महसूस हुआ।  उनकी सार्वजनिक छवि और निजी जीवन के बीच इस विपरीतता के साथ-साथ उनकी कलात्मक विधियों के इर्द-गिर्द विवाद अंततः उनकी सफलता की कहानी का एक प्रमुख हिस्सा बन गया।
meta_description: Beloved by many, despised by others, Thomas Kinkade's quaint rustic scenes and his wholesome image belied a dark and tortured story that contrasts with his 'sugary' artworks.

title_src: Federal Reserve cuts key US interest rate for first time this year
text_src: Accuracy of jobs data is 'good enough' for Fed decision making despite revisions, Powell says Before he finished speaking, Powell was asked about revisions to employment data recently released from the Bureau of Labor Statistics, which point to a weaker US jobs situation at the start of the year than previously thought. Powell says the revisions are primarily due to how the data is collected and the low response rate from employers to surveys from the bureau that compiles the data. This means that often the most reliable data is several weeks behind, he says. "We want higher response rates, and we need those to have less volatile data," he says, "And the way to get that is to make sure that the agencies that collect the data have sufficient resources to drive higher response rates. It's not a complicated problem, but that's what it takes." However, the monthly data they get is still "good enough for us to do our work," Powell says. The Fed boss is also asked if the central bank would have cut rates earlier had the jobs numbers correctly reflected the less abundant jobs situation previously. "You know, we have to live life looking through the windshield rather than the rear view mirror," he says. "All I can tell you is we see where we are now and we take appropriate action and we took that appropriate action today."
summary_src: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell defended the accuracy of US jobs data, stating that while recent revisions from the Bureau of Labor Statistics revealed a weaker-than-previously-reported jobs market early this year, the data remains "good enough" for the Fed's decision-making.  Powell attributed the revisions to low employer response rates in BLS surveys, resulting in delays and volatility. He advocated for increased resources for data collection agencies to improve response rates and data accuracy.  However, he emphasized that the Fed's actions are based on current assessments, not solely on retrospective data revisions.  The Fed, he said, "has to live life looking through the windshield rather than the rearview mirror."
summary_tgt: अमेरिकी रिजर्व के अध्यक्ष जेरोम पॉवेल ने अमेरिकी रोजगार आँकड़ों की सटीकता का बचाव किया है। उन्होंने कहा कि हालाँकि श्रम सांख्यिकी ब्यूरो (Bureau of Labor Statistics - BLS) के हालिया संशोधनों से इस साल की शुरुआत में रोजगार बाजार के पहले से बताए गए आँकड़ों से कमज़ोर होने का पता चला है, फिर भी ये आँकड़े फेड के निर्णय लेने के लिए "काफी अच्छे" हैं। पॉवेल ने इन संशोधनों के लिए BLS सर्वेक्षणों में नियोक्ताओं की कम प्रतिक्रिया दर को जिम्मेदार ठहराया, जिसके कारण देरी और अस्थिरता आई। उन्होंने डेटा संग्रह एजेंसियों के लिए अधिक संसाधन उपलब्ध कराने की वकालत की ताकि प्रतिक्रिया दर और डेटा की सटीकता में सुधार हो सके। हालाँकि, उन्होंने इस बात पर ज़ोर दिया कि फेड के कार्य वर्तमान आकलन पर आधारित हैं, न कि केवल पिछले आँकड़ों के संशोधनों पर। उन्होंने कहा कि फेड को "रियरव्यू मिरर के बजाय विंडशील्ड से देखते हुए जीवन जीना होगा।"
meta_description: Head of the central bank, Jerome Powell, has faced months of criticism from President Trump for not cutting rates faster.
